loans.name: Lion Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of Lion group. They are women with small-scale businesses who are based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Isatu S. who is age forty-five and was born in Sanda village. She is married with three children and her husband is a photographer. Her children are attending primary and secondary schools.

For five years now, Isatu has been selling rice and palm-oil. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying more rice and palm-oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy rice and palm-oil in large quantity to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada, actividad que realiza todos los días, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja mensualmente, Flora es viuda tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 1 vive con ella y estudia en la universidad.
Flora es socia del Banco Comunal Chaska Lucero y solicita un crédito de 2000 soles para la compra de pantalones.
Flora sueña con tener capital propio para ya no pedir prestamos.
texts.en:
Flora has a stand at the April 12th Market where she sells a variety of clothing. She engages in this business every day. Flora acquires products in the city of Lima where she travels on a monthly basis. She is a widow and has four children, one of whom lives with her and studies at the university.

Flora is a member of the Communal Bank “Chaska Lucero” and is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 PEN to buy trousers. She dreams of having her own capital so that she no longer has to ask for loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers

loans.name: Lyndie

texts.en:
Lyndie D. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Lyndie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale. Lyndie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Lyndie joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used as additional capital for her business. Lyndie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina S. is from the village of Brgy. Uddiawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 55 years old. Sabina is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Sabina makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Sabina has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2006, Sabina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sabina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Sabina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Sabina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Belinda Walkiria

texts.es: La señora Belinda Walkiria C. T. es comerciante del Mercado central tiene un negocio de venta de productos es soltera madre de dos hijos los que están en edad y por los que lucha fuertemente trabaja de lunes a domingo y este financiamiento lo solicito para comprar cosméticos para su negocio que casi no tenia en existencia, tiene cinco años de trabajar con nuestra institución en los cuales dichos créditos los ha invertido en su negocio y ha obtenido buenas utilidades las cuales las ha invertido en su casa y en su calidad de vida
texts.en: Mrs Belinda Walkiria C. T. is a merchant in the 'Mercado Central' (central market).  She has a sales business.  She is a single mother to two children for whom she struggles really hard.  She works from Monday to Sunday and the loan which she is requesting will be used to buy cosmetics for her business as she has virtually none left.  She has been working with our organization for five years and has used her loans to invest in her business.  She has obtained good profits which she has invested in her house and in raising her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, toys and clothes

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan lives in a 2-room brick house with her family in an area called Shamsabad, which is a housing colony in Mian Channu. Mian Channu is a small city of Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. 

Bashiraan is a widow and lives with her two sons. After the death of her husband, her sons left their education as they had to work to financially support the family. Her elder son sells fish while her younger son paints houses and buildings on contract. 

Bashiraan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her elder son in his business. With the loan, he will buy fish of different kinds to sell. He started this business two years ago and Bashiraan is hopeful that her son will be able to increase his sales by having a good quantity of fish in stock. 

Bashiran wants to have him get married because he is 25 years old. She is hopeful that she will be able to do it very soon with the help of increased profits due to the loan. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. She is a responsible client and always paid her installments on time in previous loan years.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fish to sell

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

She has operated a dumpling sale business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she sells fresh water which contributes to her other source of income. Kibibi faces a major challenge of seasonality and fluctuation of prices of commodities in the market. She hopes to establish a big retail shop in the future. 

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase water pipes for her fresh water selling business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase water pipes for her fresh water sale business

loans.name: Darlison

texts.en:
Darlison is 32 years old and single, with four children ages 2 to 16. She has no other dependents, and she lives in a family of five people. Darlison owns her home, and her family goal is to educate her children. 
She sells secondhand clothes and has been doing it for one year now. She started by selling produce; she saved her income and started the secondhand clothes business. She faces the challenge of clothing going out of fashion and also fading if it stays in stock for long. In the future she hopes to transform her business into a wholesale business. She wants the loan to buy more secondhand clothes to add to her stock.

loans.use: Purchase of Second Hand Clothing.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 33-year-old man from Palestine and a father of one son and one daughter, Omar has started a studio one and a half year ago, Omar is still working on equipping the studio, which is located in a good location in the city center.

Omar came to FATEN and took a loan to purchase a still camera, as now he is having two photography rooms equipped and he needed a second camera. Omar's work is prospering steadily and he has become well known for his good work and punctuality.

Omar appears in the picture here in his studio.

loans.use: To purchase a still camera

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old, married, and supports her family by operating two ventures, a furniture-making enterprise and a food vending business. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental.

Elizabeth has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her furniture-making and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

For this loan, Elizabeth is borrowing 15,000 PHP so she can purchase more materials and inventory. This will be her ninth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Elizabeth aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to perhaps achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more materials and inventory for furniture-making and food vending businesses

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “YANAPAKUY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Edwin; el tiene 29 años de edad y es soltero; el socio es biólogo de profesión el trabaja en un laboratorio particular lleva ya un buen tiempo en este trabajo del cual le trae muchas satisfacciones ya que está realizando las cosas que le gustan, el socio es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante, el socio está ahorrando ya que le gustaría poder  invertir en algún negocio o de repente en su maestría.

El socio solicita el préstamo para ahorrar y para utilizarlo en gastos menores para su uso como comida, pasajes entre otros más.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Yanapakuy". The bank is located in the district of Cusco, it belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

The member is Edwin, he is 29 years old and is single. He is a biologist by profession and works in a private laboratory. He has been doing this work for some time and it brings him much satisfaction since he is doing things that he likes. He is a very happy person and very eager to get ahead. He has been saving since he would like to invest in a business or in a master's degree. 

He is requesting this loan to save and to use it for minor expenses such as food and travel expenses among others. 

He is happy for this loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: To save and to use for minor expenses such as food and travel expenses.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors. Gladys' major challenge is the high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber, iron bars, and shoe soles.

loans.name: María José

texts.es:
La Señorita María José T. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres en Progreso, vive en la parroquia de Baños, esta parroquia es muy turística gracias a sus aguas termales, su gastronomía es muy variada cautivando el paladar de propios y extraños.
 
La Señorita. María José tiene 22 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su papa es chofer profesional, su mamá es costurera y tienen casa propia.

Nuestra socia estudia Turismo y se encuentra cursando en el último año, también ha empezado a trabajar en un instituto en la venta de matriculas para estudiar Ingles.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en los gastos de sus estudios. Su sueño es viajar a distintos lugares del mundo.
texts.en:
María José T. is a member of the “Mujeres en Progreso” communal bank. She lives in the parish of Baños. This is a very touristic parish because of its hot springs and a variety of cuisine that captivates both locals and visitors. 

María José is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Her father is a professional driver and her mother is a seamstress. They live in their own house.

María José is studying tourism and she is in her last year. She has also begun working at an institute where she works in sales to register people for English classes. 

She is in her second loan with the communal bank. She will invest the money from the loan in her education. Her dream is to travel to many different places in the world.

loans.use: to pay for education expenses

loans.name: Mawimbi Group

texts.en:
Pandu H., who is in his early sixties, is married with four children and twelve grandchildren (in the picture, Pandu is the only man and is in front). He sells coffee and water outside his house. He has been in business for 25 years. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Pandu's fourth “motisha” loan fron Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania which allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. He has paid back his previous loans successfully. He hopes to obtain a loan to finish building his house in Zanzibar, an island off Tanzania.

Pandu will share this loan with his loan group, Mawimbi, which has a total of fourteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To continue building his house

loans.name: Ann Wachuka

texts.en:
Ann Wachuka E. L. is 50 years old. She is married and a mother of five children. She has been a wheat farmer for the past 11 years with a monthly income of KES 13,000.

She learned about KADET LTD through a KADET staff in her place of habitat. She has applied for her third loan which she intends to use to buy wheat seed and fertilizer. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to large scale and, also to buy a few goats for fattening.

She dreams of educating her children to a higher level of education. She is a thorough woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy wheat seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Marily Nalleli

texts.es:
La señorita Marily Nallely es una mujer muy responsable que aun vive en la casa de sus padres los cuales apoya económicamente con los gastos de hogar.
La casa donde la familia vive la adquirieron de interés social la cual es muy pequeña, y no le permite a esta joven tener su propio espacio, por lo que se ve en la necesidad de ayudar a su padre con la construcción de su propia recamara. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra y de esta manera le permitirá tener su privacidad.
texts.en: Marily Nallely is a very responsible woman who still lives in her parents’ house; she helps them financially with the household expenses.  The family lives in social welfare housing.  The house is very small, and doesn’t allow this youngster to have her own space.  Therefore, she finds herself needing to help her father build her a bedroom.  In order to carry out this project, she needs to buy construction materials and pay for manual labor.  This addition would permit her to have privacy.

loans.use: buy construction materials and pay for manual labor to add a bedroom.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La señora Sandra es socia del banco comunal Las Dalilas del Distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos
Son 8 años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica al servicio de turismo, tiene una agencia de viajes y trabaja junto con su esposo.
Con su nuevo préstamo de s/. 3,000.00 se comprará un paquete de viaje a la ciudad de México para viajar junto a su esposo, viaje necesario para poder relajarse y también hacer algunos contactos de negocios en ese  país, más que todo conocer para que de esa manera puedan recomendar a sus clientes sobre esos paquetes de viaje.
Este es un negocio rentable para su familia, sus hijos estudian en buenos colegios y no les falta nada, tiene todo lo que los niños necesitan.
texts.en: Señora Sandra is an associate of the Delilahs of the District of Yarinacocha communal bank, department of Ucayali.  She is 37 years of age, married and she has two children.  She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for 8 years.  She is dedicated to the service of tourism. She has a travel agency and works along with her husband.  With this new loan of  3,000 soles, a package trip to Mexico City will be bought to travel with her  husband.  It is a necessary trip to be able relax and also to make some business contacts in that country.  Most of all to become familiar with the trip so that they can recommend the trip package to their clients.  This is a profitable business for her family.   Her children study in good schools and lack for nothing.  She has everything that the children need.

loans.use: to buy a trip package for her travel business.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa es madre de familia de  30 años de edad con un hijo, vive en casa de sus padres,la cual no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en Chacupe bajo que pertenece al distrito de la Victoria.  Este distrito desarrolla la actividad agrícola, comercialización de aves de corral y artesanía (elaboración de sombreros).

La actividad a la que se dedica Rosa desde hace 4 años es la elaboración de sombreros de palma que lo aprendio desde muy pequeña, este trabajo lo realiza con mucho gusto ya que que a pasado de generación en generación en su familia.  También  cuenta en su domidilio con una pequeña tienda donde tiene galletas, frugos y golosinas, lo que le permite tener ingresos para poder cubrir sus necesidades diarias.

El préstamo que a solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de materia prima (palma) para la elaboración de sus sombreros, los cuales son de muy buena calidad, por eso tiene clientes satisfechos y así obtiene mayores ganancias.  Rosa es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo y responsable con sus clientes, con el objetivo de sacar adelante a su única hija.
texts.en:
Rosa is the mother of a family, 30 years old, and she has one child. She lives at home with her parents. Their house is not equipped with any of the basic services and it is located in Chacupe Bajo, belonging to the district of La Victoria. This district undertakes agricultural activities, poultry sales, and crafts (sombrero making). 

Rosa has undertaken her business activity for the past four years and it is the crafting of straw sombreros, a trade she learned when she was very young. She enjoys her work especially because it has been passed on from generation to generation in her family. She also has a small store in her house where she sells cookies, fruit juices, and sweets and it permits her to have an income to provide for her daily needs.

The loan when she requests from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) is of 500 nuevos soles and it will be used to purchase materials (straw) to make sombreros. They are of very high quality and so her clients are satisfied and she obtains greater earnings. Rosa is a person who is very dedicated to her work and she is responsible with her clients. Her objective is to provide for her only daughter.

loans.use: to purchase materials (straw) to make hats.

loans.name: Batzul

texts.en:
Batzul is 29 years old and lives with his wife and three children, ages 2 to 11, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, in his workplace’s yard. His oldest son is 11 years old and goes to primary school, while his wife, Uyanga, stays at home with their younger two children. 

Batzul worked as a woodworker at a local timber company from 2006 to 2010. He supports his family by operating his carpentry business. He started his business in 2010. Now he usually makes a ger (a Mongolian housing tent) to sell to a retailer. In the past year, he has established a continuous supply. 

Batzul is an honest and hardworking person. He plans to make a big, carved ger and then he wants to exhibit this ger. He is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more wood to make a big and carved ger.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to make a big and carved ger (Mongolian tent).

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 64 years old and lives in Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is married with two children. 

To earn a living, she operates a restaurant business. She earns about $125 each month doing this type of work. Felicidad has requested a loan to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant.

location.town: Liloy-Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: She will use the loan for her business expansion, paying the school fees of her children and building a new house. she have 4 children 2 are schooling and she is marriage

loans.use: Grandnut,maze buy & Sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and bundles of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Kerlys Elianny

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Junio.

En este lugar vive la señora Kerlys, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  14 meses de edad y actualmente está en su 7 mes de embarazo de su segundo hijo. Su esposo es militar. 

Nuestra amiga e dedica a la venta productos Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) y ropa por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella aprovecha sus momentos libres y cuando está desocupada para realizar sus ventas las cuales deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, dice que le encanta vender, lleva en este negocio 4 años y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  tres ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que dan.

Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The June 5th Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Portoviejo, which has been called the City of “Los Reales Tamarindos” since colonial times.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Kerlys. She is 30 years old, married, and has a 14-month-old son. Kerlys is now in her seventh month of pregnancy with her second child. Her husband is in the military.

Kerlys sells products manufactured by Avon and Yanbal, such as beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories. She also sells clothing through catalogs. Her sales are conducted by going door-to-door. Kerlys takes advantage of her free time and any moment when she is not busy to make sales. She extends credit to her customers and collects payment on a weekly basis. Kerlys says she enjoys selling and has done very well in the four years she has been in business.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, crèmes, and all types of clothing. She has been with the Communal Bank for three loan cycles and enjoys the assistance that has been given to her. Her dream is to move forward in her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, crèmes, and all types of clothing.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children. Both of her children are currently in school.  Rose has a wholesale shop that sells soft drinks, which she has had for five years.    

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sodas and beer for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business.  Rose is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase sodas and beer for resale.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Cirila has been running a fire wood shop for 5 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy fire wood for resale.
Cirila has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Cirila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fire wood for sale

loans.name: Francia Elena

texts.es: Francia tiene su actividad que es una pulpería. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a su vivienda a buscar los diferentes víveres que necesita. Ella tiene 3 años con este negocio, por lo que ha podido obtener una gran experiencia  al brindarles lo que ellos necesitan. El motivo del crédito que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, pan, galletas, cremas, leche, fósforos, sopas y enlatados.
texts.en:
Francia owns a general store.  The majority of her customers come to her home to look for different foodstuffs that they need. She's had her business for 3 years, and has gained a lot of experience in providing them with what they need. 

The reason she is applying for a loan is to buy bulk grains, bread, cookies, creams, milk, matches, soups and canned goods.

loans.use: To buy bulk grains, detergents, bread, cookies, creams, milk, matches, soups, and canned goods.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Анвар житель Яванского района. Ему 23 года. Он холост. Живет вместе с родителями. Он предоставляет услугу, занимается монтажом и дизайном видеокассет и дисков. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения видеокамеры.
texts.en: Anvar lives in the Yavan district.  He is 23 years old, single.  He lives together with his parents.  Anvar provides a service of video editing and design of video cassette and disks.  He has been in this business for five years.  Anvar is requesting this loan for the purchase of a video camera.

loans.use: to buy a video camera

loans.name: Cristino José

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce, departamento de León, el señor Cristino José. Se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy dedicada al trabajo debido a que ha sabido llevar el bienestar a su casa y su familia y ha logrado mantener su hogar que tanto ama y estima.

Cristino se caracteriza por ser un excelente trabajador y con buenos valores inculcados el cuál ha logrado ganar el aprecio de muchas personas de su municipio. 

 Actual mente ha acudido a Ceprodel  con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, para ello está solicitando el crédito, para la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como cemento y arena ya que con esto mejorará las condiciones de dicha vivienda.
texts.en:
Cristino José has stood out in the town of El Sauce, León Department, for being a person who is very dedicated to work because he’s known how to provide wellbeing for his home and family and he’s managed to support his home that he so loves and esteems. Cristino is an excellent worker with good inherent values that have earned him the esteem of many people in his town.

He has called upon Ceprodel to request a home improvement loan and this is why he’s asking for the loan: to buy building materials and supplies, like cement and sand, to carry out the home improvements.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand.

loans.name: Olga Luz

texts.es:
La señora Olga es socia del banco comunal Las almendras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 35 años de edad, tres hijos, está casada y su esposo se desempeña como operador de maquinas pesadas.
Lleva trabajando cuatro años con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de mercaderías de uso personal, todo lo que son ropas, zapatos y carteras, negocio que viene realizando desde hace tiempo y que le da buenas ganancias.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: 6 pares de zapatos, 1 docena de camisas, 2 docenas de polos, 1 docena de pantalones, ½ docena de shores.
No es mucho lo que invierte solo trabaja con pedidos para traer la mercadería y entregarla inmediatamente, su hija mayor le ayuda a colocar/vender su mercadería.
Está muy contenta por que ahora tiene un negocio propio y se pone horarios para salir a realizar su cobranza y para atender su hogar.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the communal bank Las Almendras in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 35 years old, has three children, and is married. Her husband works as a heavy machine operator.

She has been getting loans through Manuela Ramos for four years and works selling personal goods such as all types of clothing, shoes and handbags. Her business has been growing over time and is at present making good profits.

With this new loan of 2,000 soles she will buy 6 pairs of shoes, 1 dozen blouses, 2 dozen sport shirts, 1 dozen pair of pants, and 6 pairs of shorts.

It is not much of a risk because she buys and then immediately delivers, since she only takes orders. Her oldest daughter helps her find and sell the merchandise.

She is very happy because now she has her own business and she sets her hours working her own schedule and is able to take care of her house.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes for resale

loans.name: San Andres Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN ANDRES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Está compuesta por seis integrantes dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora  Asunta.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: confección de busos, compra y venta de fierro, tienda de barrio, venta de chompas, venta de carne.
 
La señora Asunta indica que hace doce años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una compañera. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideo, aceite, azúcar, etc.) que compra de la Ceja y posteriormente  lo comercializará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y ahorros.
texts.en:
The “SAN ANDRES” community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional office.  The bank has six members and is run by a board of directors which is headed by Asunta.  The businesses that the ladies are engaged in are varied and include: making tracksuits, buying and selling iron, running a neighborhood store, selling sweaters and selling meat.  

Asunta tells us that she has been a member of a Pro Mujer community bank for twelve years.  She joined through an invitation from a friend.  She currently has a neighborhood store where she has been working for years.  

Asunta will use this loan to increase her capital (buying noodles, oil, sugar, etc.)  She will buy her products in La Ceja and then sell them from her sales premises.  This work allows her to make the money she needs to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Asunta replied taht she likes the training and the savings.

loans.use: to buy noodles, oil, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 42-year-old man. He has four children with ages ranging from 1 year to 6 years. He describes himself to be religious and God fearing. He operates a grocery store, where he sells vegetables. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a shopping center. He describes his biggest business challenges to be insufficient funds and low sales. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy vegetables. His business goal is to grow into wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will diversify and open a general store.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old. She is married and has one child.

Vilma is in the agricultural business. She raises pigs in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vilma has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Berto

texts.en:
Berto is a hardworking father who raises his family in a village. He cultivates their farm lots buy planting vegetables and root crops. He also engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. He wants to increase his income so he can continue to send his seven children to school. He plans to expand his vegetable plantation to increase his yield and income.

In this regard, Berto is asking for additional capital of PHP 23,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for vegetable production. He believes that through patience and hard work, he will improve his status of living and give his children a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for vegetable production.

location.town: Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman with three children. She is 48 years old and resides at Sumalig, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, the Philippines. 

Leonila runs a fishing business, harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community. She has been in this business for ten years. Each month she earns PHP 10,000 from her business. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional fish to raise and sell in the future. Leonila has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Leonila wants to purchased another pump boat to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise and sell.

loans.name: Darkhantuya

texts.en:
Darkhantuya, 45 sells childrens' clothes in the supermarket called “Tumen Plaza” which is located in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her husband and her son in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar. 

She has been running her business since last year and her daily sales volume has increased. Darkhantuya plans to expand her business through increasing the working capital. Initially she needs to purchase the new styles of, and large numbers of, kid's clothes from her supplier. It is beneficial for her business future and her family’s income. The loan she is taking will be used to purchase the kid's clothes for expanding her business working capital.

loans.use: to purchase childrens' clothes for expanding her business working capital.

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Benkadi 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Sirakele, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec Aicha,  première personne à droite  sur la photo avec son enfant.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 180.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants, de petits matériels agricoles et  de semence

loans.name: Bemilda Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Bemilda de la edad de 63 años, se divorcio de su esposo con quien había compartido la mayor parte de su vida, tiene 5 hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes quienes la apoyan en todo, continua siempre con su negocio de cafetín ubicado en uno de los mercados más populares de Managua desde hace 20 años, con los créditos obtenidos ha ido invirtiendo en su pequeña dependencia, este préstamo lo utilizara para comprar gaseosas, frutas variadas, jugos enlatados, reposterías, café por libra todo esto para dar una mejor atención, sus planes es seguir invirtiendo por medio de financiamientos.
texts.en: Bemilda is 63 years old and divorced from her husband, with whom she spent most of her life. She has five adult children, who are all independent and give her a lot of support. She continues running the snack stand that she has had for 20 years, and which is located in one of the most popular markets of Managua. With the loans she has obtained she has been able to invest in her small business, and she will use this loan to buy sodas, a variety of fruits, canned juices, baked goods, and coffee by the pound in order to offer a better service. Her plan is to continue investing in her business through financing.

loans.use: to buy sodas, a variety of fruits, canned juices, baked goods, and coffee by the pound among other items.

loans.name: Bernadeta

texts.en: Bernadeta is married and has two children.She lives in Yombo area of Dar es Salaam.Bernadeta sells fried fish near her residence.She collects fresh fish from Indian Ocean shores,spice and fry them ready for sale.She want to make her  business attractive by improving sanitary conditions of her business premises.Te display cage and aluminium wrapping materials will even make her business attractive.This will anable her make more sale and thus more profit.Next year her first born will join secondary school.The increased income will enable her save for school fees.To implement her plan she needs USD 550.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Akoua

texts.en:
Ms. Akoua S. was born August 16, 1962 in Akoumapé in the Vo prefecture. She is a married mother of two who also takes care of two other people. Her retired husband earns a very small pension and can no longer assume financial responsibility for his family. She is a seamstress by trade who fights to meet her family's needs with the little money she earns. Despite her miserable condition, she has never backed down from her responsibilities. To help continue doing so, she would like to buy a new sewing machine and begin selling traditional African cloth and other products in order to diversify her sources of income. As she does not have the means to buy these items, she is requesting a loan of $800. She needs help in achieving her goals in order to meet her family's needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Akoua est née le 16 août 1962 à Akoumapé dans la préfecture de VO. Mariée, elle est mère de deux (2) enfants avec deux personnes en charge. Son mari retraité qui perçoit difficilement ses pensions, n’arrive plus à assumer financièrement ses responsabilités. Couturière de profession, elle se bat pour satisfaire la famille avec le peu qu’elle gagne. Malgré cette condition de vie très misérable, elle n’a jamais reculé devant ses responsabilité. Ainsi, pour mieux accomplir cette mission, elle voudrait acheter une nouvelle machine pour renforcer sa couture et ajouter à ce métier la vente de tissus pagnes et autres produits dans le but de diversifier ses sources de revenu. N'ayant pas les moyens pour réaliser ce projet, elle vient solliciter un crédit de $800. Pour l’épanouissement de sa famille, elle a besoin de soutien pour atteindre son objectif.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and sell traditional cloth

loans.name: Roshel

texts.en: Roshel is married with four children all in primary school.  She is a primary school drop out and hasn’t undergone any formal training. She started her business in 1990 in order to sustain her family as her husband is not employed. First she started in a small canteen and with time it developed into a shop. This is her second loan with PEMCI; the first loan enabled her to increase her stock and also enabled her to start a food store next to her shop. With a second loan from PEMCI, she intends to increase her food store stock. Through her business, she has been able to support her family and educate her children.

loans.use: Roshel would like to increase her stock for her mini shop.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Hortencia is a very hard working and enthusiastic woman. She is married and her husband does seasonal agricultural work. It was therefore difficult to meet their household costs. Hortencia therefore started her own business selling perfumes house to house. In this way she has been able to help her husband cover their costs. Her love of sales and her character has made it easy for her to relate to people and her business has grown.

In order to meet her clients’ needs, Hortencia is asking for a loan of $375 which she will use to buy merchandise. She will repay this amount over a period of 5 months. You can be a part of the growth of this business and help to improve the living conditions of this family. Don’t think twice, they will thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Hortencia es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, ella es casada, su esposo es albañil y realiza trabajos sólo por temporadas por lo que en ocasiones era muy difícil cubrir las deudas del hogar, como Hortencia es una mujer emprendedora inició su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes, también realiza ventas de perfumes casa por casa, de esta manera es como apoya a su esposo con las obligaciones de su hogar. Su gusto por las ventas y su carácter que le facilita relacionarse con las demás personas le ha ayudado a hacer crecer su negocio.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes Hortencia está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 5 meses. Tú puedes ser parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayudar a mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta familia, no lo pienses más, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 26 and unmarried. She embroiders napkins, tablecloths and blouses which she sells to intermediaries for resale in tourist centers of Chiapas. She is a member of the Cruz 3 cooperative along with Maria A. Pérez and Maria Pérez Pérez. Together, they will use this loan to buy thread in bulk.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

MARIA. Tiene 26 años, soltera se dedica a la artesanía bordando servilletas, manteles, chales, blusas, las cuales vende entre las personas de su ciudad quienes posteriormente las llevan a comercializar a los centros turísticos de la zona. Forma parte del grupo Cruz 3 junto con doña Maria A. Pérez (artesana) y Maria Pérez Pérez( artesana ) Con sus préstamo invertirán ambas comprando hilos al por mayor .

loans.use: To buy thread for embroidery in bulk.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Today a widow, S. Marie was born in 1971 in Benin. She currently lives with her three children in Lome, in the neighborhood Tokoin Lycee. She is a retailer of basic goods and necessities though she also has a general grocery store. A single mother, she is the sole provider for her children, but because their needs take priority, she often lacks the funds necessary to stock and supply her grocery store, which means she sometimes loses customers. She is asking for a loan of $400 to expand her business. With the loan, she will stock her store with sacks of rice, oil and other goods, because it will soon be time for the end-of-the-year festivals. This will allow her to increase her earnings, directly profiting her children and giving them a better future.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Veuve S. Marie est née en 1971 au Bénin. Elle vie actuellement à Lomé dans le quartier Tokoin Lycée avec ses trois (3) enfants. Elle est revendeuse des produits de premières nécessités et a également une boutique d’alimentation générale. Seule devant la charge des enfants elle souvent en manque de fonds de commerce pour alimenter sa boutique ce qui fait qu’elle perd à petit coup sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $400 pour agrandir la taille de son commerce. S’approvisionner en sacs de riz, d’huile et autres car c’est bientôt les fêtes de fin d’année. Ceci augmentera son revenu en vue d’un meilleur devenu de ses enfants.

loans.use: Supplying/stocking Her Grocery Store

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose O. is 36 years old, a mother of 4,  and comes from Mushin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She produces body cream, powder and detergent. She has been  with LAPO as a secretary for 3 years. Bose has been in her business since the year 2002 and needs the loan to buy materials for her products.

loans.use: To buy materials for her products

loans.name: Andina

texts.en:
Andina is a forty-two year old mother of three school-going children (two girls and a boy).  Her husband is an electrician and works for a construction company installing wires for electrical systems.
A few months ago, Andina started a business of running a small grocery store.  As she didn’t have access to capital, she was obliged to use a room of her house to operate the store.  She is still running the grocery store within her house but hopes that before long she will have a big and comfortable space where people can go to make purchases easily.
Andina explains that the competition in her community is very strong.  Nevertheless, she believes she can attract a lot of customers and her store keeps on growing.
With this loan (the second she will take from FSMA), she plans on adding new goods to her inventory in order to better satisfy her customers’ needs.  Andina’s business supports her children's school tuition and helps to pay for the rental of the house.

loans.use: to replenish a small grocery store

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbozi, Tanzania! This is 35 year old Christina K.. She is married with two children, aged 13 and 8. In 1997, Christina established a crop selling business, and now requires a loan in order to purchase an additional stock of crops. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed ‘un-creditworthy’ by financial institutions due to a lack of tangible collateral assets. Poor financial support results in poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a ‘sale and leaseback arrangement’.

loans.use: To purchase additional an stock of crops

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
My name is Nasreen B. and I am a group leader of three other women. I have eight children; four boys and four girls. My husband is sick and cannot work. I operate a cycle rental from my home and currently own five cycles for this purpose. I want to purchase additional cycles so that my income can rise. I have invested two previous loans into my business. The additional profits enabled me to marry one of my daughters this past year and purchase a refrigerator for my house.

The other group members would use the loan as follows: Razia B. is borrowing for her husband’s CD and mobile phones business. Parween’s son wants to buy cardboard. Shazia will invest her share of the loan in her husband’s grocery store.

loans.use: Purchase bicycles

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina, in partnership with her beloved sister, has stood out for her great work in a small cosmetology center. With much diligence and despite her economic limitations, little by little her small salon has grown in a shopping mall in the city of Juliaca, thanks to the excellent services that she offers, with the agility and skill that have always characterized her rapid increase in her customer base, thus increasing her income. In this opportunity to provide greater comfort to her customers, Florentina plans to expand her salon, with the goal of improving the presentation of her area and above all her services. With this proposal she humbly asks you for a loan to invest in her profitable business.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C. Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Florentina, en compañía de su querida hermana ha destacado por su gran trabajo en su pequeño centro de cosmetología.Con mucho empeño y a pesar de sus limitaciones económicas poco a poco ha ido implementando su pequeño salón en un centro comercial de la ciudad de Juliaca, gracias a los excelentes servicios que presta con la agilidad y la habilidad que la han caracterizado siempre está logrando incrementar rápidamente su cartera de clientes y por ende mejorando sus ingresos económicos.En esta oportunidad para otorgarle mayor comodidad a sus clientes Florentina tiene pensado implementar y ampliar su salón, con el fin de mejorar la presentación de su local y sobre todo sus servicios.Con este propósito recurre humildemente a ti persona para solicitarte un préstamo que invertirá en su rentable negocio.

loans.use: Increase in capital to improve the facilities of her beauty salon

loans.name: Isturah

texts.id:
Ms. Isturah profession is a Food chips seller. Every day, Isturah has to go to the market at 06:00 AM to buy ingredients to make chips like flour, peanuts and chicken intestines. Usually she bought abaut 8 kgs (17.2 lbs) for Rp7000 (about 90 US cents)/kg. Afterwards with Mohammad Najib, her husband's help, Isturah fried those chips, and after being packed offered to food stalls and cantines around her home in Kartini street, Denpasar. Profit drom this chip sales are used to pay for children's schooling, and also for family expenses. Isturah hopes she could get this help to increase business capital

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Profesi yang dijalani Ibu Isturah sekarang ini adalah sebagai penjual krupuk. Setiap hari, Isturah sudah harus ke pasar pukul 06.00 pagi untuk membeli bahan-bahan untuk membuat krupuk berupa tepung, kacang dan usus ayam. Biasanya dia membeli sebanyak 8 kg dengan per kg Rp.7.000.- Setelah itu, dibantu oleh suaminya Mohammad Najib, Isturah menggoreng krupuk tersebut dan setelah jadi kemudian dibungkus lalu diedarkan warung-warung dan kantin-kantin yang ada disekitar tempat tinggalnya di Jl.Kartini Denpasar. Keuntungan yang didapat dari berjualan krupuk dipaki sebagai biaya menyekolahkan anaknya dan juga mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga. Isturah sangat berharap mendapatkan bantuan sebagai tambahan modal usaha.

loans.use: Business capital (Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir N.  is a 27-year-old young man who keeps a shop where he sells marriage portions for brides. He has nine years of experience in this field. He lives with his family in the southern region of Azerbaijan, Sabirabad. He applied for 800 USD to purchase a first supply of wedding dresses. The estimated cost for one wedding dress is 200 USD. Samir says he would like to start with a few dresses, but from the money he earns he will purchase more and expand his business.

loans.use: Expand his business by purchasing wedding dresses

loans.name: Thi Tu

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tu Thi D. is 33 years old. Everyday, she buys crackers and breads in her neighborhood and goes to sell it in adjacent towns. Her husband works in construction. The family’s income is about 200,000 VND per week. She has three children who are in school. She is requesting 2,006,000 VND to use as capital for her business. She would like to participate in the program for a long time and increase the loan amount slowly.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị Tú (MS: 020022), năm nay 33 tuổi. Hàng ngày chị đi mua bánh đa bánh, bánh mỳ của các hộ trong thôn đi giao bán ở các địa phương khác. Chồng chị làm nghề xây dựng. Thu nhập gia đình chị khoảng 200.000 VND/ tuần. Chị có ba con còn nhỏ hiện đang đi học. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn đi chợ. Chị thích được tham gia chương trình lâu dài và được vay vốn tăng dần lên.

loans.use: Capital for business

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
Rocío is a hard-working woman who for many years has been dedicated to selling cosmetics and various knick knacks, depending on the occasion. However, for the most part, she is dedicated to the sale of groceries, which she distributes among her neighbors and friends. So far, she is doing well but her wish is to get ahead and her goal is to have a minimarket in the future. In the meantime, she continues to work so that she may provide her small, seven year old daughter everything that she deserves. At this time, Rocío wishes to increase her working capital for which she is requesting a loan of 1,300 soles which she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Rocío es una mujer de mucho empeño, se ha dedicado durante varios años a la venta de cosméticos, de productos variados de acuerdo a la ocasión y también a la costura, pero en mayor medida a la venta de abarrotes que distribuye a sus vecinos y amistades, hasta el momento le va muy bien y su deseo es seguir adelante, con la meta de tener un minimarket en el futuro, mientras tanto seguirán trabajando para darle a su pequeña de 7 años todo lo que se merece.En esta ocasión Rocío desea incrementar su capital de trabajo, para lo cual está solicitando un préstamo de 1300 soles que invertirá en la compra de más mercadería.

loans.use: Increase merchandise for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda O. sells sachets of water, drinks, and provisions such as milk, sugar, eggs, and tomato paste. She has been in this business since the year 2002. Linda is 31 years old and married with three children. She is a LAPO client. Linda lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of $425 to buy more provisions and drinks to sell. Linda says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Rocio Monica

texts.es:
Rocio tiene 25 años de edad, estudió en el Superior Pedagógico, es soltera y es la mayor de 04 hermanos menores. Vive en el Centro Poblado de Acari, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.  

Rocio integra el Banco Comunal “Fe y Alegría” en Yunguyo. Con su primer crédito de S/.300 aumentó su capital y compró 01 torete con S/.1,200. desde los 18 años de edad se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno 

Con este crédito de S/.1,200 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprará 01 cabeza de ganado vacuno en la feria de Ilave para comercializarlo en la feria de Yunguyo.

Su meta es invertir más capital en ganado vacuno, tener 05 o 06 cabezas de ganado vacuno mejorado. Con su capital acumulado piensa comprar una casa en la ciudad de Lima y apoyar a sus hermanos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rocio is 25 years old. She went to school at Superior Pedagogico. She is single and she is the eldest of 4, all of whom are still minors. They live in the Centro Poblado in the city of Acari, within the district and province of Yunguyo, Puno.

Rocio is a member of the community bank "Fe y Alegria" in Yunguyo. With her first loan, amounting to S/.300, she replenished her capital savings and she purchased a calf, costing S/.1200. Since she was 18 years old she has been purchasing and sellling cattle.

With this loan, amounting to S/.1200 Nuevos Soles, repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase a head of cattle at the Ilave fair and she plans to resell it at the Yunguyo fair.

Her goal is to invest more capital and expand her herd, to have 5 or 6 head of cattle. With her accumulated capital she hopes to purchase her own home in the city of Lima and she wants to support her younger siblings so that they may grow up to be professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a head of cattle.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is a businessman from Nikopol. His business, selling clothing items, was started 2 years ago. One of the biggest attractions of his venture is affordable prices, which helps Andrei keep a favorable position among all the other clothes vendors who are his competitors.

Andrei has about $4,000 invested in his business. However, he looks into the future and sees wider horizons for development. One more thing that should be mentioned about this client is his impeccable credit history in Nadiya Ukraine. He hasn’t had a single late payment ever since he started using financial assistance from Nadiya Ukraine. Andrei is a true high achiever. We believe the current loan of 5800 Grivnas will help him move one step closer to his dream of becoming a leading and prosperous businessman in this sphere of trade.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Нормухамедова Мавджуда жительница города Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 28 лет . Имеет двоих детей. Уже 15 лет занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке  города Курган-тюбе. Продает детскую одежду. Решила получить кредит для того, чтобы завезти сезонную одежду.Товар привозит из города Душанбе. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mavjuda N. lives in the city of Kurgan-Tube. She is 28 years old and has two children. For 15 years she has been working in sales. She has a stall in the Kurgan-Tube city market, where she sells children's clothing. She decided to use a loan to stock clothes for this season. The goods are brought in from Dushanbe. The loan will be repaid over 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita and her family live in the small village of Sitio Guingab. “Sitio” means an extended small group of houses within kilometers but still covered by a large but typical Barangay. She is 54 years old and married to a simple upland farmer and they are blessed with 11 children. Most of their children are high school and college undergraduates and two of them are still studying and already in their high school level.

She has managed a small village store for 15 years. She is thankful that she can earn at least PHP 2,500 gross income a week which they utilize to sustain their daily needs such as food, school allowance for their children and as rolling capital for her store. Teresita wants to make her business grow so she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00. This amount will serve as her capital to purchase additional stocks for her store so she can meet the demands of her customers. “We all help each other to improve our lives and we are hoping that our two children will pursue their studies hard and hopefully earn a college degree”, Teresita said.

loans.use: Teresita would like to purchase additional stocks for her store.

location.town: Sitio Guingab, Masipi East Cabagan, Isabela

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky K. is currently in the business of selling onions, tomatoes and other products at a market. She is requesting a loan to expand her business. Vicky is 26 years old and a widow. She has 2 children who go to school, and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business and continue her children's education.

loans.use: pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima K. sells cereals and other groceries at Mnyamani ward at Buguruni in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She purchases the items from the Kariakoo city market and Buguruni market. Sometimes she buys items directly from the producers. She mostly sells wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, cashew nuts, and ground nuts.

Halima K. uses the income from the shop to feed the family and purchase goods to sell. She is requesting a loan of $925 (1,200,000 TZS) to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Francesca

texts.en:
Francesca Korang-B. is fifty years old. She is widowed and a mother of four children: a boy and three daughters. She says one of her daughters is married. Of the remaining three, one is at the teacher training college, one is in the junior high and another is in the senior high school. Francesca lost her husband not long ago; that’s why she is in dark colours. In our part of the world as done elsewhere, dark colours are worn when one is bereaved. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Francesca deals in printed textile fabrics. She says she procures a variety of fancy and wax prints from a textile depot in Accra and sells in Berekum. She also treks to nearby towns to sell. Francesca has been in this business for three years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more fabrics. She desires to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy printed textiles in bulk

loans.name: Akosuaa

texts.en:
Akosua O. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two girls and a boy.  All of them are currently in basic school.

She trades in bags of all sorts.  Akosua purchases traveling bags, ladies’ dressing bags, etc. from Accra and treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

Her husband is a farmer. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Hweakwae, in the Eastern Region of Ghana.  The major occupation of the dwellers of this community is farming.  The land is rich in nutrients and as a result, many inhabitants combine trading and farming activities.

She wants a loan to purchase more of the bags and other fashion accessories to maximize her profit margin.  Akosua has been in this business for six years.  She aspires to give her children the best education.

loans.use: Purchase traveling/dress bags

loans.name: Reina Escobar

texts.es: Reina Escobar V. D. V., resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango junto a sus dos hijos mayores D. edad. A sus 44 años D. edad Reina trabaja en su propio negocio, en el cual se encarga D. vender frutas y verduras D. manera ambulante en la zona oriental del país, la cual esta ubicada a unas 2 horas y media D. su hogar. A pesar que el hijo mayor D. Reina trabaja, esto no es suficiente para poder pagar todos los gastos del hogar, es por ello que Reina se esfuerza día con día, ya que su mayor deseo es poder brindarles una vida mejor a sus hijos, los cuales puedan estudiar y D. esta manera triunfar en la vida. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero para aumentar sus productos y tener mucha más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes, D. manera que sus ventas aumente y ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales contribuyan a una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Reina Escobar is the widow of V.. She lives in the municipality of Ilopango together with her two adult sons. Reina is 44, and she has her own business. She sells fruits and vegetables on the streets in the eastern zone of the country which is 2 and a half hours from her home. Even though her older son works, it is not enough to be able to pay the household expenses. That’s why Reina works day by day. Her biggest desire is to be able to give her sons a better life. They can then study and become successful in their lives. This is why she is asking for a loan. She will use the loan to buy more produce and have a much greater variety to offer her customers. In doing so her sales will increase, and she will receive greater income to contribute to better economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
“Hardworking and skillful woman" describes Elsie B., who is 48, married and living in Calube, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has eight children, four of whom are in school while the other four have their own families. Her husband is a carpenter.

Elsie used to bake bread just for her family's snacks. She knew how to bake because she used to be the “alalay” (helper) of her mother, using a native "pugon" (oven). When some of her neighbors who had tasted her bread encouraged her to bake more and sell it to them, she grabbed the opportunity. Now she continues her bread-making business, and it turns out to be profitable. In order to have additional capital, she joined the Kiva field partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, to take out a loan.

As a member in good standing, she is already on her 10th loan cycle. Now she is applying for a loan of $825 to buy flour and other ingredients for making bread, and to buy sacks of rice for her new business, which is selling rice. She plans to have mixing equipment someday and to expand her business into a bakery.

loans.use: To buy flour and ingredients for bread making and sacks of rice for rice retailing

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: la Sra. Margarita T. nacio el 15 de agosto de 1970, ella tiene 38 años de edad, ella hace mucho tiempo empezo a gustarle el comercio y vendia cosmeticos, ropa y carne por libras pero en cantidades minimas, pero poco a poco fue creciendo y con el pasar de los años tuvo la idea de poner un puesto en el mercado los dolores de la ciudad capital, despues de tanto tiempo de solicitar el local se lo aprobaron y puso una carniceria con el nombre de MANOA, ella tiene tres hijos los cuales junto a su esposo han logrado sacar adelante, la vida de ella ha sido muy dura pero en estos momentos la recompenza es buena y su negocio esta creciendo mucho ya que ahora compro otro local para ampliar su negocio pero necesita capital para poder comprar mas carnes y tener mas ventas.
texts.en:
Margarita T. was born August 15th, 1970, and she is 38. A long time ago she started to like commerce. She sold cosmetics, clothes, and meat by the pound, but in small quantities. Little by little her business was growing. With the passage of the years, she had the idea to set up a stall in the Los Dolores market in the capital city. After applying, much time passed, and then she was approved. She set up a butcher shop named Manoa. She has three children, and together with her husband they have been able to get ahead. Her life has been very hard, but now the reward is good. Her business is growing a lot. She bought another place to expand her business, but she needs capital to buy more meat and have more sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beef, pork and chicken

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda S. is thirty-two years of age. She is a married mother of two children – both daughters. She says both of her daughters are in the primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Linda is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice – fried rice, rice and stew. She prepares the food in her house of residence and sells in a container (kiosk) by a roadside in her community. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from shops in her town. She sells from morning till evening.

Linda has been in business for one year and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. Linda desires to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 31-year-old married man with one child. He has owned a beauty salon since 2004. He first started learning the family business fourteen years ago with the help of his father, who stood by him to be able to start a career for his son. Today, George is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy goods needed for his salon.

loans.use: To buy goods needed for his salon

loans.name: Mirna Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Mirna del Socorro es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 57 años de edad, sigue en las ventas y con el deseo de lograr una tienda botánica, su labor es la venta de medicina botánica el cual le ha ido bien ya que las personas optan por productos naturales. Reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos mayores de 25 y 30 años de edad. Este negocio lo inicio con fondo que su familia otorgo. Este es su noveno ciclo de préstamo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de productos botánico para elevar las venta y obtener mas ganancia. Sus planes para personales es poder hacer unas mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mima del Socorro is a hard working woman of 57 years. She continues working in sales with the goal of having a botanical store. Her work, selling botanical medicine, has been going well since people are choosing natural products. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua and has two older children, 25 and 30 years old. She began this business with funds her family provided. This is her ninth loan cycle with AFODENIC and she will invest it in the purchase of botanical products to increase her sales and increase her earnings. Her personal plans are to be able to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy botanical products

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Célestine A. est une femme de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est commerçante de céréales à Kpalimé. Célestine exerce cette activité depuis 4 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son commerce en achetant des sacs de maïs, mils riz, haricots pour la revente.
texts.en:
Célestine A. is a 40 year old woman, she is married and the mother of 2 children. She sells cereals and grains in Kpalimé. Célestine has been working in this business for almost 4 years and she hopes that with this loan she will be able to increase the size of her business and buy sacks of corn, milled rice and beans for resale.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn, milled rice and beans

loans.name: Tumain

texts.en:
Tumaini is a member of the Mafifi south borrower group,she is 23 years old woman,she is married and amother of 1 child.Her child is aged  2 years .

Tumaini started her own tailoring business 5 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tsh.

This is Tumain`s first loan from BRAC,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more material for her tailoring business.

With profit she gain from the use of this loan Tumaini hopes to save more money and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more material

loans.name: Marta Lilian

texts.es: Marta Lilian G. R. de 40 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Marta es una mujer soltera y emprendedora en su negocio, ella posee una panadería donde fabrica variedades pan dulce y pan francés, la panadería de Marta se encuentra ubicada en una casa que Marta alquila y a su vez vive en ella. Marta siempre sueña con expandir su negocio haciendo que su pan llegue a muchos más lugares, este sueño solo se puede ir haciéndolo realidad con la ayuda en este crédito, el cual le permitirá a Marta comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima.
texts.en:
Marta Lilian G. R. is 40 years old, single, and lives in the district of La Libertad. She is an entrepreneur who owns a bakery where she makes a variety of sweet breads and French breads. Marta lives in a rented house, where she also runs her bakery. She dreams of expanding her business so that her bread can be distributed to many more places. That dream can become a reality with the help of this loan, which she will use to buy more ingredients in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Ana Maruja

texts.es:
Ana Maruja M. Q. es una socia activa del banco comunal El Paraíso que encuentra ubicado en   la parroquia Cumbe a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca,  Ana vive en el sector de los Olivos a unos 15 minutos de la parroquia  Cumbe, tiene 40 años de edad vive en unión libre, tiene 2 hijos de 17, 9 años de edad, su hijo mayor estudia en el colegio Técnico Cumbe y su hijo pequeño estudia en la escuela Gabriel Arseminio Villauri del sector, su casa es  propia hecha con el esfuerzo de varios años de su juventud, su esposo es transportador de gas, se ayudan económicamente formando un buen pilar familiar. 

Ana tiene una  tienda de abarrotes hace unos 10 años y le va muy bien en su negocio, el horario de trabajo es desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche todos los días  sin cerrar los domingos, nos cuenta que la ventaja de trabajar en un negocio propio es que no está sujeta a un estricto horario y nadie que  le de órdenes, cuando tiene una ocupación cierra el negocio, su desventaja es que le falta un poco de capital para surtirle a su tienda. 

Se encuentra trabajando junto al bankito hace 10 ciclos, recuerda que cuando iniciaron eran solo 6 socias y ahora están 19 y espera  que más mujeres se integren para seguir creciendo.
Los prestamos le han beneficiado en su negocio, también le gusta porque se garantizan entre compañeras y no realizan mucho papeleo.

El dinero del crédito solicitado lo  invertirá  en su negocio comprando mercadería surtida para abastecer mejor y contar con un stock adecuado para ofrecer a sus clientes.

La meta de Ana  es  tener un mini comisariato, ponerse cabinas telefónicas y una papelería.
texts.en:
Ana Maruja M. Q. is an active member of the El Paraíso Communal Bank, which is located in the Cumbe parrish in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. Ana lives in the Los Olivos area, which is 15 minutes from the Cumbe parrish. She is 40 and in a common law marriage. She has two children, 17 and 9. Her older son goes to the Técnico Cumb School. Her younger son goes to the Gabriel Arseminio Villauri School in the area. Her house is her own, made with various years of effort in her youth. Her husband transports gas. They help each other economically, forming a good family cornerstone. Ana has had a grocery store for ten years. Her business is going very well. Her work hours are from six in the morning until ten at night every day, without closing on Sundays. She tells us that the advantage of working in your own business is that you are not subjected to a strict schedule, and nobody gives you orders. When you have something else to do, you close the business. The disadvantage is having little money to stock the store. She has been working with the bank for ten cycles. She remembers when they started and there were only six members. Now, there are 19. She hopes that more members join to keep growing. Her business has benefited from the loans. She also likes it because they guarantee them between colleagues, and they do not need to do much paperwork. She will use the money from the loan she is asking for to buy merchandise to better stock her store and have adequate stock to offer her customers. Ana’s goal is to have a mini supermarket with telephone booths and a stationery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to better stock her business

loans.name: Florish Sister Group

texts.en:
Florish Sister is a group of five borrowers led by Sylvestine W., who is 31 years old and married.  She has two children ages 11 and 13 years old, and their educational levels are 4th and 5th grade. She also cares for a sibling. Because Sylvestine could only afford to attend school through the eighth grade, she needed to go into business so as to take care of her family’s needs.

Sylvestine buys food such as cereals, sugar, milk, etc. wholesale and then sells them at retail to the residents of Claratown, a crowded community north of Liberia’s capital, Monrovia.
She has been running this business for eight years and is grateful for her good relationships with her customers.
