Sylvestine is requesting this loan in order to increase the food she offers for sale. In this way she hopes to grow her business so she can change her family’s living conditions for the better.

loans.use: To buy more wholesale food to sell at retail

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mrs. Chum N. is 48 years old and she lives in Kdei Tnaot village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she faces a problem because her soil is infertile. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. She will use the rest of money to build piggery. Her husband, Mr. Some Uy, is a palm juice collector. This couple has two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to build piggery.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria is 32 years old and has two children of the ages six and ten. She began her food sale business six years ago in order to provide a method of improving the quality of life she was providing for her children.  She says that it was necessary because the father of the children didn’t help to support them. She dreams of having an established location for her restaurant, she would like to be better able to serve her clients. Providing a comfortable space for them would be her dream. As a current challenge, Ana Maria faces a lot of competition from other food vendors nearby. Ana Maria has a good credit history with Fundacion Leon 2000.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 32 years old and has two children of the ages six and ten. She began her food sale business six years ago in order to provide a method of improving the quality of life she was providing for her children. She says that it was necessary because the father of the children didn’t help to support them. She dreams of having an established location for her restaurant, she would like to be better able to serve her clients. Providing a comfortable space for them would be her dream. As a current challenge, Ana Maria faces a lot of competition from other food vendors nearby. Ana Maria has a good credit history with Fundacion Leon 2000.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: C2879 Ubuwe Muyombo Group

texts.en:
Evelyne is 26 years old, married with 2 children aged 6 and 10 years old. Evelyne has been a proven entrepreneur for many years, and now she is the president of a group called “UBUMWE MUYOMBO” This is the tenth successful year of this group in selling animals like sheep and cows. This group runs their business from 6 AM to 3 PM every day.

This is the first time for this group to request the loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. When they are lent this money, they hope that it will allow them to buy more domestic animals for sale as well as increasing a number of their customers and hopefully making more profits. With this profit Evelyne is saving for buying a house that she and her spouse have long dreamed of owning.  Also, it will allow them to continue paying school fees and provide more and better food for their families.

loans.use: obtaining more animals for sale

loans.name: Indra

texts.en:
Mrs. Indra T. has one daughter who attends pre-primary school. Her husband, Mr. Dil Kumar T., is a taxi driver.

Indra T. owns one cow and she sells the cow’s milk in her area. She carries milk containers and sells door to door in the morning and evening every day. In Nepal, pure fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for human nutrition. Indra T. lives in growing neighborhood and, in that area, the demand for the milk is increasing constantly. To meet the rising demands of her customers, she is requesting a loan of Rs 10000.00 to purchase another young cow.

loans.use: To buy a calf for her milk-selling business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” desde hace 5 años atrás, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y tiene 12 hijos de los cuales 4 viven con ella. Estudió primaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores.
Juana nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà animales como: ovejas y gallinas.
Su sueño para el futuro es vivir tranquila y mejorar su alimentación.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Juana has been a member of the communal bank, "Gregoria Apaza" for five years in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 56 years old, married, and has 12 kids, 4 of whom live with her. She completed her primary studies and is dedicated to the buying and selling of young animals. Juana told us that with her first loan from the Movement Manuela Ramos, in the amount of 300.00 soles, that she was able to increase her capital. She is soliciting a loan of 500.00 soles with which she will buy animals, such as sheep and hens. Her dream for the future is to live peacefully and improve her diet. The things she likes best about her communal bank are the savings and the member meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep and hens

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo sells groceries. She is 32 years old, married with 2 children aged 13 and 9. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She assists her husband with meeting the family's basic needs. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Sri Kurn Village Bank Group

texts.en: Village bank president Mrs. Sri K. leads a group of 17 people, located in Kandal province. The members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sri K. is a grocer in the local market. Although she tries to work hard with her business, she still doesn't earn enough income to support her family.   In order to increase and expand her business, Mrs. Sri K. is asking for a loan of 800,000 Riel from AMK to buy more fish. With the rest of the loan, she will support her grocery business.  Mrs. Sri K. is 57 years old. She is a widow with a child who is a student in the local school. Mrs. Sreynuch C. is a group guarantor of this village bank, so she is presented in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying Clothing for Resale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a business woman.  She runs a beer bar in Lagos and her family lives there, too.  She sells drinks to her costumers at retail and from this she makes her living.  Veronica has been in the business for years.

As a hard working woman, she also sells pepper soup in order to make additional profit. With the profit she get from the business, she is able to support her family.  She is requesting a loan amount of N 180,000 to purchase more drinks and pepper soup spices. Veronica is 40 years old, married with 3 children who are doing well in school. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pepper soup spices.

loans.name: Lucrecia Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia P. se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos  tales como abanicos, planchas, radios, bolsos, entre otros iniciando sus labores todos los días desde tempranas horas sacando parte de sus electrodomésticos a orillas de la acera de su tramo para poder ofertarlos en el mercado de León.   

El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de dichos electrodomésticos para continuar comercializandolos en su local y así generar sus respectivos ingresos para el sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucrecia sells electrical appliances. In the early morning hours, she moves some of her inventory out to the sidewalk near her store to offer to customers. Her business is open from 8am to 5pm. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy appliances such as fans, irons, radios, and other items. In addition to this business, Sra. Lucrecia also operates a diner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase appliances to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane D. has been a LAPO, Sierra Leone client and a credit-union member for two years. She has taken four previous loans, using her previous loans' profit to complete her house project and to assist her husband with her children's schooling. She is asking for a loan of 1,500,000 Leones to expand her fish business.

Jane is 42 years old, married and has four children, three boys and a girl. She lives with her family in Tengbeh town, an area of Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She helps her family with the profit from her business.

With the assistance of LAPO, SL and Kiva lenders, Jane will use her new loan to purchase more fish and thereafter, use her profit to better her life and that of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Nyamtsetseg

texts.en:
Nyamtsetseg, 27 years old, lives with her husband and son in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent, in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband, Nyamdelger, is a solderer in a private factory and after work operates a taxi service business and helps with his wife's business.

Currently, Nyamtsetseg operates a shoe trading business at Har Horin, one of the biggest markets in Mongolia. She started selling shoes at her mother's counter at the Har Horin market, and since 2006 has independently operated her own shoe trading business. Over the years, she has steadily expanded her business and today her working capital is 2,000,000 tugrugs (~ 1410 USD).

Nyamtsetseg is an experienced trader and enthusiastic person who has many plans for the future. She says, "I would like to expand my business and to sell all types of clothing." She is requesting a 1,700,000 tugrug (~ 1245 USD) loan to purchase summer shoes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel C. is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan Cotabato. She is 25 years old. Maricel is married and has three infant children. To make a living, Maricel owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Maricel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is married with seven children and all her children go to school.  She resides in and owns a three-room house where she stays with nine people. Hadjah doesn’t take care of additional family members. Hadjah is a market vendor in Kawempe market. Hadjah owns a stall selling bananas. She wants to use this loan of 500,000/= to buy more bunches of bananas from Mbarara in southern Uganda. Hadjah has been in this business for four years and with MCDT for eight years now. Hadjah sells to all categories of people at retail and at wholesale. She works seven days week. Her business challenges include transportation of bananas from Mbarara to her stall in Kawempe and the rainy season. Hadjah‘s business aspiration is to start bringing a lorry full of bananas. She decided to work with MCDT to get enough capital for her business without collateral security.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Kiorob, Talahiron, Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 39 years old. Gloria is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 20th loan taken out by Gloria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoulaye D. est un réparateur de motocyclette à KAOLACK une ville carrefour entre le Sénégal et la Gambie d'où les taxi motos occupent une grande place dans la circulation urbaine ,péri urbaine et également en zone rurale. connait bien le milieu car étant réparateur Monsieur D. sollicite ce crédit pour en acheter un et payer un employé pour lui faire le transport nécessaire . Les bénéfices obtenus de ce transport vont servir à soutenir ses parents qui vivent dans un village environnant
texts.en:
Mr. Abdolaye D. is a motorcycle mechanic in Kaoloack, a village that is located at the crossroads between Senegal and Gambia, so that moto-taxis play an important role in the urban, surban and rural traffic in the area. He knows this field well from being a mechanic. Mr. D. is seeking a credit to purchase a motorcycle for himself and to hire a driver who would transport passengers. The income will be used to support his parents who live in the nearby message.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a motorcycle

loans.name: Rose Marie Chantal

texts.fr: Rose est une femme celibataire et mere de 2 enfants .Elle est dans le metier de la coiffure.Elle a un salon de coiffure mais aussi un centre de coiffure ou elle forme des eleves dans les metiers de la coiffure et de l'esthetique.Elle dispose d'une experience de plus de 6 ans dans le domaine.Elle fait ce metier pour gagner sa vie et gerer ses enfants.Voila pourquoi elle utilise ses benefices realises dans les charges familiales.Elle compte developper son activite dans le futur.
texts.en:
Rose is a single mother of two children. She is a hairdresser. She has a beauty shop and also a training center where she teaches coiffure and cosmetology. She has more than six years experience in this field. She works at this job in order to support herself and her children. For that reason, she uses her profit for family expenses. She hopes to develop her businesses still further in future.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to renovate her beauty shop

loans.name: Chann's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chann A. is 43 years old and he is a village bank president having been selected by its ten members which located in Ampil Teouk village in Kandal province. With the loans, the members of this village will use it’s to purchase supplies, equipments and other items to support their different purpose. 
Mr. Chann A. and his, Mrs. Sary La, are farmers who work very hard to support their two children. In order to support this farm, Mr. Chann A. will use the loan who asked from AMK to buy rice seed and to pay for laborer to plow his farm. Aside from farmer, Mrs. Sary La is also vegetable seller in the local market, who is able to earn a small income to support his family living. This couple has two children, who are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and to pay for laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
N. Madina is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Madina has a business of selling soft drinks, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Madina is requesting a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more soft drinks like soda.  Madina plans to use the loan in order to expand her business, and generate profit in order to help her family.  In the future, Madina hopes to own a house.



Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
José de 57 años, el es cerrajero (en la foto aparece ya terminadas unas rejas que el hizo),  vive en la Primavera de Duran (zona urbana, con una ecología en reconstrucción). 

Tiene un taller de cerrajería en la parte delantera de su casa, comenzó desde muy joven para poder mantener a su familia, pasado el tiempo obtuvo experiencia con la ayuda de su papa que le enseño. Ahora el trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. 

Para seguir con su taller de cerrajería el quiere comprar con el préstamo pinturas y metales, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y poder readecuar el taller.
texts.en:
José is a metalsmith. In the photograph, he is finishing a set of bars that he created. José lives in Primavera de Duran, an urban area that is undergoing revitalization.

He operates a metal shop in the front part of his house. José started this business as a young man so that he could support his family. He gained experience by learning the trade from his father. José works every day from 7am to 6pm.

To keep his metalsmith workshop in operation, he wants to use this loan to buy paints and metals. In the future, he wants to finish the construction of his house and remodel his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase paints & metals

loans.name: Yury Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Yury es originario del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como Responsable de agua y saneamiento en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene ocho años de laborar. Tiene tres años de laborar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado tres créditos, el crédito lo solicitó para la compra de bloques, hierros, alambre de amarre, con el fin de empezar a construir su vivienda para brindarles un bienestar mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yury is a native of the municipality of El Sauce. He is the Head of Water and Sanitation for the Municipality of El Sauce, where he has worked for 8 years. He has worked with CEPRODEL for 3 years, where he has taken 3 loans. The loan that he requests will be used to purchase cement blocks, iron and bales of wire. He will use these materials to begin to build a house to provide for the well-being of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cement blocks, iron, bales of wire, and cement

loans.name: Manuia

texts.en:
Manuia T. is 50 and married with 7 children. She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Manuia has 2 years of experience in this business, and needs a loan of 1000 talas to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Manuia joined SPBD. This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Manuia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with two grown sons. She is a market entrepreneur from Berdyansk. She owns two kiosks where she sells dishware at reasonable prices. She started this enterprise eleven years ago. Presently, Galina has 45,000 UAH of working capital. Her income amounts to $1950 a month.  

Galina is seeking a 5,000 UAH loan to increase the assortment of dishware products in her kiosks. She likes working with this type of inventory. Galina is a diligent and determined market vendor. She knows what it takes to keep a business afloat. Galina works hard to make her small venture a successful business that will keep bringing her stable income in the future.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie S. is from the village of Brgy. Uddiawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old. Elvie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvie owns & operates a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport in the local community. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elvie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Elvie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Doralia De Los Ángeles

texts.es: La Sra. Doralia de los Ángeles E. H. ella se dedica al negocio de la venta de lotería y raspadita ella vende ambulante, tiene veinte y tres años de dedicarse a esta actividad, ella ya tiene a sus clientes a quienes les vende las raspaditas y loterías, es acompañada y  tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cinco  créditos con CEPRODEL y   cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de lotería y raspadita para ampliarle a su negocio y poder abastecer a sus clientes, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Sra. Doralia de los Ángeles E. H. works as a walking vendor of lottery tickets and scratch-off games. She has worked in this business for 23 years. She already has her customers to whom she sells scratch-off and lottery tickets. She is in a relationship and has a son of school age. She has had five loans with CEPRODEL, and she has taken out each one for the purchase of lottery and scratch-off tickets to increase her business and be able to supply her customers. The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited her greatly, since in this way she has improved her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: Lottery sales

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma is married to A. R., who operates a business selling Punjabi food. He has a breakfast stall in the market where he offers traditional Punjabi food such as Halwa puri (a combination of sweet halwa, spicy chick peas and hot crunchy puris) and Nan channey (made with chick peas) to his customers. He has a good name in the area for his food's quality and taste.

Salma is a housewife who stays at home and does her household work. She is the mother of 5 children, all of whom are enrolled in school and getting their education. Salma has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in his food stall business. With the loan, he will buy chick peas, cooking oil, flour, spices, etc. in bulk to help him make large quantities of food to sell. He has been operating this business for over 6 years and Salma is confident that he will be able to improve his business with the help of a loan investment. Salma is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: to buy required items for Punjabi food stall business

loans.name: Gil Esteban

texts.es:
Gil Esteban C. T. tiene 42 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Gil se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 15 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es dar el estudio a los hijos.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Gil Esteban C. T. is 42 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos. He has 3 children.  

The members of the rural communal bank UNIDOS SOMO MAS [Together We Are More] are in the community of El Marañon, in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. This bank is dedicated to short cycle agricultural work such as corn, rice and beans.  

Gil has worked especially with the planting of corn, rice and beans for 15 years. He buys his products at the Comercial López in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in his same community.  

He is asking for the loan to buy agricultural materials and fertilizers for his crops. The support of the loan will help him to meet his financial needs. They have faced challenges such as pests and diseases and weather variation. His dream is give his children and education. He likes to play sports.

loans.use: Agricultural materials and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with a grown daughter and a teenage son. She is a retail entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Mariya owns a small store downtown Ivano-Frankivsk. She sells children’s clothing merchandise, stuffed toys and games. Mariya has been in the trade for 5 years. Her monthly income amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas. 

Mariya is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase assorted children’s clothing and toys to meet the growing customer demand this holiday season. She is hoping to generate additional income this winter and keep both of her hired employees employed in winter when many other market entrepreneurs have low sales and are forced to dismiss their employees. Mariya is hoping to use extra profit to finish construction work on her private house. The retail business is the only source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Wilbert Nolberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Wilbert Nolberto; el tiene 60 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ferretería, el tiene una pequeña tienda donde trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar y ampliar le negocio de ferretería. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la ferretería.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Wilbert Nolberto is a member of the "Buena Esperanza" (Good Hope) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Wilbert Nolberto is 60 years old.  He is single and has 5 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his hardware business.  He has a small store where he works from 9.00am to 7.00pm.  Through his work, he gets his children ahead in life.

WIlbert Nolberto would like to improve and expand his hardware business.  He is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for his store.  He is happy to be receiving a loan and he pledges to make his payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his hardware business

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida C. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Zenaida is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida owns & operates a business raising vermi worms and cultivating vermi products for fertilizers.  Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Zenaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase vermi worms stock. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional vermi worms to expand her business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Zenaida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vermi worms to expand business

loans.name: Cascabeles Group

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa Sánchez P., vive en Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas México, es madre soltera con cinco hijos  quienes ya están casados y son su razón de seguir adelante.
El préstamo solicitado lo invierte en la compara de ingredientes para la elaboración de comidas que vende  en el mercado, lleva con esta actividad  once años en donde la va bien ya que le ha  dejado buenos ingresos.

        Desde hace once años se dedica a esta actividad ya que para sacar adelante a sus hijos tenia que tener un trabajo en el cual  le diera buen resultado para salir adelante con su  familia y gracias adiós lo ha logrado.
    
       De lo que le queda  de su venta en el día  compra mas  ingredientes que se le terminan y  así su negocio se baya incrementado día a  día, como también  tener  de manera puntual sus pagos que ha solicitado.

       Desea que con este pequeño trabajo  siga adelante hasta que dios le preste vida, también comprar cosas que le hacen falta en su casa.

       El grupo se llama cascabeles y se integra de tres señoras cada una con diferente actividad, la razón del nombre es por que cuando se formo el grupo eran las fiestas navideñas.

       María Jiménez Sánchez: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales, como son: carne, pasas, aceite, maza, entre otros.
     
       Tomasa Sánchez P.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de comidas, como son: carne. Mariscos y verduras.

       Rosa del Carmen Gómez Pérez: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de embutidos (chorizo), como son: carne, chile ancho, tomillo, entre otros.
texts.en:
Tomasa Sánchez P. lives in Tecpatan in the state of Chiapas, México.  She is a single mother of 5 children, who are already married and who are her reason to continue to press ahead.  She will use this loan to buy ingredients to make the food that she sells in the market.  She has been carrying out this type of work for 11 years, and it is going well since it has allowed her to make a good income.  

She started with this business 11 years ago, since she needed to provide for her children.  She had to have a job that would give her good results so that she could get ahead with her family, and thanks to God she has managed to do this.

With the money from her daily sales, she buys the ingredients that she has run out of, and in this way her business grows gradually, day by day.  With these funds she also makes the payments on time for the loan that she has requested.  

She hopes that with this small job she can continue to get ahead as long as God grants her life and buy some things that she needs for her home.

This group is called "Cascabeles," (Jingle Bells) and is made up of 3 women who each have their own business.  The reason for the name is that when the group formed it was during the Christmas season.  

María Jiménez Sánchez will invest the loan in the purchase of ingredients to make tamales, such as: meat, raisins, cooking oil, cornmeal, etc.

Tomasa Sánchez P. will invest the loan in the purchase of ingredients to make food, such as: meat, seafood and vegetables.

Rosa del Carmen Gómez Pérez will invest the loan in the purchase of ingredients to make sausages, such as: meat, ancho chiles, thyme, and other items.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food, such as: meat, seafood and vegetables

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz forma parte del banco comunal “Renace el sol con esfuerzo” perteneciente a la localidad de Chimbarongo,  ciudad de San Fernando. 

Ella se dedica a reparar y retapizar sofás, algunos los compra en mal estado y los repara para luego venderlos a un mejor precio, además retapiza sofás a pedido de clientes particulares. Luz tiene este oficio desde hace 17 años, trabajando directamente desde su casa, ya que acomodó un taller en el patio de ésta. Ella debe ir a buscar los sofás en mal estado con carretilla (carro pequeño de mano), para trasladarlos a su casa y poder repararlos. Ya que no cuenta con vehiculo particular. Luz además se dedica a la confección de cortinas y cojines.

Con este préstamo comprará telas, cueros y cuerina en las ciudades de Santiago y San Fernando. De esta manera aumentará su producción y sus ganancias. 
Ella vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, quienes además le ayudan en su negocio. Por su parte su esposo la ayuda cuando tiene días libres en su trabajo, quien se desempeña como artesano de mimbre (varitas flexibles de un arbusto). 

El sueño de Luz es comprar Maquinaria para coser cueros y una engrapadora eléctrica, ya que las costuras al interior de los sofás las realiza manualmente, lo que es muy sacrificado para su salud.

Su motivación para seguir con su negocio es costear los estudios de sus tres hijos.
Para Luz la ayuda de Fondo Esperanza ha sido fundamental, ya que el financiamiento que se le ha otorgado, ha sido un gran apoyo para su negocio. 
Chimbarongo es una comuna ubicada en la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’Higgins 150 Kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa "lugar entre nieblas". La economía de Chimbarongo está basada principalmente en la elaboración de artesanías en mimbre, en el cultivo de frutales y la producción de vino.
texts.en:
Luz is part of the community bank "Renace el Sol con Esfuerzo" (The Sun Is Reborn with Effort), which belongs to the locality of Chimbarongo in the city of San Fernando.  She works in the repair and re-upholstering of sofas, some of which she buys in poor condition and then repairs to cell them later at a better price.  She also re-upholsters sofas at the request of particular clients.  Luz has been working in this job for 17 years directly from her house, as she has added space in her patio to do her work. She usually goes to pick up old sofas in a small car to move them to her house for repair, but she no longer has access to this vehicle. Luz also makes curtains and cushions.

With this loan, she will buy fabric, leather, and imitation leather in the cities of Santiago and San Fernando.  In this way, she will increase her production and her earnings.  She lives with her husband and their three children, who also help her with her business.  Her husband helps her when he has time off from his work as a craftsman of mimbre (a flexible type of shrub wood). Luz's dream is to purchase machinery to sew leather and an electric stapler, as she currently does the interior stitching on the sofas manually, which is causing her health problems.  Her motivation to continue with her business comes from her desire to fund the education of her three children.

The help of Fondo Esperanza (Hope Fund) has been fundamental for Luz, as the credit has supported her greatly in her business. Chimbarongo is located in the region Libertador General Bernando O'Higgins, 150 kilometers to the south of Santiago, the capital of Chile. Its name comes from the Mapuche language, and it means "place between the clouds." Chimbarongo's economy is based principally on artisan crafts made from mimbre, the cultivation of fruit trees, and the production of wine.

loans.use: Purchase of leather, imitation leather, and cloth

loans.name: 12 Bac Hai - Hoang Phong - Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Thanh L. T. (12) is a 38-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Thanh is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 05.01.12 Bac Hai - H. Phong - H. Hoa.

Thanh is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Thanh operates a family member's business venture in the services sector operating a service: help local people to make rice ready for cook (local people bring their rice to Ms. Thanh house and Ms. Thanh uses machine to make it clean and ready for cook).  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members.  Thanh has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thanh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase equipment to improve the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Bich P. T. (11) is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Tho T. T. (3) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Thuy T. T. (20) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Giau L. T. (13) is a 49-year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Ket H. T. (19) is a 57-year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


6.  Nghia T. T. (30) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thanh L. T. (12) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Thanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 05.01.12 Bac Hai - H. Phong - H. Hoa (05.01.12).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ say sát gạo cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thanh kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2005, Thanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5,000,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua T.ết bị để cải T.ện công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Bich P. T. (11) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Tho T. T. (3) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Thuy T. T. (20) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Giau L. T. (13) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Ket H. T. (19) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


6.  Nghia T. T. (30) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Amig Chaco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIG CHACO” iniciará el ciclo número ocho en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Julia, la  presidenta.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de medicamentos, costura, venta de dulces, venta de tejidos de ropa para bebé, venta de comida, producción de estuco, venta de ropa de niños, elaboración de colchas tejidas para bebé.

La señora Julia, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la A.C. “Amig Chaco”  siete ciclos, aproximadamente  tres años y medio.  Con respeto a su actividad económica, la señora Julia tuvo como negocio el tejido de chompas y sus créditos iniciales fueron destinados a la compra de lana;  desde hace un año tiene el negocio de costura de chamarras.  El cambio de negocio fue debido a que uno de sus hijos aprendió a coser deportivos en un país  extranjero; cuando su hijo regresó le propuso iniciar el negocio de costura de deportivos y ella aceptó.  Además de trabajar con la costura de deportivos, la señora Julia indica que negocia con papa, haba y arbeja.  Este último negocio requiere que la señora Julia viaje a las ferias que se efectúan en el campo, compre los productos mencionados y los traiga para la venta en la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito de este ciclo es para comprar tela para los deportivos y  papa, haba y arbejas.

Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a sus cuatro hijos (27 años, 25 años, 22 años, 20 años) y velar por ella misma, siendo que no tiene pareja.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustó que le dieran la oportunidad de recibir  crédito con la garantía solidaria, “es un crédito fácil” dijo ella.
texts.en:
The “AMIG CHACO” community bank will begin its eighth cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Collpani center.  It is made up of eight members. The community bank is led by a board of directors and the head of this is Julia, the president. The community bank's members' businesses are varied. Among them we have: selling medications, sewing, selling candies, selling fabric for children's clothing, selling food, making stucco, selling children's clothes, and making babies' blankets.    

Julia, the president of the community bank, indicates that she has been a part of “Amig Chaco” for seven cycles, approximately three years and a half. In regards to her economic activity, Julia had a business knitting sweaters and her first loans were for buying wool. For a year she has had a business sewing jackets. The change was due to the fact that one of her children learned to sew jackets abroad. When her son came home, he proposed starting the business sewing jackets and she agreed. In addition to sewing jackets, Julia trades in potatoes, beans and peas. This business requires Julia to travel to the markets in the countryside where she buys the products and brings them to sell in the city of El Alto.

The loan this cycle is to buy fabric for the jackets and potatoes, beans and peas. 

The way of working allows her to generate resources to support her four children as much as possible (aged 27, 25, 22 and 20) as well as to take care of herself, since she is single. 
  
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she liked that she was given the chance to receive a loan withe the supportive co-sign. "It's an easy loan" she said.

loans.use: to buy fabric, potatoes, beans and peas.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 50 years old and married with three children. Two of the children are in school. Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, curls, cooking oil, candy, etc. 

In the future, Marissa would like to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq; he is 45 years old, married and has four children.

Saleh has had a shop selling household pots and plastic items since 2000. He is well known in his local area and has an excellent reputation.

 He is requesting a $2400 loan to make more shelves and a sliding door for his shop. He is aiming to develop his work and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To make more shelves and a sliding door for his shop.

loans.name: Clara Albertina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Clara, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada pero nunca pudo tener hijos. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque aquí ha recibido mucha ayuda y además porque en las reuniones se entretiene y se olvida de sus problemas.

Tiene un carro con el cual ofrece el servicio de transporte escolar, trabaja de lunes a viernes durante todo el dia, nos cuenta que realiza cuatro recorridos por dia, lleva 12 años que viene prestando este servicio y que año a año aumentan sus clientes ya que ofrece puntualidad y seguridad.
 
Necesita el crédito para comprar llantas y ciertas refacciones para mantener en excelente estado su carro.
 
Su sueño es tener otro carro más moderno para brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the Luz De América communal bank meet in the city of Portojejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years at the city of the Royal Tamarinds.

Here we meet 54 year old Clara.  She is married but was never able to have children.  Her husband is an auto mechanic.  This is the bank’s second cycle and she likes it because she has received lots of help there.  She also likes going to the meetings because they are entertaining and she is able to forget all of her problems.

She has a car with which she offers school transportation services, all day Monday through Friday.  She makes four trips each day and has been doing this for 12 years.  Her customers increase each year because she offers them security and timeliness.
 
She needs this loan to buy tires and certain spare parts to keep her car in good shape.  She hopes to one day have a newer car to be able to provide better service.

loans.use: to buy tires and spare parts

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es: José Leonel tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Es una persona muy responsable, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad su cargo. Sus clientes siempre les están solicitando una gran variedad de productos a sus clientes, José tiene que salir todos los días con su bolso para ofrecer los pedidos que le solicitan. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de ropa en general, calzado, tratamientos, perfumes, toallas, sandalias, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, con el tiempo piensa invertir sus ganancias y ampliar su negocio ya que tiene mucha demanda por parte de sus clientes.
texts.en: José Leonel sells general household goods. He is very responsable and cares for 3 children. His clients request a wide variety of items, and José goes out every day to try and supply their requests. He seeks a loan to buy more merchandise for resale such as clothing, shoes, toiletries, perfumes, towels and sandals.  Jose enjoys talking with his clients and hopes to invest his profits in his business to meet ever-increasing demand.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, toiletries, perfumes, towels, sandals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and dairy products

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is made up of only four borrowers, who are shown in the photo. The group leader, Rin, is 41 years old. He is a porter for people who come to buy something in the market, and he earns an average of US$3 profit per day. He is married with five children most of whom attend school, while his wife works in the port as a worker. Recently, the family's living conditions have not been comfortable because their house is broken, which is not comfortable to live in. Therefore, Rin is requesting a loan to repair his house.

The other three borrowers are: 
Chheun, who is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle for the traveling needs of her whole family.
Chheun, who is seeking a loan to purchase nets for her fishing activity.  
Meng, who is requesting a loan to repair her broken house.

loans.use: to repair his house.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a businessman who is 50 years old and married to Kayui, who is a housewife. They are blessed with four children ages 18, 16, 14, and 10 years, respectively. He has been selling new shoes for the past 6 years and earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES, which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his sixth loan with KADET after successfully repaying the previous loans. Paul will use the loan to purchase more new shoes as stock for his business. He plans to use the anticipated profit to educate his children up to university level. 

His future dreams are to have a wholesale shop for new shoes and own a piece of land where he can build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more new shoes for his business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 30. She is married and has four children. After taking this loan, she will expand her business and her income will increase, then she can easily bear her children educational expenses.

loans.use: for expanding her business

loans.name: Pharis

texts.en: Pharis is a farmer in Muranga employing one farmhand in his farm which produces eggs, milk and horticultural products. He is aged 40, has been in farming business for over 10 years, and is married with one child aged five. Pharis has made a loan request for 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry at 60,000 KES, and goats for milk at 20,000 KES. He says the two businesses are promising and he remains hopeful his income will improve. He is however concerned about fluctuating market prices and proposes regular training for farmers in farming basics.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and goats for milk

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years now. She works hard to support her family. 
Elsie has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase additional fishing equipment for her business.
In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Sofia

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa Sofía pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 45 años,  tiene 03 hijos y 02 a su cargo ( de 19 y 08 años de edad), estudiantes de  nivel  superior y primario. Se inició como comerciante con la venta de productos de belleza, pero no le fue bien como ella lo esperaba debido a que sus clientes no le cancelaban en la fecha acordada, por este motivo y por iniciativa propia decide, con una inicial de S/. 600.00, dedicarse a la venta de calzado para damas, actualmente realiza sus pedidos de diferentes modelos vía internet a la ciudad de Trujillo, y los vende en los diferentes distritos de la región San Martín haciéndose de una muy  buena clientela. Este negocio le da muy buenas ganancias y le brinda muchas satisfacciones, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Con este préstamo de S/1500.00, comprará  más modelos y diversas marcas de zapatos para damas, y de esta manera podrá acceder a más clientes.  La Sra. Rosa Sofía, es una mujer trabajadora y entusiasta,  su sueño es tener una zapatería; está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa Sofía belongs to the Esmeralda Communal bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province and department.  She is 45 years old, married, and has three children.  Two of them are under her care (a 19 year old and an 8 year old).  They are post high school and elementary school students.

She started selling beauty products, but that did not go well for her because her customers did not pay on time.  That is why, through her own initiative, she decided to sell women’s shoes.  She started with 600 soles.  She now orders different styles through the Internet in the city of Trujillo.  She sells them in the different districts in the San Martín regions.  She is getting a lot of very good customers.  This business gives her very good earnings, and it provides her with much satisfaction.  Her husband helps her.

With this loan for 1,500 soles she will buy more styles and different brands of women’s shoes.  This way she will be able to get more customers.

Rose Sofía is a hard-working and enthusiastic woman.  Her dream is to have a shoe shop.  She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manueala Ramos for helping women like her to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Nurahmad

texts.ru: Нурахмад проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат. Его жена домохозяйка. У него двое детей. Он имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Нурахмад 10 лет проработал в средней школе района. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей. Арендует помещение, где открыл продуктовый магазин. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов питания. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Nurahmad lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 36 years old, married and has two children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He has a higher pedagogical education and spent ten years working at the district's secondary school.  Today, Nurahmad is involved in sales.  He leases a space, where he opened a food market.  He has been working in this field for two years.  Nurahmad is requesting this loan for the purchase of food products.  He wants to expand the assortment of his merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Soklai

texts.en:
Soklai (in the photo), 31, is a garment worker. Her husband Phansy is a construction worker. They have been married since 2008 and just have a young daughter. They are living in a village along National Road number five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Soklai is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Kimmatoy

texts.ru: Кимматой проживает в районе Яван. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж и сын находятся в Российской Федерации. Сама Кимматой более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый и мелко - рогатый скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа двух голов крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Kimmatoy lives in the Yavan district.  She is 43 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband and son are in the Russian Federation.  Kimmatoy has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years.  She breeds cattle and small livestock at home.  She is requesting this loan for purchase of two heads of cattle in order to increase its quantity.

loans.use: to buy two heads of cattle

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 36 years-old.  She is married with four children. 
Evelyn has a shop that sells RTW or ready to wear clothing such as underwear, blouses and shirts. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 in order to buy clothing such as t-shirts and blouses to sell.

Evelyn has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as t-shirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Rolando

texts.es:
La señor Oscar Rolando tiene 48 años de edad y se dedica a prestar servicios de transporte Taxi, tiene mas de 3 años en dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, su unidad esta asignada a un mall de la ciudad capital,  así mismo  cuenta con clientes fijos que traslada todos los días a diferentes lugares, por razones de mantenimiento su vehículo le esta fallando y necesita llevarlo al taller para revisión. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para el mantenimiento del automotor.
gracias a su negocio puede alimentar, dar estudios a su hijos y pagar los compromisos adquiridos.
texts.en:
Oscar Rolando is 48 years old.  He is a taxi driver and has been in this business for three years.  His unit is assigned to a mall in the capital city so he has regular customers who he transports daily to different places.   His vehicle is failing due to lack of maintenance, and he needs to take it to a garage for service.  He will use the loan to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of his automobile.

Thanks to his business, he is able to eat, provide an education for his children, and pay his financial obligations.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Las edades de los hijos de la socia son de 20 y 19 años de edad, la socia actualmente se encuentra criando animales menores para la venta, la socia compra conejos, gallinas, pollos, cuyes, ella los compra tiernos, los cría y engorda, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de animales menores para la crianza y la venta de los mismos. Ella invertira el credito enla compra de de animales menores como 10 pares de gallinas, 50 cuyes, 30 pollos. La socia desea a futuro tener su terreno propio de cultivo. La socia invertira el prestamo en la compra de animlaes menores.
texts.en: This member’s children are aged 20 and 19. She currently raises young animals to sell them on. She buys rabbits, hens, chickens and guinea pigs. She buys them young, raises them and fattens them. The member would like to invest the loan in the purchase of young animals such as 10 pairs of hens, 50 guinea pigs and 30 chickens to raise them and then sell them. She would like to have her own plot of farming land in the future.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of young animals.

loans.name: Syna

texts.en:
Syna (in the photo) sells grocery items at home. Her husband Sarith is a motor taxi driver. They have been married for more than four years and have two young children, one son and one daughter. The family is living in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sarith wants to fund a new business producing shoes for sale because he has just finished learning this skill, but he does not have the capital to buy materials to launch his business. Hence, Syna is applying for another loan of $1,000 to help her husband to buy materials.

loans.use: To help her husband buy materials to launch a business producing shoes.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en: Zosima is 48 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 10 children. To earn a living, Zosima has a fishing business. She earns about PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase a fishing net. She has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, Zosima would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 19 years old, married, and has one child. He lives with six family members, two of whom work.

Hussein has been an owner of a food market since 2007, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese, and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, and he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $2400 to buy a tricycle truck to transport his goods. He aims to gain more profits for the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To buy a tricycle truck to transport his goods.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Despite the hardships of life, Jose aims to improve their status of living and give his family a better life. He has been a farmer for almost 30 years, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, he plans to expand his onion plantation to increase his yields and income in order to support the education of their two children. 

Jose is requesting a loan of PHP30,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for onion production. He mentioned that this loan will help a lot to expand his plantation and hopes that he will be having a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for onion production.

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung and his family live in Ho Chi Minh City.  He is 44 and has two children.  Dung earns a living by running a coffee shop.  He also runs a business selling household equipment, in particular water pipes, from the door of his house. He has done this for the past 11 years.

Dung would like to borrow money to expand his current business by buying a greater quantity and variety of water pipes and other household items. He hopes that this will enable him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy water pipes to resell

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her nephew, who does embroidery on shoes. He has a very demanding business because his skills draw more admirers day by day. He gets the orders from different shoe selling factories and shops and he pastes beads as well as does embroidery on shoes.  

These kinds of shoes are very popular and have high demand in the market.
 
With the loan, he will buy beads, colored thread and laces in larger quantity that will allow him to fulfill larger orders on time and increase his profits.
 
Her husband is employed in a private organization. Perveen has no children, so she spends her time doing her household responsibilities.
 
She is hopeful that her nephew will be able to improve his business after investing the loan into it.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Perveen.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials.

loans.name: Aluel

texts.en:
Aluel is 35 years old, married, and has six children, four of whom attend school. She has a food stall in Dokuru bor, South Sudan, which she has had for two years.

Aluel is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.en:
Concepcion and Genaro are an active, hard-working and a small enterprise managers couple, both are 48 years old and are married since many years ago. Concepcion and Genaro have a business of Elaboration of hanging pots (filled with candies, fruit, etc.). These are figures elaborated with reed and paper. These are too much demanded because are so popular in Mexican parties, the tradition is that this hanging pot used to put in a cord and people have a good time hitting it until breaking it. Concepcion began her business making paper figures like hobby, then she made the hanging pots to her parties’ children, she knew how she could elaborate them. Concepcion and Genaro were without employment and together they decided to start to making and selling hanging pots.

Now their business is growing and it requires of work capital for the quantity of $475 USD to purchase raw material and cover their demand for their products, because the Christmas Mexican celebrations is approaching and the sales are better than another seasons, for that reason, they are going to return the loan in 4-8 months.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Concepción y Genaro son una pareja de pequeños empresarios muy activos y trabajadores, ambos tienen 48 años y están casados desde hace algunos años. Ambos tienen un negocio de Elaboración de piñatas, estas son figuras elaboradas con carrizo y papel, la mayoría de las veces rellenas de dulces y frutas, que son muy demandadas ya que forma parte de la mayoría de las de las fiestas en México, la tradición es que cuelgan esas figuras en un cordón y la gente se divierte pegándole hasta romperlas y que salgan los dulces que recoge la gente como diversión. Hace tiempo Concepción empezó a realizar figurillas en papel como pasatiempo y después hizo las piñatas de sus hijos, fue ahí que se dio cuenta que podía elaborarlas. Tiempo después, Concepción y Genaro se quedaron sin empleo y esto los orilló a decidirse a iniciar el negocio de elaboración y venta de piñatas y complementos.

Ahora su negocio esta creciendo y requiere de capital de trabajo por la cantidad de $456 USD para poder hacer frente a la demanda por su producto, ya que se avecinan las tradicionales posadas (celebraciones típicas navideñas), época en que se incrementan sus ventas, es por eso que solicita un plazo de 4-8 meses para pagar.

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The money will be used to buy electrical appliances.

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.en: Nasimjon has been working as a hairdresser for 13 years already. He has his own salon by the house. He likes his job, but the income from this business is not enough for a big family. He has two children and helps his elderly parents and brothers. The whole family lives with him in one house, so Nasimjon has to keep domestic animals and engage in trading fodder. His last loan he received for fodder grain, which he gets from the local coarse-grinding mill, and sells in the city market in Khujand. His next loan he plans to use for purchasing a hog and some sheep.

loans.use: invest in livestock

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Mrs. Bin S. is a married woman aged 40 who has three children. She and her husband work diligently on their farm growing rice and breeding ducks. They typically earn up to $4/day in income from selling ducks' eggs and a variety of their crops. Two of their children are employed at a local garment factory, and the other attends school.

This couple would like to raise more ducks to generate more income from eggs, but financial constraints limit them. Currently, Bin S. is requesting a loan of US$ 400. She hopes the expansion of her family's farming business will allow them to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more ducks to raise for eggs

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en: "I started this business a year ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to safeguard my capital to ensure continuity in business." All these are the words of Mrs. Elizabeth O.. She is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 40 years of age, married, the mother of 3 children. She sells doors, windows, wall panels & frames. She hopes to increase her business and buy more doors, windows, wall panels & frames for sale with the loan amount of $1175. She has been a LAPO member for 5 years.

loans.use: To buy a saw machine & wood for making windows

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Throughout the countryside there are large structures of adobe brick stacked in “towers”, sometimes with a base of 15’x15’ and rising 10’to 12’, with a small tunnel in the bottom running all the way through the base. This is the oven to fire bricks. For three days a hot fire is placed in the tunnel, and at the end of the period all the bricks in the tower are fired and ready to sell.

Juliet is married with three children and for the past two years, she has been making adobe bricks for sale. It is relatively cheap to start this business, but very labor intensive. The right “earth” is needed, along with adobe molds and firewood for the fire. When it rains  the muddy earth is put it in the molds, then the molds are removed and the bricks are stacked iin a “tower” and fired for 3 days. 

Juliet will use her loan to start a second business. Poultry raising. She will buy 200 chicks to raise as boilers. The loan will enable her to feed them for two and half months, and then she can sell them at the market.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed for her new business

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar has his own business. He has raised cattle for 3 years. This 21-year-old man is single and lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region. He needs a loan of $1200 to buy  balling presses for improving his cattle.

loans.use: to buy balling presses for his cattle business

loans.name: Juana Irene

texts.en:
Juana, a sixty-four year old woman, is the owner and operator of a grocery store in her community.  She is a well experienced businesswoman since she has been entrepreneur for a long time.  “All my life, I have been in business,” she says. 
Juana has seven grown children, three of whom are boys, which she raised on her since her husband had left her.
She says that it’s an exploit raising a lot of children alone, with nobody’s help but God’s.  She worked a lot and made a lot of sacrifices for her offspring.  
Currently, she has a popular and profitable grocery store. The store is in a good location and has very good hygienic conditions.   Juana is requesting a loan (the second one she will take from our organization) to replenish her store in order to keep satisfying her customers’ needs and increase her income.  That way, María will improve her living condition.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of goods to replenish her grocery store

loans.name: Total B(2088)C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is N. Resty. She is currently in the restaurant business and is requesting a loan to expand. N. is 28 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 1 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, N. makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children.

N. is joined in her small group by Hadijah N., Ruth N., Sharon Nakayaga, and Tashra N.. Hanifah N. is currently operates a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to buy two more hair dryers. Ruth N. is currently in the restaurant business and is requesting a loan to buy a fridge. Sharon Nakayaga is currently in the business of used clothing and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Tasheirwe N. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan to buy more land to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand restaurant business

loans.name: Alema

texts.en:
Alema was born in 1976 and she lives together with her husband in Hlapčevići, near the town of Visoko. Her husband is a professional soldier and his monthly salary is about US$ 925.

Alema has requested this loan in the amount of US$ 925 in order to buy a few sheep. She wants to expand her business with sheep-raising as she has all the right conditions for sheep breeding. Alema thinks that this way, she will secure additional money for their 2 children who are 5 and 8 years old.

loans.use: Buying a few sheep to raise

loans.name: Marlene Monica

texts.es:
R. belongs to “Las Rosas de Yungay” (The Roses of Yungay) Grupo Mientras Tanto (an interim group of borrowers not large enough to form a communal bank). For the past two years she has sold fruits at the local market in the district and province of Yungay in the state of Ancash. With this loan of $125, which she will repay in four months, she will buy three boxes of limes, two boxes of mangos, two boxes of apples, and three boxes of plums. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is a chauffer with temporary employment; on his free days, he helps her with the business. La señora R., pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay, desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de frutas en el mercado del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 3 cajas de lima, 2 cajas de mango, 2 cajas de manzana y 3 cajas de ciruela. Ella tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es chofer y tiene trabajos eventuales, en sus días libres le apoya a su esposa en este negocio.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruits to sell at the local market.

loans.name: Matrida

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Matrida M.. She is married and has 5 children aged between 14 and 18. She has 5 more dependents who live with her because they are orphans. In 1998, Matrida established her grocery/pub business. She is now requires a loan in order to buy more stock of beer and soft drinks. She thanks you for your support.

Her bar is a good place to chill with a beer if you manage to finish work early on a Friday afternoon.
