It’s the kind of place where you kick back on a plastic chair under a tree, with a local beer in hand, the aroma of roasting ‘mishikaki’ (kebabs made on an open fire) wafting around you, and talk to anyone and everyone who happens to wander by.

loans.use: To buy more stock of beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn K., 29, is a mother of four children and lives in the province of Kampong Cham. She is a farmer growing rice and yams. She makes $3.60 per day. Her husband (pictured with Mrs. Morn) works collecting recycling items in the village. Everyday he has to go around the village to purchase the recycling items and re-sell them to the recycling plant, earning around $7.50 in revenue per day.

This couple would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike and reserve money to purchase the recycling items in large amounts.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and reserve money to purchase recycling items in large amonts.

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en:
Kemi A. is 36 years old and married with two children. She has been selling cooked foods and drinks for the past 7 years in Igando, Lagos State, Nigeria.

Kemi needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy more drinks and foodstuffs for her restaurant. Kemi expresses her gratitude to kiva and lenders.

loans.use: To buy more food and beverages

loans.name: Fidan

texts.en: Fidan (her father is pictured) was born in 1987. She is single. The Huseynov family lives in Baku city. This family has been in the cafe business for three years. Now they need a loan of $1200 to buy glasses, teapots, kettles and sugar bowls to improve their business..

loans.use: To buy glasses, teapots, kettles and sugar bowls

loans.name: Chinelo

texts.en:
Chinelo O. lives in Alaba, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells clothes and she is also a fashion designer. She learned how to sew 3 years ago. She is a LAPO client.

Chinelo started this business in 2005. She is 25 years old and married without a child. She is requesting a loan amount of $850 to buy more clothes to sell, so that she can expand her business and increase her profit margin. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia tiene 20 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es conveniente y progenitora de un hijo varón de 01 año con 07 meses de edad. Vive en el Centro Poblado de Imicate, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Fe y Alegría” en Yunguyo. Con este crédito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprará papa, chuño, tarwi, haba para ser comercializados en la ciudad de Tacna. 

Yesenia a los 13 años de edad empezó con el negocio de productos ya mencionados, desde que cumplió los 16 años de edad convive con su esposo y continúa con su negocio. 

Su meta es terminar con la construcción de su casa en el sector de Challapampa, el cual está cerca a la carretera de Yunguyo, instalar una tienda de abarrotes y educar a su hijo para que sea profesional.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 20 years old and completed primary school. She is married and mother of a son who is one year and seven months old. She lives in Centro Poblado of Imicate, district and province of Yunguyo, Puno. She is a member of the community bank "Fe y Alegría" (Faith and Happiness) in Yunguyo. With this loan for 500 Soles, which she will repay in four months, she will buy potatos, potato starch, tarwi (edible Andean bean), and broad bean for reselling in the city of Tacna. At age 13, Yesenia began this business with the mentioned products, and when she was 16, she married her husband and continued this business. Her goal is to finish the construction of her home in the sector of Challapampa, which is near the highway in Yunguyo, set up a grocery store, and educate her son to be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: potato, potato starch, tarwi, broad beans, etc.

loans.name: Taifa

texts.en: Taifa, married with two children aged six and eight, has been selling food in Zanzibar for four years.  Working daily from 9:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m., she earns a profit of approximately $100 each month.  Taifa is now requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy additional inventory for her shop, thereby increasing her sales and profits.

loans.use: To buy more food for her shop.

loans.name: Paul Johnson

texts.en:
Paul Johnson T., a 33-year-old newly wed and father to a 10-year-old boy, is engaged in a food vending activity as a money-making venture. He is from Loon, Bohol but has spent his adolescence in Mindanao until he married. Later on, he decided to go back to his hometown to land inherited from his parents. 

On that land, he built a small ‘nipa’ hut for his family and lived a simple life.  As a neophyte in marriage, he began to worry about how he could sustain his family, considering he has no definite source of income. To help remedy the situation, he joined CEV and got into his business. 

He chooses to sell food in the streets for it only requires minimal capital. He started his food vending business almost a year ago. His wife cooks the food while he sells it to his neighbors. With the income he gets from the daily vending, he is able to sustain his family. 

With the aim of expanding his business, attracting more customers, and having a better place to display all the food items, he wants to build a food stall in front of his house. That is why he has requested, for the first time, a loan amounting to P 3,000.00. He hopes that in this way, he can guarantee a better future for his family.

loans.use: building a foodstall where he can display his food for sale

loans.name: Isai

texts.es: Hola mi nombre e Isai Z. me dedico a la venta de flores y plantas hornamentales en la feria del agricultor, este queda ubicado en el Barrio los Graneros, las ventas las realizo los Viernes y los Sabados, en este momento necesito un prestamos para aumentar mi inventario de plantas y asi poder tener mayores ventas, mi negocio se llama Mercadito Verde, con este credito tambien deseo comprar herramientas para que me permita ser mas eficiente en mi trabajo. de este negocio dependen mis hijos y gracias a el puedo darles alimentacion y estudio.
texts.en:
Hello my name is Isai Z., and I sell flowers and decorative plants in the agricultural fair which is located in the neighborhood of Los Graneros. Sales take place on Fridays and Saturdays. At the moment, I need to make a loan to improve my inventory of plants and subsequently increase sales. My business is called Mercadito Verde. With this loan, I also wish to purchase tools that will allow me to be more efficient in my work. My children depend on my business, which thankfully allows me to provide them food and education.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of plants

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en: Mambo from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Mwanaidi M. from Dar es Salaam. She is a divorced women with two children between the ages of 7 and 15. Mwanaidi has been running a cafe business since 2004. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Mwanaidi currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 525 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, sugar, cooking oil, and soda. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Mwanaidi thanks you for your support. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, sugar, cooking oil, and soda.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina K. runs a business of selling charcoal at Mbagala ward in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She purchases the bags of charcoal directly from producers and sells it to retail to her customers. She employs two workers who help her run the business. She also runs a café at Mbagala. She is requesting a loan of $475 (600,000 TZS) to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: Buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Wassa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe WASSA est composé de femmes mariées qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles dans le village WEREKELA, sous préfecture de FANA, relevant de la préfecture de DIOÏLA  région de Koulikoro république du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues  par des relations de commerce et font en générale l’achat vente du charbon de bois. 
Pour développer leur activité commerciale et avoir plus de stock, elles ont fait recours à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 9 tonnes de charbon de bois auprès des charbonniers de WEREKELA et environs. Les charbons sont conditionnés dans les sacs de 100kg avant d’être revendus au comptant aux grossistes venant de BAMAKO. Leur clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent obtenir avec ce prêt un bénéfice de 40 000 FCFA qui servira à étoffer leur fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
WASSA is a group composed of married women who average 32 years of age and 6 children. They live in traditional conjugal families in the village of WEREKELA (in FANA sub-prefecture, belonging to DIOÏLA prefecture) in the Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. They know one another through business ties and in general do work buying and selling charcoal.

To develop their commerce and to have more inventory, they turned toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their fifth group loan (solidarity loan). The preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

The group members plan to use this loan to buy nine tonnes of charcoal from the charcoal producers in and around WEREKELA. The charcoal is packaged into sacks of 100 kg and then sold in cash to wholesalers from BAMAKO. Their customers are composed of men and women.

With this loan, they intend to make a profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will serve to expand their working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es: Carmen María S. C. tiene 45 años de edad, su estado civil es casada. Doña Carmen no tiene hijos. La actividad económica de Doña Carmen es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de ocho años que se dedica este negocio y dio inicio con capital propio por medio de una amiga que le dijo que esta era una buena fuente de ingreso y recurre a Fundación León 2000 para solicitar financiamiento y así comienza con su negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Carmen son de seguir administrando su negocio de una buena forma. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita invertir en la compra de nuevos productos ya que se acerca la temporada de verano y sus clientes solicitan variedad de productos. Sus deseos son de viajar ala exterior para conocer otros países. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 7.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Carmen María S. C. is 45-years-old, married and doesn’t have any children. She has been selling a variety of merchandise for over 8 years. She started her business with her own capital at the suggestion of a friend who said it would be a good source of income. She turned to Fundación León 2000 for funding and her business took off.

Carmen plans to continue managing her business effectively. Since the summer season is approaching and customers will demand a variety of products, she will use this loan as working capital to invest in the purchase of new merchandise. Her dream is to travel abroad to learn about other countries. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 7000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jose De Los Santos

texts.es:
el sr. Jose de los Santos D. C. cosecha y vende cafe de dos tipos, desde hace mas de 10 años, durante todo este tiempo el ha adquirido mucha experiencia y buena clientela,  de esta manera va saliendo adelante con su negocio y lograr darle bienestar a su familia.
el esta casado y tiene una hija de 4 años la cual esta en la preparatoria de un kinder de esta localidad, con los ingresos de su negocio comple con todos los gastos familiares y las obligaciones financieras que tiene.
el solicita un credito ya que necesita capital para trabajo y diversificar su negocio, comprar mas producto y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y por lo tanto mejorar su ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. José de los Santos D. C. has been harvesting and selling two types of coffee for more than 10 years, and during this time he has acquired much experience and good clients. This way he is moving ahead with his business and is successful in offering well-being to his family.

He is married with a 4 year-old daughter who attends a local kindergarten. With the income from his business he covers the family expenses and his financial obligations. He requests a loan as he needs work capital, to diversify his business, buy more products, and meet his clients' demands and thus increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pergamino coffee and mantequilla coffee.

loans.name: Zula Saudah‘S Group

texts.en:
Saudah is 30 years of age, a single mother of three children, aged between 9 and 13. She owns a two-roomed house where she is living with four people, and she doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Saudah sells charcoal at her house in Naguru, one of the city suburbs .She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work from suppliers who get the charcoal from the villages; that is how she earns her living. Her monthly expenses include rent for her residence, which functions as her place of work, and school fees for her children.

Saudah sells to all categories of people and works seven days week. She has done this business for over two years now This is her sixth loan since she joined MCDT, and she has been with MCDT for three years, working with the same group mates. Saudah wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Ngại Nguyễn Thị (100060021) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc.  She is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Ngại owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Ngại has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2001, Ngại joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ngại has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  Ngại is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The loan will be the eighth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Ngại plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María Esperanza T. T. tiene 48 años, su estado civil es casada. María tiene 1 hijo y estudia en una escuela pública. La actividad económica de María es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, María tiene muy pocos recursos económicos y fue por una amiga decidió establecer este negocio, y mejorar su vida. Además esta agradecida por tener este humilde trabajo, que esta ubicado en su vivienda. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales y granos básicos. Su deseo es que su hijo logre terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
María Esperanza T. T. is 48, and she is married. María has one son; he goes to public school. María has a mini market. She has had this business for over five years. María has very few economic resources. It was because of a friend that she decided to establish this business and improve her life. Also, she is grateful to have this humble work, which is located in her home. The loan she is asking for is to buy sweets, natural soft drinks, and basic grains. Her wish is for her son to complete his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is a mother of seven. She is 40 years old and married. Bola sells provisions and drinks. Bola is a client of LAPO, a Kiva partner. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks

loans.name: Erica Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Erica Consuelo, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 29 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico de su hogar, motivada por su mamá emprendió un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos y amigos de su barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Ms. Erica Consuelo is a member of Mujeres Emprendedoras Community Bank in the District of Moyobamba, Moyobamba Province, State of San Martin. She is 29 years old and a single mother of three. She supports her children, all of whom go to school. Since she needed to contribute financially at home, and encouraged by her mother, Ms. Erica Consuelo launched a small grocery business with her first loan of S/.300.00. She was successful right from the start thanks to the high quality of her products, fair prices and excellent customer service. She currently operates this same business out of her home. Neighbors and local acquaintances are her main customers. With the loan of S/. 3,000.00, she will buy additional products to add variety to the merchandise she sells. She plans to buy rice and sugar in kilogram packages, eggs in cartons, cleaning products and personal hygiene items, packaged soft drinks, sweets and other products attractive to her customers. She is very happy with her endeavors and the service she provides and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for supporting people like her, who want to work and get ahead. She hopes the organization will be around for a long time and willing to help many more families and enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and improve her store offerings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Carlota Jose

texts.pt:
Carlota José M., de 42 anos de idade, Natural da cidade de Maputo, distrito de Maputo, Província de Maputo, viúva e mãe de 2 Filhos de 17 e 09 anos de idade, vive na casa própria em Macassa, estudou até 12ª Classe, nunca parou de estudar teve somente algumas paragens devido a sua deslocação para Manjacaze. Alem dos filhos sustenta a neta que vive com ela.

Em 1982 saiu para Manjacaze com o seu irmão que estava transferido para trabalhar lá onde estudou ate 6ª classe, depois se deslocou para cidade de Xai-xai para tirar o curso de professores, em 1988 regressou para Maputo onde começou a trabalhar na EP1 de Macassa. 

Carlota trabalha como Professora desde 1988 e o seu rendimento mensal actual é de 5.523,00Mt com os quais sustenta a sua família e consegue poupar para fazer face às despesas de melhoramento da sua residência.

Conheceu a Hluvuku-adsema através da sua vizinha, este é o seu primeiro empréstimo, nunca teve empréstimo em nenhuma outra instituição.

Com o empréstimo de 15.000,00MT, pretende melhorar a sua residência comprando vários materiais de construcao como chapa de zinco, areia, cimento, pedra e outros. O seu maior desafio e concluir a sua obra.
Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a outros empréstimos para mobiliar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Carlota José M. is 42 years old. She was born in the city of Maputo, district and province of the same name. She’s a widow and a mother of 2 children of 17 and 9. She owns her home in Macassa. She finished 12th grade, but she never stopped studying, except for some brief periods due to her relocation in Manjacaze. Besides her two children, she also supports her granddaughter who lives with her. In 1982, she moved to Manjacaze with her brother who was transferred to work there. She finished 6th grade there, and then she moved to the city of Xai-xai to obtain her teaching degree. In 1988, she moved back to Maputo where she began to work in EP1 (School grades from 1 through 5) in Macassa. Carlota works as a Teacher since 1988 and her current monthly salary reaches 5,523.00MT. With that money, she supports her family and manages to save to face the expenses of her home improvements. She met Hluvuku-adsema through her neighbor. This is her first loan and she never received any loans from any other association. With her 15,000.00MT she would like to make home improvements purchasing several construction materials such as zinc plates, sand, cement, stone and others. Her biggest challenge is to finish this project. She’s determined to repay this loan with no problems in order to access to other loans to be able to buy furniture for her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Akoua T. est une femme âgée de 59 ans mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit  à Adéta une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle voulait  profiter de la baisse des prix de mais pour faire un stock. Ainsi lorsqu’il aura une augmentation de prix de mais, elle pourra se servir de son stockage pour faire la préparation de la pate. Ainsi elle pourra alors augmenter très rapidement son bénéfice. Avec ses bénéfices, elle voulait construire son propre bar-restaurant et s’occuper de l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akoua T. is a 59-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children.  She lives in Adéta, a town located about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo.  She'd like to take advantage of the drop in corn prices in order to stock up.  So when there's an increase in corn prices, she'll then be able to make use of her stock for making cornmeal mash.  In this way, she can increase her profits very quickly.  With these profits, she would like to build her own bar-restaurant and to take care of her children's education.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking up on corn

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel  es una persona  muy trabajadora, ella tiene 43 años de edad, es madre de siete hijos, todos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, pues tiene un restaurante en el mercado número uno de la ciudad de Pucallpa, allí trabaja con algunas de sus hijas, ella empezó a vender sus menús (alimnetos)en una mesa, ahora es propietaria de un restaurante. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él es supervisor de una empresa. Ysabel es socia desde hace dos años del Banco Comunal “Dulce Vida II”, su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la apertura de su negocio. 
Con este crédito es de 1700 soles,comprará diversos productos e ingredientes para su restaurante, también comprará manteles para sus mesas. La meta de Ysabel es poder tener otro restaurante, pero quisiera construir este local en su casa y también seguir ayudando a su esposo.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a very hardworking person. She is 43 years old and is the mother of seven children, all of whom are grown up. She sells food for a living and has a restaurant in the number one market in the city of Pucallpa, where she works with some of her daughters. She began selling her food at a table, and now she is the owner of a restaurant. However, she counts on the support of her husband, who is the supervisor of a company. Ysabel has been a partner of the Banco Communal "Dulce Vida II" for two years. Her first loan was 300 soles, which she invested in the opening of her business. With this credit of 1,700 soles, she will buy diverse products and ingredients for her restaurant and will also buy tablecloths for her tables. Ysabel's goal is to be able to have another restaurant, but she would like to set up this business in her house and also continue helping her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy food products for her restaurant and tablecloths for the tables.

loans.name: Nelly Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Nelly Lainez es una dama muy trabajadora que se dedica al negocio de pulpería el cual tiene en su propia casa de habitación donde es visitada por sus clientes a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el anochecer.

Con muchos deseos de desarrollar el negocio, la señora Nelly ha iniciado a trabajar más arduamente y tiene la necesidad de llenar sus estantes de productos y para ello solicita un crédito para la compra de los productos principalmente comestibles para ofrecerlos en la pulpería y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.

loans.use: Compra de mercadería

loans.name: Andria

texts.en:
Andria A. is 38 years old and married with four children. She sells frozen foods, drinks and provisions to make a living.

Andria hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Nelly Nancy

texts.es:
La señora NELLY NANCY S. A., tiene 42 años, vive en el distrito de Las Delicias, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LUIS ALBERTO S.. Presenta estudios hasta 1ero. de secundaria porque debido a la falta de recursos económicos no pudo continuar estudiando y empezó a trabajar para ayudar a  su familia y cubrir sus propios gastos. Ella es soltera y no tiene hijos, se dedica la venta de arroz,  aceite, leche, jugos,  galletas,  gaseosas,  golosinas,  etc. en la tienda que tiene en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró tela de peluches, hilos, relleno de  fibra, algodón, etc. 
Con este crédito de 700.00 comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, atún, aceite, galletas, gaseosas, jugos, etc. para surtir su tienda que tiene en su casa.
Nelly sueña con ampliar su tienda y ganar cada día mas clientes para así poder obtener mayores ganacias.
texts.en:
Nelly Nancy S. A., 42, lives in the Las Delicias district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Luis Alberto S. Communal Bank. She went to school until her first year of high school. Due to the lack of economic resources, she could not continue studying. She started to work to help her family and to cover her own expenses. She is single and does not have children. She sells rice, oil, milk, juice, crackers, soft drinks, and sweets in the store that she has in her house. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought fabric for stuffed animals, thread, fiber stuffing, and cotton, etc. With this loan for 700 PEN she will buy rice, sugar, noodles, tuna, oil, crackers, soft drinks, and juice, etc. to stock the store she has in her house. Nelly dreams of expanding her store and gaining more customers everyday in order to get greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, noodles, tuna, oil, crackers, soft drinks, and juice, etc.

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
Chhuon L., 30 years old, lives with her family in the province of Kampong Chhnang in Cambodia. Her husband owns a car which he uses as a taxi. For over two years she has been working in the rice trade, buying rice directly from farmers and reselling it to earn a profit. Chhuon believes her business is doing well because she is acquiring more regular customers. She currently earns an average of $5 per day.

Chhuon's business is the main source of stable income for her family. In order to continue growing her business, Chhuon is asking for a loan to buy additional rice for future sales.

loans.use: To buy additional rice for future sales.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 36 years old and married with two children. She has a salon and has been in business for ten years, employing three people. She says the business is in a very busy location. She describes herself as hardworking and says that through loans from Faulu, she has been able to increase her monthly income.

Emily requested this loan of Kes 50,000 to purchase chemicals, seats and a hair dryer for her salon. She hopes to continue to improve her living standard and to expand her business to multiple salons.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, seats and a hair dryer for her salon

loans.name: Agnes M.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a primary school in Makeni. The school is divided into a Lower Primary School (classes one to three) and an Upper Primary School (classes four to six). The school was founded in 1974; it has a total of about 770 pupils with a staff of twenty-four teachers. Since its inception in 1974, the school has produced many of the professionals in town and in the country at large.

This school is seeking its second loan from SMT/Kiva Lenders. With their previous loan, staff of this institution were able to meet their most immediate financial challenges, like paying school fees for their children, buying a piece of land, tables and other furniture, and so on. Having completed repaid their loan, a set of ten new teachers have join the group to seek a new loan. With this loan, these teachers can again meet their immediate needs and with their monthly salaries, the school’s bursar will repay SMT/Kiva on their behalf.

Agnes M. L. (third from left) is the head teacher at the Lower Primary school and head of this loan team. L. is fifty-eight years of age. She was born in Bo, Sierra Leone's second capital city. L. is a widow with seven children, five of whom are already grown-ups and two still in school. She is seeking a loan from Kiva Lenders for the second time to enable her to pay school fees for her children. (Beneath are a group of teachers not present for the group snapshot.)

loans.use: Pay school fees and other school-related charges for her children

loans.name: Déguène

texts.fr: Déguène D. est âgée de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KA FALL depuis 3ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 07 prêts qu’elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle fait de l’embouche bovine, ovine et caprine. Ses bénéfices lui permettent d'assurer la prise en charge de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
Déguène D. is a 47 year-old married mother of six. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de KA FALL for three and a half years and has received 7 loans, all of which have been well-managed and repaid in a timely way. She is involved in the fattening of cattle, sheep and goats. The profits that she generates from this enable her to cater to her children's needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her livestock business

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Mrs. Thach C. is 56 years old. She lives in Koh Reas Kroam village, Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Son Sorm, are farmers who own a plot of land for cultivating. They have their own water machine to irrigate the field. In order to grow more, Mrs. Thach C. decided to ask for 1,000,000 KHR to buy gasoline and fertilizers for supporting the field. 

Mrs. Thach C. is the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory, three are housekeepers, and the youngest is a student in the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: Thérèse N. est une femme de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Saint Anne depuis 8 ans. Elle est vendeuse de fruits de saison tels que des oranges, des mandarines et de melons. Elle participe à l'amélioration de la santé et de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Thérèse N. is a 49-year-old woman, married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the «Banc Villageois » of Saint Anne for eight years. She sells seasonal fruits, such as oranges, mandarines, and melons. She participates in the improvement of her children's health and their schooling.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain her fruit-selling business

loans.name: Marilou's Group

texts.en:
Marilou C. is from the village of Gappal, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Marilou is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marilou is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a butcher shop. The main source of income for the business comes from butchering and selling pork in the market. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer D. 44 años, está casada con el padre D. sus 6 hijos, vive en su pequeña casa D. un piso, pero D. material noble.

Hace 10 años labora como empleada del hogar, este trabajo no es fácil ya que tiene que lidiar con los malos tratos D. algunas personas, pero sigue trabajando porque debe ayudar a cubrir los gastos D. su hogar, mientras que su esposo trabaja como albañil.  A ella le gustaría tener un propio negocio y dedicarse a la costura, actividad que le apasiona desD. su niña, pero por el momento debe seguir esforzándose junto a su esposo para ahorrar lo necesario para que en el futuro pueda comprar lo necesario para su taller D. costura y brindarles a sus hijos una  mejorar su calida D. vida.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas en las fechas señaladas. Asimismo, manifiesta su agradecimiento a todos los integrantes D. su banco comunal por permitirle ser parte del grupo y asegura que no defraudará su confianza. Con el dinero que solicita comprará maderas para el armado D. los pisos que realiza su esposo, así podrá realizar mejores acabado en sus trabajos y captará más clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa, 44, is married to the father of her 6 children; she lives in her small, one-story house maD. of substantial materials. For the last 10 years she has worked as a domestic employee; this isn't easy work because she has to put up with being treated poorly by some people but she continues to work because she has to contribute to household expenses while her husband works as a bricklayer. She would like to have her own tailor shop, an activity that has been her passion since she was a little girl, but for the moment must continue to make the effort with her husband to save what they need so that in the future she can buy what she needs for her sewing shop and proviD. her children with a better quality of life. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She also states her gratituD. to all the members of the communal bank for allowing her to be part of the group and assures them that she will not disappoint them. She will use the funds requested to buy wood for her husband to install flooring so that he can proviD. better finishes and thus capture more customers..

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood for her husband to use in installing floors.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Garri (cassava flakes) is a staple food in Nigeria and it is gotten from cassava. It can be eaten with soup, peanuts, coconut and beans. She also sells tubers of yam. She is a hard working woman and she is so determined to lift her business above poverty. Charity is married to a commercial driver. They are blessed with 5 children. She needs a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more garri to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more garri (cassava flakes) to sell

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, in an apartment. Dolgorsuren operates a spare car parts trading business with one of her daughters at the local Ogoomor market. She sells all type of spare parts, but specializes in parts for Korean cars, for which there is high demand in Mongolia. Dolgorsuren sells her products from one shipping container and her daughter Tuyatsetseg sells from another shipping container. Her daily sales revenue is 50,000 – 80,000 tugrugs (~ 35 – 60 USD), and her daily profit is 10,000 – 20,000 tugrugs (~ 10 USD). Korean spare parts demand is very high, especially during the spring when the number of drivers increases with the end of winter. With her business profit, she has built a house for her family and has been paying tuition fees for her children.  Dolgorsuren is a very hardworking person and says, “My dream is one day to open a large spare parts trading shop". She is requesting a 3,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase more Korean spare parts at wholesale prices and resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more automobile spare parts

loans.name: Bo

texts.en: Bo S., 26, is married and resides with her husband and child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She sells porridge and Chinese noodles for an income of about USD 2.3 per day, while her husband, a construction foreman, earns an income of USD 3.3 per day to help cover the family expenses.  Bo is now requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits earned to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Bo is pictured with her husband here.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Leonor Narcisa

texts.es:
Leonor A. de 45 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas, es divorciada, pero tiene cuatro hijos que ya están casados. Vive sola en su casa de cemento, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. 

Leonor empezó a ser comerciante desde muy joven ya que toda su familia es comerciante ella también quiso ser igual y tener sus propios ingresos. Invirtió sus ahorros en ropa, perfumes, cremas, artículos de hogar etc. Trabaja también como vendedora Yanbal (es una compañía que ayuda a las mujeres para que sean vendedoras de cosméticos y ganen un porcentaje de comisiones). 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes y ropa para tener mas variedad en lo que vende. En el futuro quiere comprar un carro para llevar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Leonor Arguelllo is 45 years old and lives in the urban area in Las Orquideas; she is divorced and has four children who are all married. She lives in a cement home which has basic services (water, electricity, etc.). Leonor began as a saleswoman when she was very young as her whole family works in sales and she wanted to do the same to earn her own income. She invested her savings in clothing, perfumes, creams, and home products. She also works selling Yanbal (a company that helps women to sell cosmetics and earn a commission). She will use this loan to buy perfumes and clothing to have a greater variety of products to sell. In the future, she would like to buy a car to carry her merchandise to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfume, clothing

loans.name: Irma Del Rosario

texts.es: Irma Del Rosario tiene 31años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella comenzó como vendedora una casa comercial por lo que las ventas las realiza por catálogos pues así ofrece a sus clientes la variedad de sus productos. Poco a poco fue incrementando su número de clientela pero con esfuerzo y dedicación ella invitaba a sus amigas para que sean vendedoras. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cremas, perfumes, colonias, lápiz labial, sombras y cremas. Su deseo es seguir con este negocio que con mucho esfuerzo ha tenido.
texts.en:
Irma Del Rosario is 31 years old. She sells cosmetics, and she has been is this business for over five years. She has two minor children under her care. She started as a seller for a commercial house. Her sales are by catalog. That way she offers her customers a variety of products. Little by little the number of her customers was getting larger. With effort and dedication she invited her friends to become sellers. The loan she is requesting is to buy creams, perfumes, colognes, lipsticks, and eye shadow. Her wish is to continue with this business that she has by working hard.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kateba Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Kateba” group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They have applied for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to improve their businesses.
 
John K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. John was born in Makeni. He is about 40 years of age, married to a businesswoman and they have 2 children who are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. John is a tailor and has been in this profession for many years now. With the help of this loan, John will buy working materials like zippers, thread, poplin, other cloth, etc.

loans.use: Buy working materials like zippers, thread, poplin, other cloth, etc.

loans.name: Grettel

texts.es:
Grettel V. M.   es una  joven de 28  años de edad quien vive con su esposo y 2 hijos en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías.
Desde hace muy poco tiempo doña Grettel  ha querido desarrollarse como microempresaria, con un pequeño proyecto dedicado a la  producción de leche y algunos derivados, tales como natilla y queso. 
Dice estar muy agradecida con este proyecto, ya que le ha generado una mayor confianza, ha servido como una fuente de ingresos para mejorar sus condiciones a pesar de las dificultades económicas que hay en la región 
Actualmente Grettel  requiere un préstamo de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) destinados a la  compra de una vaca lechera. Esto le permitirá aumentar la producción de leche y por ende la de sus productos los cuales aseguran ser muy demandados en la comunidad ya que son de muy buena calidad.
Doña Grettel es socia de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Grettel V. M. is a 28-year old young woman who lives with her husband and two children in a community called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in the the province of Cartago. It is a small rural community with a population of approximately 2,000. The local people are milk and coffee producers. The area is hilly and much of the land is tropical rainforest. It’s very attractive with two lovely lakes, coffee plantations, and dairies mixed in with the rainforest. In the last little while Grettel has wanted to develop her small dairy business with a project involving milk products such as cream and cheese. She says that she is very pleased with the business because it's built her confidence and served as a source of income for improving her life despite the problems that the community faces. Currently Grettel needs a loan of 500,000 colones with which to buy a cow. This will enable her to increase milk production and other dairy products which are sure to be in great demand in the community since they are of high quality. Sra. Grettel is a member of the Producers’ Association of El Sauce, one of the hundred member organisations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her second loan and she hopes that it will enable her to continue developing both on a personal and on an economic level.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia R. is a married woman who lives in GK Village, Brgy Villareal, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a fish vending business.  

Aurelia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Aurelia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus raising her family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 6th cycle loan, Aurelia is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her business in order to continue to save up for future renovations of her house. Aurelia R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.en:
Gumercinda I. is a married woman who lives in Ibabao, Mactan, Lapu-lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  shell handicrafts and an Avon dealership. Her husband, Celestino I. who is 52 years old, works as a woodcarver. They have 5 children who are 13 to 24 years old. 

Gumercinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 cycle loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gumercinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000 helped increase her monthly profit to PHP 20,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 3rd cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase more materials for her shell handicraft business. She can then continue to save for the future, expand her business and become an exporter of shell handicrafts. Gumercinda I. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase materials

loans.name: Angela Coronado

texts.es: Ángela Coronado Antón V. es una mujer madura de 50 años de edad, quien vende frutas en el mercado oriental, ella en ocasiones incluso consigue la venta completa de la cosecha alguna de las frutas que ella siembra. Ella tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esta labor y es su pareja quien le ayuda y le apoya en estas actividades.
texts.en:
Ángela Coronado Antón V. is a 50-year-old woman who sells fruits in the eastern market. From time to time, she manages to sell the whole harvest of fruits that she has grown. She has been doing this for the last five years. Her partner helps and supports her in these activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of goods

loans.name: Jorge Dante

texts.es:
Jorge es un padre de familia de 21 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su menor hijo en el anexo San Ramón del caserío Fanupe Barrio Nuevo, una zona rural que forma parte del distrito de Mórrope de la provincia de Lambayeque. La zona se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace dos años. El cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí, el ofrece a sus clientes productos de consumo diario a los cuales no tienen fácil acceso debido a que la zona se encuentra lejos del pueblo central. El negocio cuenta con buena acogida y gracias a los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad sustenta los gastos de su familia.

Jorge desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas mercadería de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y percibir un mayor número de ganancias. Como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Jorge es un padre trabajador y muy entregado a su familia. Diariamente da lo mejor de si para sacarlos adelante y brindarles la calidad de vida que necesitan. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y confiable.
texts.en:
Jorge is a family man. He is 21 years old and he lives together with his wife and their young son in the region of San Ramon in Caserio Fanupe, Barrio Nuevo. The region is a rural zone that is part of the district of Morrope in the province of Lambayeque. Region is located more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has had his grocery store for two years. He has set up a small store in a section of his house. There he sells products of every day use to his clients, who do not have easy access to such products from the main village for its far distance. The business is successful and it is thanks to this source of income that he is able to cover the family's expenses. Jorge wishes to expand his business and to purchase more merchandise, to increase his sales and see an improvement in his earnings. He does not have enough capital funds to make this happen on his own. He requests a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles. Jorge is a hard working and very devoted father. Every day he gives his all to provide his family with the quality of life they need. People know him for being calm and trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory to restock his grocery store.

loans.name: Sulpicia

texts.en: Sulpicia H. is a married woman who lives in Manghilao, Masaba, Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: abaca (a plant fiber) weaving and farming. Her husband Dionson H., who is 50 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. She has six children who range from 11 to 28 years old. Sulpicia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sulpicia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,400, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to purchase additional stock so that she can continue to save up for the future education of their children and improve their living conditions. Sulpicia H. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase of additional stock

loans.name: Gezardo

texts.en:
Gezardo D. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 41 years old. Gezardo is married. To make a living, Gezardo operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from gathering and selling seaweed to the market. Gezardo is currently renovating his house so that his family will have a better shelter. He works hard to earn better and be able to finish their house.

Gezardo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gezardo is requesting a new loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Mari-Grace

texts.en:
Mari-grace L. is from the town of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. She is 28 years old. Mari-grace is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Mari-grace owns & operates a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport services in the local community. Mari-grace has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

Mari-grace joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mari-grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. Mari-grace is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Mari-grace from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Aura Lidia

texts.es: La Sra. Aura Lidia E. G. ella es trabajadora activa del Ministerio de Salud desempeñándose como Auxiliar de Enfermería tiene  veinte y cinco años de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Aura Lidia E. G. is an active worker for the Ministry of Health. She is an Assistant Nurse and has worked for this institution for twenty five years. She is presently married. She has taken out six loans from CEPRODEL and has taken out each one to purchase construction materials to enlarge and improve her home.  The loans with Ceprodel have really benefitted her since she has been able to improve the quality of life for herself and for her family.

loans.use: Sand, cement, stone, gravel, tiles.

loans.name: Juan Ronald

texts.es:
Juan Ronald G. M. tiene 24 años. Es soltero,  vive con los padres,  vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No Tiene hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño mejorar la situación económica.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juan Ronald G. M. is 24 years old, single and lives with this parents in the area of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos, he has no children.

The members of the V.R.C. El Recreo group mainly work in the agricultural field, especially growing short-cycle crops like corn, rice, soy and beans, the communal bank has 12 members. All the members are from the same area of San Vicente in Las Lomas, Cantón Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Juan is in agriculture and has grown corn for over 5 years. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the markets of the same city.

Juan needs the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers to grow corn. The loan will help him meet his financial needs. His crops face infestations and disease and climate changes. Juan’s dream is to improve his economic situation.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: N. Aisha lives in the Kawala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children who are not in school. She also takes care of additional family members (brother's children).    Aisha has a business selling second hand clothes.  She has been in this business for four years and she works seven days out of every week. Aisha sells her products door-to-door by means of retail. Aisha has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes. The main business challenge(s) for Aisha include rainy season and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are getting a permanent business premise and buying a plot of land.   Aisha lives in a home that she rents without access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Petua

texts.en:
Petua N. lives in the Mengo MacKay neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her father).    

Petua has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for six years and she works seven days out of every week. Petua sells her products at the market, by means of retail.    

Petua has requested from MCDT SACCO a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Petua include transportation and defaulters.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand her business. Petua lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Elsy

texts.es: Elsy, de 41 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus 2 hijos, de los cuales solo se hace cargo del menor, pues el mayor ya se mantiene y trabaja; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Los días de esta emprendedora mujer pasan tranquilos, pues ella se dedica a la atención de la tienda que tiene instalada en su casa. Desde hace 4 años, esta emprendedora dama decidió empezar con un negocio que le permita obtener ganancias y también atender a sus hijos, es así como instala su tienda donde no solo ofrece comestibles si no además adornos y diversos artículos para el hogar, es por esta razón que su tienda es muy visitada por sus vecinos. Le gusta mucho su labor porque es tranquila y mientras comercializa se entretiene conversando con sus vecinos, quienes suelen comprarle por los buenos precios de su mercadería. Como siempre piensa en el futuro ya tiene pensado ampliar su tienda para ofrecer lo  mejor a sus clientes, y de esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso. Es el octavo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Elsy tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en comestibles para surtir mejor su tienda, pues debe ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes durante la campaña navideña que esta próxima.
texts.en:
Elsy, 41, lives in her own house with her 2 children. She looks after the youngest child only, as the eldest already works and earns a living. Together they strive to get ahead every day. The days of this enterprising woman are peaceful, because she manages a store installed in her own home. Four years ago she decided to start a business that would allow her to make a profit and also care for her children. That's why she opened the store, where she not only sells food, but also decorative and household items. The store is well liked by her neighbours, who buy because of the good prices of the merchandise. She loves her work because it is quiet and she enjoys talking to her neighbours when she is selling to them. 

She always thinks about the future and she already has plans to expand her store in order to offer the best to her customers and make progress. This is her eighth loan with MFP and she is committed to replaying it on time, because she doesn't want to disappoint those who are helping her to continue to work. Elsy is planning to invest the requested loan in the purchase of foodstuff to stock up her store, because she wants to offer the best to her customers during the Christmas season.

loans.use: Buy assorted products to stock up her store.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 32 years old and the mother of two.  She runs a small store called Midside Shop so as to earn a living.  She also sells charcoal and rents out houses.  She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to build more rental houses.

As a business-lady, she faces a lot of competition, but she works hard to provide the best quality products to her customers.  In future she aspires to open a supermarket, and also dreams of buying a piece of land.

loans.use: To build more rental houses

loans.name: Ruth Melania

texts.es:
la sra. Ruth Melania S. se dedica al comercio, tiene una pulpería la cual opera bajo el nombre de “pulpería Marvin” su negocio esta ubicado en la Terminal de transportes frente al estacionamiento de buses de San Matías.
El crecimiento en su negocio es notable, los clientes la prefieren por la atención que les brinda y los precios que les da, ya que su negocio es uno de los que luce de mejor surtido en ese sector y tiene a la venta los productos de mayor consumo diario, muchos viajeros antes de salir a sus lugares de origen aprovechan para comprar lo  más necesario de consumo diario y llevar a sus hogares. 

Doña Ruth vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo uno depende de ellos, el compañero de doña Ruth se dedica a la reparación de llantas para vehículos.

El hijo que actualmente depende del matrimonio es un niño especial ya que padece de hidrocefalia y la única persona que lo cuida es doña Ruth.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y para los gastos de su hijo.
texts.en:
Ruth Melania S. is a merchant, she has a grocery store which she operates under the name "Pulperia Marvin". Her business is located in the transportation terminal across from the San Matias bus parking lot. 

The growth of her business is remarkable. Her customers prefer her because of the attention that she gives them and because of her prices since her business is one of the ones that is best stocked in the area and she sells products that are highly consumed daily. Before they leave, many passengers buy the necessary products for daily consumption to take to their homes. 

Ruth lives with a live-in partner and has three children of which only one is dependent on them. Her partner repairs car tires. 

Her son who is currently dependent on them is a special child since he suffers from hydrocephaly and the only person who cares for him in Ruth. 

She will use the loan to purchase merchandise to stock her business. She needs the profits to cover her home's expenses and for expenses for her son.

loans.use: Purchase products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El Sr. Félix es casado se dedica al transporte urbano hace varios años, vive la zona de thago loma vive en casa propia, su casita se encuentra a unas cuadras de la escuela de la zona, su esposa se dedica  a la venta de verduras, tienen 3 hijos pequeños   el sr. Félix es muy conocido en su trabajo por su amabilidad y responsabilidad, trabaja de lunes a sábado los domingos se dedica al comercio de papa, es una familia muy trabajadora, el préstamo lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción y poder terminar de construir su casa, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Félix is married and has worked in public urban transportation services for several years.  He lives in the Thago Loma zone in his own house.  His little house is located a few blocks from the local school.  His wife is a vegetable merchant.  They have three small children.

Félix is very well known at work because of his kindness and responsibility.  He works from Monday to Saturday.  On Sundays he’s a potato merchant.

It is a very hard working family.  The loan will be used to buy building materials and supplies to finish building his house.  He is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: 'determiners' Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of two borrowers called 'Determiners'.  He is 36 years old, married, and has three children who are between the ages of 9 to 2 years. He is a college graduate.
 
For eight years, he has been selling milk in Duala Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 15,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars business loan to buy more cartons of milk for resale.

He describes himself as an easy-going man whose dreams are to improve his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of milk for resale

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe P., 52, aims to go against the common notion of mediocrity with regard to her business. She is happily married to Demetrio and they are blessed with children who are currently studying. The family lives in Bagong Silang, Pasay City.

Fe has been buying and selling golf balls for several years. She buys the balls at wholesale prices and then sells them at a piecemeal rate. Her store is located outside the Philippine Navy golf course in Fort Bonifacio, which is very accessible to all golf players who are her immediate customers. Nelia earns an estimated monthly income of PHP 10,000.

But Fe knows she can do more to produce more. She is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to help her expand her business. She intends to use the loan to buy more quantities of quality golf balls to sell. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store.

Fe is doing everything possible to see her business grow and stabilize because she wants to become successful in life, be it on a personal or business level. She also prays that her children will be successful someday and land stable jobs. As a CCT community partner, Fe faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy golf balls

loans.name: Kulyara's Group

texts.en:
Kulyara U., 52, is the leader of this group. She lives in Karabalta in the northern part of the country, population 38,700. She has been happy to live there and raise her kids but several years ago a severe tragedy hit her family. She was left a widow with 6 children to feed. All these years she has relied on her dairy business to provide her kids with at least the basic needs. Now, her children are grown up and live on their own; the youngest one is 16. 

Kulyara’s youngest son assists in processing milk and selling it wholesale in Bishkek market. In five years the number of dairy cows in her household has greatly increased. The business was started with initial capital of 2,000 soms and now the monthly returns reach twice that amount. 

Kylyara wants to give a worthwhile education to her youngest son and plans to increase her savings. Kulyara, along with the other members of the group, is in strong need of financial assistance because she would like to invest more in her business and get higher returns. 


          --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase milk

loans.name: James Ndungu

texts.en:
James has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. He is 52 years old and is married to Felista Wanjira. They have five children.  

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, James hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: German Clever

texts.es: German tiene 41 años de edad. Es padre soltero de dos hijos. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Se dedica a la venta de ladrillos. Cuenta con muchos años de experiencia, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona.  Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de ladrillos para vender. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con esta inversión, podrá generar más ingresos y mejor solventar sus gastos familiares. Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
German is a 41-year-old single father of two children. He lives with his family in the district of Motupe, an agricultural region in the province of Lambayeque, which is an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He sells bricks. He has many years of experience and knows the line of work very well. He has an established clientele in the area. 

He wants to increase his business by buying more bricks to sell. For this reason, he has asked for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. With this investment, he will generate more income and be able to better cover his family's costs. He thanks the Kiva lenders for their support in growing his business.

loans.use: to buy more bricks to sell

loans.name: Ricardo Jose

texts.es: Ricardo José, tiene 24 años, está casado y vive con su hijo y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El lo que pretende con el préstamo es comprar una buena parte de ganado, ya que actualmente tiene una buena oferta. El cuenta con la experiencia en la compra y venta de ganado pues este es su negocio que le brinda el alimento diariamente. El quiere generar ganancias para su bienestar y la de su familia y así poderles dar una mejor calidad de vida a futuro. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos, pero se le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades para que pueda continuar adelante.
texts.en: Ricardo Jose is 24 years old, married, and he lives with his son and wife. They are is greatest priorities. He plans on purchasing a good number of cattle, especially because he has a good offer. He has experience in the buying and selling of cattle. This is the business earns him a daily living. He wants to generate more income for his wellbeing and that of his family, to provide them with a better quality of life in the future. He has not had any previous loans. But a loan with greater benefits was granted to him to help him continue moving forward.

loans.use: to purchase a number of livestock.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: Maria De La Concepción tiene 59 años. Doña Maria tiene 4 hijos de 2, 8, 17 y 18 años a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta ropa, es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, por lo que disfruta mucho de su negocio. Hace más de 16 años que  se dedica a este negocio, dio inicio a su pequeño negocio por el deseo de superación ya que tenía que mantener a sus hijos.  El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y el dinero será utilizado para la compra de vestidos, trajes, pantalones, camisas, faldas camisolas. El deseo de Maria es de proporcionarles a sus hijos la educación necesaria para que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en: Maria De La Concepcion is 59 years old. Maria has 4 children in her care, aged 2, 8, 17, and 18. Her business activity is the sale of clothing. She is an achiever and a very enterprising woman who loves her business. She has been in business for more than 16 years. She started out her small business with the dream of improving, especially because she had to support her children. The loan will be used as working capital and the funds will be used to purchase dresses, suits, pants, shirts, skirts, and undergarments. Maria's dream is to provide her children with the education they need to have a good career.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, suits, pants, shirts, skirts, and undergarments.

loans.name: Dilrabohon's Group

texts.en:
