loans.use: build a new education room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita V. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan Cotabato. She is 64 years old. Amelita is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Amelita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Amelita has been engaged in her business for over 32 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Amelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. Amelita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Amelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: La Sra. Jenny se dedica a la venta de ariculos en remate ya sean estos aretes que hoscilan entre uno y dos bolivianos medias, juguetes y otros mas.  Ella vive en habitaciones en anticrético juntamente con su esposo Roberto y su pequeño niño, el esposo es transportista y le ayuda con los gastos familiares.  El destino del credito es para abasteserce de una mayor variedad de articulos y tambien terminar de pagar el ingreso de su minibus al sindicato donde su esposo trabaja con el mismo, uno de los deseos de la Sra. Jenny es el de comprarse una casita y poder ir a vivir con toda su familia, es muy trabajadora siempre pensando en brindar una mejor calidad de vida  a su familia, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Jenny works in the bargain sale business, selling products such as earring, their price fluctuating between 1 to 2 bolivianos, tights, stockings, toys and more. She lives with her husband Roberto and their young son in an “anticrético” house (a housing system in which one grants a loan to the owner of the house one wants to live in for a period of time: if the owner does not give the money back to the lender when the contract expires, the lender keeps the house). Her husband is a driver, and he helps her with the family expenses. The loan will be used to obtain a wider variety of products and to extinguish the tax for the minibus that is due to the union her husband works for. One of Jenny’s desires is to succeed in buying a small house for her family to live in. She is a very hard-working woman, always concerned about offering a better quality of life to her family. She is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Rwensinga Twimukye, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
The produce sales business is very much liked by many entrepreneurs here in Uganda and this is where A. Levi has banked his savings to earn more profit.

The married father of five started up a grocery store dealing in dry foods, especially cereals, ten years ago in Omukafunjo, Ibanda. Due to his hard work and determination, Levi has been able to run this business and it earns him profits of 80,000 Ugandan shillings monthly.

With this loan, Levi is looking forward to restocking his business which will benefit him in the market and also attract many customers to his shop. Earning more revenue and expanding his business is his main motive in this case so as to live a self-sustaining life.

Levi belongs to a group of members who are on their 14th loan.

loans.use: To restock his business

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 62 años, comparte su vida a lado de su esposa y de su último hijo de 14 años, juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas de 20 años tiene su establecimiento donde vende todo tipo de artículos de  ferretería, instalada dentro de su propio domicilio, en donde estratégicamente esta ubicada en una avenida  muy transitada de su barrio. De esa manera le facilita el trabajo, ya que son muchos quienes transitan cerca y acuden a su establecimiento. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposan en donde atiende a sus clientes. Por el momento desea incrementar de mercadería para su  ferretería. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que es muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con éste crédito que recibirá, comprará tuberías de plástico para instalaciones eléctricas.
texts.en:
Jorge is 62 years old and shares his life with his wife and their youngest son who is 14. They live together in their own home. For more than 20 years, Jorge has operated an establishment where he sells all types of hardware items. The store is located in his house, which is strategically located on one of the busiest streets in the neighborhood. This makes his work easier since many people who walk by come into his establishment. Sometimes his wife helps attend to the customers. At the moment, Jorge wants to increase the inventory of merchandise in his hardware store.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Jorge is very responsible with his payments. He thanks everyone responsible for issuing the loan he requested because it will be very useful in advancing his business. The loan he received will be used to buy plastic tubing for electrical installations.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastic tubing to add to his inventory

loans.name: Huaycheñitas Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal German Busch se reúne la Asociación Comunal Huaycheñitas,es un grupo de 8 personas estusiastas y alegres.

La presidenta es Francisca de 34 años tiene el negocio de venta de comida, el cual emprendió por iniciativa propia hace 4 años aproximadamente. Francisca vende en la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto todos los días  de 9 de la mañana a 3 de la tarde. Con los ingresos que se genera puede cubrir las necesitades básicas de sus 5 hijos. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, fideo y papa.

Las demás integrantes de este grupo tienen diferentes negocios que se dedican a la producción, servicio y comercio.
texts.en:
The Huaycheñitas Communal Bank meets at the German Busch branch office. It is a group of eight enthusiastic, cheerful people. The group president is Francisca, who is 34 years old and has had a business selling meals for the past four years. She launched the business on her own initiative. Francisca works in La Ceja neighborhood of the city of El Alto each day from 9am to 3pm. She uses the income from her business to pay for the basic needs of her five children. She needs this loan to buy ingredients like rice, noodles and potatoes. The other group members have different businesses in the production, service and commerce sectors.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Compra de insumos

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha C., 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean temples. She sells porridge and fruit for an income of $1.50 per day. Her husband sells Cambodian traditional cakes, earning an income of $1.50 per day. 

C. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport cakes to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike to transport cakes to sell

loans.name: Afiavi

texts.fr: S. exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits de beauté. elle fait ce commerce depuis 2006 dans sa propre boutique qu'elle a appelé "LYDIC BEAUTY CENTER", sa clientèle se compose de femme de tout âge; elle exercee seule cette activité dans son quartier ce qui lui fait bénéficier d'une situation de monopole et d'avoir une forte demande. cette demande l'oblige à gonfler son stock de marchandises pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle avec 3  cartons de produits de beauté, 4 cartons de mèches, 24 perruques et divers.
texts.en:
S. makes a living selling beauty products. She began her business in 2006 with her own store called "Lydic Beauty Center". Her clients are women of all ages. She is the only one in her neighborhood, so that she monopolizes the business and faces a very high demand. She requests this loan to increase her stock of products in order to satisfy her customers' demand. She will buy three boxes of cosmetics, four boxes of hair extensions, 24 wigs and several other products.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Las Aliadas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Las Aliadas se encuentra integrado por Elena Francisca Rodríguez, Esther del Carmen Gómez A. y Amada Julia O. Calero. Elena, coordinadora del grupo, trabaja de conserje pero también vende los días domingo donas, fritangas y tortillas, en sus inicios ella vendía cajetas de manera ambulante. Esther vende repochetas, refrescos, enchiladas, sandias y otros rubros y Julia en su casa de habitación vende gaseosas, panes, helados y chiverías, en sus inicios sólo vendía gaseosas y panes. Ellas utilizaran el crédito para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
The Los Aliadas solidarity group has three members: Elena Francisca Rodríguez, Esther del Carmen Gómez A. and Amada Julia O. Calero. Elena, the group leader, works as a secretary but also has a business selling donuts, fried snacks and tortillas on Sundays. In the beginning she sold caramels as a street vendor. Esther sells repochetas [similar to quesadillas], soft drinks, enchiladas, watermelon and other items.Julia sells sodas, bread, ice cream and snack foods from her home. In the beginning she only sold sodas and break. The borrowers will use the loan to purchase more products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Dominga Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Dominga M. Díaz   ella  es Trabajadora activo  del colegio público “Instituto Nacional de San Rafael Del Sur”  desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Secundaria, tiene  veinte y cuatro  años de trabajar para esta empresa,. Ha tenido  dieciocho créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este crédito lo está solicitando para la reparación de su baño,  los cuales le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Dominga M. Díaz works for the public school “Instituto Nacional de San Rafael Del Sur” as a secondary school teacher. She has worked for this school for 34 years. She has taken 18 loans with CEPRODEL, and they have helped her to buy construction materials to improve her home. With this loan she is requesting she will repair her bathroom. These loans have benefited her greatly, since in this way she has been able to improve the living conditions of herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and stone

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings.

loans.name: Ranie

texts.en:
Ranie T. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Ranie is single. To make a living, Ranie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling a variety of food products in the local community. Ranie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ranie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ranie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ranie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en:
Gulnar M. is a 47-year-old mother of seven children. She is a teacher of the Kyrgyz language in a school in Kara-Balta town and her husband also works as a teacher in a medical college.  They have a very united family and support each other in all activities.  Unfortunately, the salaries of teachers are very low and Gulnar’s family needs an additional source of income. 

In 2000, they decided to engage in cattle breeding with initial capital of 5,000 KGS. Everyone in Gulnar’s family works hard and they have managed to develop their farm and expand their herd to 15 sheep.  With the revenue, Gulnar was able to reconstruct her house. 

Now, Gulnar plans to use this loan of 60,000 KGS to further expand her herds for fattening and resale. In the future, Gulnar plans to by a car for her beloved family. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Julio Ariel

texts.es: JULIO ARIEL T. M.,Trabaja como Higienista en  Commema  en el Mercado Candelaria de Managua, es padre de familia de un niño y este se encuentra en e dad escolar, el prestamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales electricos para su casa de habitacion.
texts.en: Julio Ariel T. M. works as a cleaner for Commema (Corporación Municipal de Mercados de Managua) in Managua's Candelaria Market.  He has one school-age child. The loan which he is requesting will be used to buy electrical materials for his house.

loans.use: To improve his house, replacing his electrical system

loans.name: Joffre Antonio

texts.es:
Joffre Antonio  V. Z. tiene 40 años. Vive en Unión Libre,  vive con la compañera y con los hijos,  vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.
 
Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Joffre se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño comprar terrenos para seguir en el negocio.
Le gusta manejar el carro.
texts.en:
Joffre Antonio V. Z. is 40 years old and lives in a common law marriage with his partner and 2 children. They live in the Ventanas area in the Los Ríos Province.

The members of the V.R.C. El Recreo group mainly work in the agricultural field, especially growing short-cycle crops like corn, rice, soy and beans, the communal bank has 12 members. All the members are from the same area of San Vicente in Las Lomas, Cantón Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

Joffre is in agriculture and has grown corn for over 5 years. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the markets of the same city.

Joffre needs the loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn crops. The loan will help him to meet his financial needs. Some problems that he faces are plagues and disease and climate change. His dream is buy land to keep working in the field.

Joffre enjoys driving his car.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Laly Missehounton

texts.fr: LALY MISSEHOUNTON D. C. est née le 27 septembre 1967 à Adjohoun  dans la commune de l’Ouémé au Bénin. D. C. est mariée à ALKARY Alassane, un magasinier et est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple vit à Lokokoukoumè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji et à quatre personnes à charge. Pour venir en aide à son mari, D. C. mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d’année la vente de Akpan, de Tapioka (bouillie à base d’amidon de manioc et de maïs accompagné de sucre, du lait, et de la glace). C’est à  Dantokpa, marché  international du Beinin que D. C. achète ses produits.  D. C. a déjà bénéficié de cinq crédits auprès de ALIDé qui ont été tous bien remboursés. C’est toujours dans le but d’améliorer la qualité de son repas que D. C. sollicite un nouveau crédit auprès de ALIDé.  D. C. ambitionne augmenter son stock de produit.
texts.en: D. C. Laly Missehounton was born on September 27, 1967 in Adjohoun, in Ouémé community in Benin. D. C. is married to Alassane ALkary, a warehouseman ,and is the mother of five children, all of whom go to school. The spouses live in Lokokoukoumè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, and have four additional persons to support. In order to help her husband, D. C. has been selling “akpan” [ corn patties] and tapioca (a dish based on manioc and corn starch, with the addition of sugar, milk and ice) for about fifteen years. D. C. buys her groceries in Dantokpa, at the international market of Benin. D. C. already  obtained loans from ALDIé five times in the past and repaid all of them well. With the same goal of improving the quality of her cooking, D. C. is seeking a new loan from ALID. She would like to expand her product stock.

loans.use: Purchasing  corn, sugar, milk, rice, etc

loans.name: Assou

texts.fr: Assou a 40 et est marié. IL a 3 enfants.  Pour répondre aux besoins de ses enfants, il exerce la cordonnerie et associe la fabrication de chaussures.  IL cumule dans cette activité près de 9 ans déjà. IL achète les matières premières de fabrication à Bè et au grand marché. Après la fabrication, les chaussures sont vendus dans un atelier dans le quartier Afagnakomé. Il demande un prêt pour acquérir  4 douzaines de semelle et  10 douzaines de cuir.
texts.en:
Assou is 40 years old and married with three children. 

In order to provide for his children, he works as a cobbler and shoe-maker. He has almost nine years of experience in this activity. 

He buys the raw materials in Bè and at the big market. Once manufactured, the shoes are sold in a shop located in the Afagnakomé district. 

He is seeking a loan to buy four dozen soles and ten dozen pieces of leather.

Purchase of raw materials

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for shoe repair and shoe-making

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas.
La señora Marina es una de las integrantes y se desempeña como chipera (vendedora de chipas), ella vende las chipas en varios lugares con concurrencia de la genta especialmente a la gente que viaja, por ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de chipa para esta época ya que mucha gente que viaja hacia el interior del país para la fiestas.
texts.en:
The group named "Mujeres Unidas" is formed from several individuals who are neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. 

Each of the members has their own business, including sales, and fast food.

Marina is a member of the group and she sells biscuits. She sells biscuits in various well traveled locales, especially focusing on travelers. She requests a loan to purchase biscuits for this time of year when there are many holiday travelers in the country.

loans.use: To purchase biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Deus

texts.en: Deus is a forty-year-old married male with nine children who owns a house in Kasese. He has been dealing in an alcohol business for the last ten years, which he started with five jerrycans and now has thirty of them. His hardship is some customers' delay in paying him. His vision is to expand his business to two hundred jerrycans. Deus intends to use the loan to buy more jerrycans of alcohol to resell.

loans.use: To buy jerrycans of alcohol to resell

loans.name: Carmen Rosario

texts.es: La señora Carmen vive en la casa de su suegra con su esposo y sus dos hijos quienes siguen en el colegio su esposo trabajo como oficial y ella vende zapatos, cosméticos por catalogo también cocina cuando tiene algunos contratos por que no le alcanza con el sueldo de su esposo ya que son cuatro en su familia y el estilo de vida de ahora no le da para todos los gastos,  por ese motivo tiene que buscar la manera de ganar unos cuantos centavos mas para poder sobresalir pero lo va muy bien en  el negocio de la venta de zapatos y cosméticos ya que no le quita mucho tiempo y puede estar con sus hijos mas tiempo es por eso que saco el préstamo para la compra de mercadería de cosméticos que se encuentran en promoción y así de esta forma incrementar su capital de trabajo, es una persona muy trabajadora siempre viendo a que actividad dedicarse, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señora Carmen lives in her mother-in-law's house with her husband and two children, who go to school.  Her husband is a skilled worker, and she sells shoes and cosmetics by catalog.  She also cooks when she has contracts to do so because her husband's wages do not cover all of their family's expenses since there are four of them and because of their lifestyle.  This is why she has to look for a way to make a bit more money to be able to get ahead.  Her business selling shoes and cosmetics doesn't take very much time away from her, and she can spend more time with her children.  This is why she is taking out a loan to buy cosmetics that are on sale.  She will increase her working capital in this way.  She is a very hard-working woman, always looking for an actiivity to which to dedicate herself.  She is very grateful to this institution for the support it has offered her.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and shoes

loans.name: Carmelitas Group

texts.en:
The Carmelitas communal bank is currently in their fourth loan cycle at FINCA Peru. They have 9 members: Pelaya, Paulina, Victoria, Rosila, Adbeel, Lucia, Vanessa, Frisia, and Erica. Their total loan amount is 4,350 nuevos soles for this cycle. The group members run a variety of businesses in Ayacucho, including sales of groceries and artisanal goods. 

Pelaya is the President of the Carmelitas communal bank. She is 41 years old, married, and has 6 school-aged children. She has been a member of FINCA and the bank for one year now. She will be using her loan of 300 nuevos soles to buy firewood to sell in Ayacucho. She enjoys the support that FINCA provides her as an entrepreneur and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy firewood to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy larger quantities of bulgur wheat, beans and cassava leaves to sell

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 37  años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus  hijos en una zona rural de Pasabar  La Granja ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, los cuales cría en un ambiente dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente Luis tiene su mototaxi con el cual es más fácil la comercialización de sus animales ademas ofrece servicio de transporte de Olmos a sus caseríos. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben de estas actividades se encargan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Luis desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Luis is 37 years old, is married, and lives with his wife and children in the rural zone of Pasabar La Granja. This is located in the district of Olmos, an agricultural area with substantial commercial activity in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Luis’ business is raising and selling farm animals. He raises them in a space in his house and then, when they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to the general public and to the dealers that often visit the area. 

In addition, Luis has a mototaxi that makes it easier to transport the animals. He also offers taxi service to Olmos for his community. With the income from both of these activities, he is able to support his family.

Luis would like to enlarge his business by buying more animals and balanced feed. This would lead to increased sales. For this reason, he is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 new soles.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa is 45 years old and lives with her three children in Ulaanbataar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in small wooden house on their plot of land. 

Tsetsegmaa is left to raise her three children after her husband passed away in 2008. Her older daughter, Davaadulam, works at the state emergency department and her younger two sons are attending a university. Tsetsegmaa has operated a retail business for the last three years, selling pants and renting a stall at the Bumbugur market, the most crowded market in the city. 

Normally she buys her products from Ereen, the border city of China. Tsetsegmaa is providing her two sons' tuition fees. Therefore, she is trying to save some money by increasing her business profit. She is also one of our reliable customers. This time she is applying for a loan for the second time and wants to use it to increase her working capital by buying more pants and jackets.

loans.use: to increase her working capital by buying more pants from Ereen, the border city of China

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 33 years old and married with eight children, six of whom go to school. She is currently in the charcoal-selling business. Alice is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. 

In the future, Alice hopes to use her extra profits to pay for her children’s school fees and build a concrete house.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn E. is from Prenza Tangub City. She is 45 years old.  Evelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children.  She owns & operates a business operating motor transport services.  Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor es una madre de familia de 20 años de edad, vive en casa de sus suegros, junto a su esposo y sus hijos, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, está ubicada en Callanca que forma parte del distrito de Monsefú y  a 20 minutos de Chiclayo.  Se caracteriza por ser una zona rural  agrícola, cuenta con restaurantes campestres y también se dedican a la artesanía.

Flor desde muy pequeña apredió la actividad de bordar, ya que forma parte de la cultura y costumbre de éstos pobladores, ésta labor la pone en práctica bordando manteles, sábanas, servilletas, etc., donde utiliza una infinidad de colores de hilos en su trabajo.  Los productos que borda son muy apreciados por los turistas, su trabajo demanda mucha dedicación y tiempo, pero por la calidad del producto,  lo puede ofertar a un buen precio para poder  mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Se ha visto Flor en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 400 nuevos soles para comprar  material (hilos detodos loscolores ) para seguir bordando los pedidos que tiene pendiente, para que su clientela esté satisfecha con su producto y la sigan recomendando por el buen trabajo que realiza.  Al tener mayor cantidad de pedidos, le va permitir tener más ingresos para pagar su crédito y como es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora Flor quiere que sus hijos tengan mejores oportunidades en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Flor is a 20 year old homemaker who lives with her in-laws, husband and children.  The house has running water and electricity and is located in Callanca in the district of Monsefú, 20 minutes from Chiclayo.  This is a rural farm area which has country-style restaurants and dedication to handicrafts.

Flor learned to embroider when she was very young since it is part of the culture and tradition of the local people.  She applies her skill to tablecloths, sheets, napkins, etc. and uses a wide array of colored thread in her work.  The products she embroiders are very popular among tourists and her work requires much dedication and time.  Because of the quality of her products she is able to command good prices so she can improve her family's quality of life.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 400 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy material (colored thread) to continue working on the orders she has pending.  She wants her customers to be satisfied with her products so they will recommend her based on the good job she does.  By inceasing order volume she will increase income to pay back the loan.  Since she is reponsible and hard-working, Flor wants her children to have the best possible opportunities in society.

loans.use: To buy ebmroidery supplies (colored thread).

loans.name: Maria Elia

texts.es: La Sra. María  es una persona muy responsable ella tiene un negocio de abarrotes en el  cual ella quiere invertir  para satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela, ella  esta casada con el Sr. Roberto los  cuales  juntos  atienden  su  negocio , ellos se preocupan  enormemente por el bienestar de su pequeño hijo que aun depende de ellos es  por  eso que  agradecen el apoyo   brindado para  la realización de  su proyecto   ya  que   gracias  a esto podrán  ofrecer  a  su   familia  una mejor  calidad  de   vida.
texts.en: Maria is a very responsible woman. She has a grocery store business in which she wants to invest to satisfy the needs of her clients. She is married with Roberto and together they manage their business. They are enormously attentive to the wellbeing of their young son who still depends on them. For this reason they are thankful for the support provided for the realization of their project. It is thanks to this that they will be able to offer their family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries and tinware to sell.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 28 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school. Rachel works with her husband. They have a bakery where they make bread. Rachel has been in this business for one year. Her business is going well. She is requesting a loan to buy more bread ingredients and stock them in order to make more bread and increase her profits. She plans to renovate  her house and pay fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread ingredients.

loans.name: Toufic

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married and has three children.

In 2008 Toufic opened a food market, selling cheese, candies, juices, soft drinks,  daily use items and diary products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting $1500 loan to buy two showcases, a freezer and to make shelves for his market. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To buy two showcases, a freezer and to make shelves for his market.

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira, 43, is the leader of this group. She is married and has three children, the youngest of whom is 15. Damira is an accountant and her husband is a security officer in the same company. The monthly income for the family is 6,000 soms. Damira’s husband is looking forward to starting to drive a cab in his free time from work. In order to do this, he has found a suitable automobile in good condition; however, the price isn’t affordable for the family. 

Damira was in despair, until her oldest son, who is employed in the banking sector, suggested that she learn about the project Kiva. With much excitement, Damira learnt about all the conditions of the loan and applied for the loan through Kiva’s field partner in Kyrgyzstan, Mol Bulak Finance. Damira has high hopes of financial assistance from lenders, because it would help her in a big way in the purchase of an automobile. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use as a taxi

loans.name: Parvin

texts.ru: Парвин жительница города Куляб. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж работает в аптеке. Сама Парвин более пяти лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке района, где продает мужскую, женскую и детскую одежду. Кредит берет для покупки детской одежды. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Parvin lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 41 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband works in a pharmacy.  Parvin has been trading in the market for more than five years.  She has a shop in the region's central market where she sells men's, women's, and children's clothes.  She is taking out a loan to buy children's clothes.  She wants to increase the variety of goods she offers.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, separated, is 63 years old. She is blessed with four children. Erlinda has been managing her rice field for almost 50 years. The farming business is her way of supporting her family. Her income from the business helped her raise her children well. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to acquire fertilizers, insecticides and seeds. She will also pay the labor fees spent for tilling, sowing, pulling and transplanting her rice crop. 

She hopes to further support her family without her husband's assistance. She strongly believed that through hard work and patience, she could give all her children a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and seeds.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 33 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA ESPERANZA, se encuentra ubicada recinto JESÚS DEL GRAN PODER, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl.

Juan carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol . Compra sus productos en Comercial Roca en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl, para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, urea, abonos orgánicos y semillas de maíz fréjol y arroz para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente  a toda la familia para poder suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y construir la casa para los hijos.


Le gusta hacer deporte y jugar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 33 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) meet in the neighborhood of “Jesús del Gran Poder” (Jesus of Great Power) in the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-term farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Juan Carlos is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. He buys his supplies at the Roca Commercial Center in Ventanas and sells his products at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Juan Carlos is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and pigeon peas. He plans to buy fertilizers, herbicides, urea, organic composts, and seeds (corn, beans, and rice) for producing his crops. With the financial assistance given to his entire family, he will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges he faces include pests and diseases that could impact his crops. His dream is to buy land and build a house for his children.

Juan Carlos enjoys sports and playing with his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, urea, organic composts, and seeds.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea, is a 31-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with her three children and her parent in Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Chea married, but she is divorced from her husband.

Mrs. Chea works in the massage shop as an internal staff and she can get around $4USD each day. She has a plan for running a small business as a clothes seller. Now Mrs. Chea has some money in her savings account but it is not sufficient to make her plan possible. Therefore, Mrs. Chea has applied for a $800 loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase different kinds of clothes for selling.

For her future expectation, Mrs. Chea wants to expand her clothes-selling business, to build a new room in her house and to support her children to attain the university degree.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of clothes for selling.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment for her tricycle transport business.

Josephine has been in this business for two years. Josephine earns more income from selling sand & gravel.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase tools & equipment for her tricycle

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Daisy has a retail shop that sells clothing & beauty products from Avon & Natasha. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stock from AVON & NATASHA for sale.
Daisy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Daisy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from AVON & NATASHA for sale

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is a rice farmer. She is the mother of two school-age children, who live with her. She has been farming with her husband for years, and this business is their sole source of income. 

They can make around $10 per day to support their family.  Chan has only a few plots of land for growing rice.  

By using Kiva’s loan, Chan wishes to buy additional farmland to gain more profits from their efforts.  Chan’s goal are to provide her children with better opportunities to join a university and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional farmland.

loans.name: Romer

texts.en:
Romer is 59 years old and lives in Lawa-an Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is married but has no children. 

Romer has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Romer has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Romer hopes to have a fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un señor de 61 años de edad, el cual vive con su esposa e hijos, en  la Fuente, en la provincia de Cartago. El principal sistema de drenaje de esta zona es el río Reventazón que nace en el Cerro Cuericí. Por la fertilidad de sus suelos volcánicos y aluviales, Cartago es el centro de población que tiene en la agricultura y ganadería sus principales fuentes económicas.

Desde hace varios años que Manuel tiene este negocio, ya que cuenta en estos momentos con un local, pero le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados.  

Actualmente Manuel está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢400.000 (cuatrocientos mil colones) para comprar unos cerdos y alimento. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio, ya que tiene en mente iniciar de esta manera, para luego aumentar su capital y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Manuel es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Delirio, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 61-year-old man living with his wife and children in La Fuente, Cartago Province.  The main drainage system for this zone is the Reventazón River whose source is Cuericí Hill.  Because of the fertility of its volcanic and alluvial soil, Cartago is a population center that has farming and animal husbandry as its main sources of income.

Manuel has had this business for several years.  He currently has the space but lacks the most important component so that his business can flourish and so that the neighbors in his community will be benefitted.

Manuel is asking for a ¢400.000 (four-hundred thousand colones) micro loan to buy pigs and feed.  He hopes to make his business grow this way because he plans to start out this way and then increase his capital to improve both his and his family’s quality of life.

Manuel is a member of “Comunal de Delirio” communal bank, one of EDESA’s 150 social organizations in Costa Rica.  This will be his first loan and he hopes with it to continue growing both personally and economically as well as to participate actively in his community’s credit organization.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Sreymao is a weaver, while her husband, Norng, is a construction worker. They have been married since 2000 and have four children - three sons and one daughter. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sreymao is asking for a loan of $1,200 to build a fence around her house. She will also use a part of the loan to continue her weaving business by buying weaving materials.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house and buy weaving materials for her business.

loans.name: Haitgul

texts.ru: Хаитгул жительница района Джиликул. Ей 24 года. Она не замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. Уже восемь лет как она занимается растениеводством. При доме у нее имеется участок земли, где она выращивает овощи и бахчевые культуры. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Haitgul lives in the Jilikul region. She is 24 years old and unmarried. She lives with her parents. For eight year she has been in the business of growing crops. At home she has a piece of land where she grows vegetables and gourds. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Sokhun

texts.en:
Sokhun is now a garment worker. She also weaves, when she is not at work, because weaving is a traditional professional business. Her husband is a security guard. They have been married since 2001 and have two children who are in school. The family is living on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokhun is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to get to work because her husband commutes to work by taking a bicycle. 

Photo: Sokhun is spinning.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to travel to work.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rosita has a food-shop or "carenderia" that sells special dishes like "adobo", "afritada" & "caldereta". She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making these special dishes.

Rosita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells Fante kenkey at Brase near Abura. She is a widow and has nine dependants. As a single parent, she feeds, clothes, and educates her children with the income she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize to prepare the kenkey [dumplings]. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children. When making kenky, the leaves in the put are used to rap the corn dough before boiling.

loans.use: buy bags of maize to prepare the kenkey [dumplings].

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбар жительница города Истаравшан. Возраст, 51 год. Замужем. Имеет троих детей. Она занимается торговлей фруктов. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа зимних фруктов.
texts.en: Sanavbar is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  She is 51 years old, married and has three children.  She is involved in selling fruits.  Sanavbar has been in this business for 15 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of winter fruits.

loans.use: to purchase winter fruits

loans.name: Mareidel

texts.en:
Mareidel is 32 years old and lives in Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is married with one school-aged child. 

To earn a living, Mareidel has a business selling of different kinds of viands (prepared dishes). She earns about 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Mareidel has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc.

Mareidel has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Mareidel would like to save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc.

loans.name: Miriam Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Sra. Miriam es originaria de Mexico, actualmente se encuentra separada del papa de sus hijos vive con su mama y comparten sus ingresos y gastos. La Sra. Miriam además de atender su negocio de tocos mexicanos, cuenta con un  trabaja en una maquiladora desde hace 8 meses y su mama la apoya con una pensión que recibe mensualmente. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de materia prima y acondicionar el puesto para dar una mejor apariencia y así puedan los clientes consumir sus alimentos mas cómodos. Espera contar con su cooperación y poder llevar a cabo su proyecto en su negocio y poder después ayudar a otras mujeres dándoles trabajo como cocinera en el puesto de comida.
texts.en:
Miriam was born in Mexico. She is separated from the father of her children and lives with her mother. They share their income and expenses. In addition to looking after her Mexican taco business, Miriam has been working in a manufacturing plant for 8 months and her mother supports her with her monthly income.  

She is requesting this loan to buy premium material and to install air conditioning in her business to give it a better appearance and so that her customers can eat their food more comfortably.  With lender support she hopes to carry out her business project and then be able to help other women by hiring them to cook in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy premium material and to install air conditioning in her taco business

loans.name: Amélé

texts.en:
Madam Amélé D. was born at Aného in the prefecture of Lacs in 1962, a daughter of a family of sixteen (16) persons. She didn’t succeed to continue her secondary studies after her Primary School Leaving Certificate (PSLC). Very early, she came to live with her aunt, the cereals trader in the market of Hanoukopé. Wanting to follow the way of her aunt, she started to sell tomatoes and peppers. Married for already 18 years, she is a mother of three (03) children. Her husband, taxi motor driver, succeeds rarely to provide for the family needs. Retailer for 27 years, Madam D. has benefited from three respective credits of $300, $650, $850 which she has well repaid without any delay. The credit of $1200 that Madam D. requests will serve to supply in rice -sacks in order to satisfy the customary in those periods of end years feasts and bring out a profit margin liable to contribute to the improvement of family life conditions.

Madame D. Amélé est née dans la préfecture des Lacs à Aného en 1962, fille d’une famille de seize (16) personnes. Elle n’a pas pu continuer ses études secondaires après son certificat du premier cycle. Très tôt, elle est venue habitée avec sa tante commerçante de céréales au marché de Hanoukopé. Voulant suivre le chemin tracé par sa tante, elle a commencé par vendre des tomates et piments. Mariée depuis déjà 18 ans, elle a trois (03) enfants. Son mari, conducteur de taxi moto, arrive rarement à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Revendeuse depuis 27 ans, Madame D. a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits respectifs de $300, $650 et $850 qu’elle avait d’ailleurs bien remboursé sans aucun retard. Le crédit de $1200 que Madame D. sollicite servira à s’approvisionner en sacs de riz afin de satisfaire la clientèle en ses fêtes de fin d’année et de dégager une marge bénéficiaire susceptible de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy whole rice-sacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret would like to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a blow dryer and a dryer

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed J. is forty-nine years of age and married with five children. J. runs a small store selling onions, tomato paste and cooking oil in Kabala in Sierra Leone. J. is requesting a second loan of $200 from SMT to increase his inventory so he will be able to earn more income from his little store. He wants to be able to provide more towards the education of his children and the up-keep on his house.

loans.use: Increase his inventory of food items sold in the market

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif I. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Jabrayil Region of Azerbaijan. He has been living in Dashburun village, which is in the Beylagan Region, since 1993.  He is married and has 6 children. His business is cattle-breeding. He has had 3 loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch. Now he needs $400 to buy a calf.

loans.use: To Buy a Calf

loans.name: Cristina's Group

texts.en:
Cristina, 47 years old, is a woman who is striving for a better life in spite of a very adverse situation.  Her husband died seven years ago, and since then, she has had to support her six children on her own.  Her children are undereducated like their mother.

To earn a living and work on her family´s issues, Cristina has been, in turn, cook, housewife and babysitter.  However, she thinks she would earn more if she could have her own business.  In conjunction with three other women of her village, Cristina plans to start selling clothes and shoes. They will purchase clothing in bulk in Dajabón and Elías Piña, two different border provinces with Haiti where garments can be bought at very low prices. They will get the shoes from Caribe Shoes, a multilevel company that wholesale sells shoes.

The other members of the group are Isabel Céspedes L., 21 years old with one daughter; Victoria Colasa A., 47 years old and a mother of nine children; and Natividad Sirita N., 37, and a mother of two children.

With the requested loan, it will be easier for these four women, headed by Cristina, to reach their goal and improve their families' living conditions. Each of the entrepreneurs will sell their portion of the purchased products within their respective houses.

loans.use: These four women will use the loan to wholesale purchase bulk clothing and shoes.  They will resell the products in their community, each one within her house.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria K. is a multi-talented multi-tasker! She is married to John Shumari and has two children, Yoeli, 7, and Wingrac, 3. In 2002 she established a business selling Christian literature and books. She now wants to expand this business by purchasing additional goods, as well as open a new business raising guinea fowl for sale. Christ and guineas? Books and fowl? It may not make sense, but I’m sure it will make money! For these business ventures, Victoria requires a loan of $525 and trusts she will find some Kiva lenders who appreciate her eclectic range of enterprises! 

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not creditworthy by financial institutions, as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases beck the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback.

loans.use: To purchase Christian books and guinea fowl!

loans.name: Sok Khom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Khom Hain, age 45, was married in 1998 and has three sons. She has been in the business of growing, purchasing, and reselling vegetables since 1997. She grows vegetables on her farmland in the village, purchases some vegetables from nearby villagers, and resells to wholesalers at Deum Kor market. Her husband, Mr. Visal Chab, is currently in the business of purchasing vegetables from farmers in Kampong Cham province and transporting those vegetables with his small truck to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. He also assists his wife in growing vegetables in the village. Their young children are studying, but they also help their parents when they are off from school.

Sok Khom is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time, in the amount of $800. She will use this money, added to money she has, to buy a small truck for her husband that will be better for transporting the vegetables.

loans.use: To help buy a small truck for her husband

loans.name: Suyono Kholip

texts.id:
Suyono Kholip makes coals out of coconut shells. Through this business, which he started 7 years ago, Suyono can earn profits around $150 a month. Although the profit is not much, Suyono continues to work hard to support his wife and their 5-year-old child.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Suyono Kholip adalah seorang pembuat arang dari batok kelapa. Usaha ini dia jalani sejak 7 tahun yang lalu dan lewat usaha ini Suyono bisa menghasilkan keuntungan sekitar 1.500.000/bulannya. Walaupun keuntungan yang didapat tidak seberapa namun Suyono tetap berusaha keras untuk menghidupi istri dan anaknya yang baru berusia 5 tahun.

loans.use: To buy raw materials (coconut shells)

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Unfortunately Paula became a widow and responsible for her son whom she always wishes to give the best. Due to lack of money Paula started to prepare food which she sold to her neighbors. Little by little her business grew and presently she has a stand at the markets and at her house.

Nevertheless, the market place does not have good facilities that allow for providing shadow. Therefore she is requesting a loan of $750 to be repaid in 6 months and with that money, Paula will buy a metal structure which she can set up on Sundays at a market place. With your support Paula will get ahead and be able to provide her son with a university degree.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Desafortunadamente Paula enviudó y se quedó a cargo de su hijo al cuál desea darle siempre lo mejor. Por la falta de dinero fue por lo que Paula comenzó a elaborar comidas para vender a sus vecinos. Poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio actualmente tiene un puesto en los mercados y en su casa.

Sin embargo en el mercado no cuenta con una buena instalación que le tape el sol. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Paula podrá comprar una estructura de metal para que pueda instalarse los domingos en un mercado. Con tu ayuda Paula podrá salir adelante y ayudar a que su hijo estudie una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Purchase a metal structure to improve a stall.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa is a single mother of a four year old son. She needed to increase her income without neglecting her child who was very small. She did not have a job that provided for childcare and could not pay a private party nor had anyone that could take care of him. That is when she started to sell lingerie on her own. She started in 2004. Her friend was doing the same and shared with her the information of the stores where she could purchase inventory in Guadalajara. She started her business selling to her neighbors. Thanks to this she has been able to cover the costs of her little one.

She now needs financial help of USD $575 which she will repay in six months, to update her inventory and purchase merchandise of the season. With your help Luisa will be able to give her son a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Ma Luisa es madre soltera de un niño de 4 años debido a esto necesitaba incrementar sus ingresos sin descuidar a su hijo quien estaba muy pequeño y no tenia trabajo que pudiera darle el beneficio de guardería ya que ella no podía pagar una privada y tampoco quien se lo cuidara, fue entonces que empezó a vender por su cuenta lencería inicio en el 2004 , una conocida vendía lo mismo, y le paso los datos de las tiendas en donde podía compra en Guadalajara, y empezó el negocio vendiendo a sus vecinas. Gracias a esto ha podido solventar los gastos de su pequeño.

Ahora requiere un apoyo económico por US $575 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 6 meses para renovar el inventario y comprar mercancía de temporada. Con tu contribución luisa podrá darle mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mona's Wapendanao Group

texts.en:
Mona is 38 years old, married, with four children, ages 22,19,13 and 7. She and her husband also take care of two other children, ages 19 and 4. Mona owns a small grocery store that she started in 2001. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more grocery items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Zainabu, who has a business in charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her businesss.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil was born in 1957. He is married and has one child. He has been in this business for 6 years. Now he needs a loan of $975 to buy clothes for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: José Noé

texts.es:
The immense longing to see his children have a promising future is reason enough to motivate José to work hard and to put forth his best effort. He is 58-years-old, and he leaves his house very early in the morning to carry out long hours of hard work with his indispensable companion, his car, with which he offers a taxi service. Thanks to his effort and dedication that he always puts into his work, he is able to offer an education to his young children with satisfaction. José how needs to repair his car because through the years and unstoppable daily route, his only work tool has mechanical failures that make it impossible for it to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Las inmensas ganas de ver a sus hijos con un futuro prometedor, son razones suficientes que motivan a esforzarse y poner lo mejor de sí a don José, hombre de 58 años, quien desde muy temprano de la mañana abandona su hogar para desempeñar horas de ardua labor con su indispensable compañero, su automóvil, con el que brinda el servicio de taxi. Gracias al esfuerzo, empeño y dedicación que siempre puso en su trabajo, viene brindándole con satisfacción los estudios respectivos a sus menores hijos. Don José ahora necesita refaccionar su auto, ya que por los años y el imparable recorrido diario, su única herramienta de trabajo, ha presentado fallas mecánicas que le imposibilita continuar.

loans.use: To repair his car to continue offering his taxi service.

loans.name: Harambee Group

texts.en:
For two years, Angela has owned and operated a shop in Arusha, where she sells clothes. She is 27 years old, married, and has one young child. She works daily from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm, which enables her to make a profit of approximately $60 each month. Angela is hoping to take out this loan so that she can purchase more clothing at bulk rates to sell from her store. By improving and expanding her business, she hopes to increase her profits.

Angela has previously taken out two loans from BRAC Tanzania, both of which she promptly and successfully paid back. She will be sharing the loan proceeds with her fellow group member, Eline, who owns and operates a shop of her own in Arusha.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Mame

texts.fr: Mame D. est une femme mariée, mère de 06 enfants. Elle souhaite renforcer son activité pour mieux subvenir aux charges familiales. Elle va faire un commerce de nététou (graine d’un arbre transformée en produit alimentaire local) et en même temps  acheter et vendre de la pate d’arachide. <b>Elle remboursera ce prêt en une seule échéance au bout de six mois<b/>.
texts.en:
Mame D. is a married woman and mother of six children. She wants to strengthen her business in order to better meet the family expenses. She is going to start a business in netetou (seeds from the Nere tree that are turned into a local food) and at the same time buy and sell peanut butter. She will repay this loan in a single installment after six months.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell netetou (seeds from the Nere tree that are turned into a local food)

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Sus aspiraciones desde muy joven, han estado en el arte textil, es por eso que Lina es una excelente costurera, cuenta con sus máquinas de coser, que le son de mucha utilidad para la realización de su trabajo diario, que es la confección de ropa, la cual vende a domicilio, la deja al contado  o al crédito, su labor es muy requerida por su buen acabado, incluso trabaja con varias instituciones educativas para la confección de uniformes para los niños del nivel inicial.Lina, a sus 40 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, a quienes les brinda todo lo necesario para sus estudios, hasta que decidan qué profesión desempeñarán, ella es madre soltera, sin embargo esto no trunca sus propósitos, ya que cuenta con el apoyo y amor de sus hijos.Su meta es alquilar un local y poner su taller de costura, para ello estima de una cantidad de dinero, la cual solicita en calidad de préstamo.
texts.en:
Lina’s aspirations from a young age have been in the textile arts which is why she is an excellent seamstress. She relies on her sewing machines which are highly useful in her daily work of making clothes. She sells this clothing door to door for cash or credit. Her work is highly sought after because it is well made. She also works with various educational institutions to make children’s uniforms. Lina, at forty years old, has three children. She provides them with everything necessary for their schooling. She is a single mother but this does not affect her goals because she counts with the support and love of her children. Her goal is to acquire a commercial space for her shop but this requires a sum of money which is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a commercial space for her shop.

loans.name: Rita Isela

texts.es:
Rita después de divorciarse hace 6 años, decidió emprender una actividad que le generara ingresos y con la que pudiera mantenerse, logro con mucho esfuerzo abrir su propio negocio de bisutería y plata, ella se dedica también ala venta de productos naturales y con estas actividades se mantiene. Ahora busca crecer y por eso solicita un préstamo para ayudarle a dar más presentación a su negocio.   

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $625 que pagara en 6  meses para remodelar su local y tener una mejor presentación para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rita, after divorcing six years ago, decided to undertake an activity that would generate income with which she could support herself. With a lot of hard work she managed to open her own business selling imitation jewelry and silver. She also sells natural products and with these activities she takes care of herself. Now she is looking to grow and for that reason is requesting a loan to help her improve the look of her business. She needs a loan for $625, which she will repay in six months, to remodel her locale and have a better presentation for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel a shop

loans.name: Naji

texts.en: Naji is a 49-year-old man, married with three children, living in Burj Al Barajneh, a suburban area of Beirut. He started his internet cafe in his neighborhood in 2005 after noticing a lack of such services in the area. His internet cafe is a safe haven for local children. As technology becomes obsolete very fast, Naji wants to borrow USD 1,200 in order to buy newer and more sophisticated computers.

loans.use: Buying computers for his internet cafe

loans.name: Duongchan

texts.en:
Duongchan S. is 55, married, and has five children. Three of his children are employed: one son is a hair cutter in Phnom Penh City, and two daughters are dealers in a casino. His wife, Soeum Tep, 44, helps him with his business. He and his family reside in Pursat Province.

Duongchan S. sells ice cream to his community from the back of his motorcycle. His best customers are young students in school. He earns approximately $5 per day. S. has applied for a loan to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one.

loans.use: Purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Silveria Maria

texts.es: SILVERIA TIENE SU NEGOCIO BIEN ESTABLECIDO Y CONOCIDO EN EL BARRIO, ESTO DEBIDO A QUE DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS ATRÁS ATIENDE POR ESTE LUGAR. ESTO LA ANIMÓ A AMPLIAR SUS SERVICIOS ATENDIENDO AHORA A PENSIONADOS. EN SU VENTA LE VA BIEN YA QUE ESTA FRENTE A UNA PLAZITA DONDE VENDEN AUTOS NO EXISTE MUCHA COMPETENCIA YA QUE ESTA EN PLENA ESQUINA DE UNA AVENIDA LA CASA Y NO EXISTE MUCHA TIENDA DE ESE TIPO SI NO MAS BIEN NEGOCIOS DE OTRO RUBRO, SILVERIA ESTABA ATENDIENDO PENSIONADOS POR LO QUE NO SE PUDO ENTRAR A SU CASA YA QUE SOLO ESTABA SU HIJO PEQUEÑO, SOLO TOMO LA FOTO POR FUERA. LA CLIENTE HA TENIDO BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO DE PAGOS EN TODOS SUS CREDITOS SIN NINGUN PROBLEMA.
texts.en:
Silveria has a known, well-established business in the neighborhood due to his longevity in this locale. This success has inspired him to expand his services now to retirees. His sales are going well as he is located in across a small plaza where they sell cars and there isn’t much competition as he is on the corner of the La Casa avenue. There aren’t many stores of this type but rather there are business catering to other areas. Silveria was taking care of retirees so we couldn’t enter his home as only his small son was there so the photo was taken outside. The client has a good payment history with all his previous loans no problems to report.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand his sales and sell to retirees

loans.name: Djafarou Djamila

texts.fr:
Cette dame habite le quartier de agoè atsanvé et a pour activité la vente de tissus et de chemises, elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2003, la demande a un peu augmenté ces temps ci et c’est pour y satisfaire qu’elle sollicite de wages son premier prêt d’un montant de 300000F pour se réapprovisionner avec des tissus et des pagnes, certaines personnes  de sa clientèle sont des couturières.
Elle est mariée et mère de un enfant.
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Agoè Atsanvé district and sells cloth and loose dresses. She has been in this business since 2003. Demand for her products has gone up a bit lately and it is to satisfy that demand that she has requested her first ever loan from WAGES in the amount of 300,000 F to stock up on cloth and lengths of African print fabric. Certain of her customers are seamstresses.

She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cloth and African print fabric

loans.name: Ashwak Group

texts.en:
This group's name is Aswak; it is made of seven ladies who are living in Aley Mount Lebanon.

Hana is a 45 year old married woman who has three children. Hana has been working as a private teacher for three years. She has requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase books and school supplies. This is the first time that Hana has requested a loan. Hana is special in her work because she is patient with children and knows how to make deals with them. Her students are children from her neighborhood. She decided on doing this business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income.

Joulia is a 54 year old woman. Joulia has been working as a seamstress for twenty years. She has requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread for her work. This is the first time that Joulia has requested a loan. Joulia is special in her work because she does it well and has done it since she was a child, and she is also known for her sewing and good work. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she had difficulty finding clients because she wasn’t known yet for her good and clean work. She decided on doing this work because she always wanted to work and she likes sewing. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

Najwa is a 37 year old married woman who has two children. Najwa has been working as a seamstress for five years. She has requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase thread and materials for her sewing. This is the first time that Najwa has requested a loan. Najwa is special in her work because has experience and is known of her good work and creativity. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When Najwa first started her business, she had difficulty building networking. She decided to do this work because she has done it since she was young. In the future, she plans on expanding her work.

Ihssan is a 51 year old married woman. Ihssan has owned a grocery store for three years. She has requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Ihssan has requested a loan. Ihssan is special in her work because she is known in her region and she knows how to please her clients, and she has competitive prices. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Ihssan decided to do this business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her store.

Mona is a 50 year old married woman who has three children. Mona has been producing natural food products for ten years in Lebanon. She sells grenadine, vine leaves and other natural products. She has requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials and special products for her production. This is the first time that Mona has requested a loan. Mona is special because she is good in her production. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Mona decided to do this business because she always liked making these items. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

Hindiyeh is a 38 year old married woman who has three children. Hindiyeh has been working as a private teacher for seven years. She has requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase school supplies. This is the first time that Hindiyeh has requested a loan. Hindiyeh is special in her work because she likes children and knows how to make lessons interesting and easier for her students. Her students are usually her neighbors and children of her friends. She decided to do this business because she always wanted to teach.

Widad is a 42 year old married woman who has a child. Widad has been working as a private teacher for ten years. She has requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase school supplies. This is the first time that Widad has requested a loan. Widad is special in her work because she knows how to teach children and make them like their lessons. Her students are usually from her neighborhood. Widad decided to do this business because she always wanted to teach. In the future, she plans on continuing her studies in order for her to become a teacher.

About Group Loans: In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: This loan will assist these women in building their businesses.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth K., 42, is married with eight children. Currently, five of them are in school. She lives with her husband and kids in Boanim, a suburb of Mampong in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works very hard because, as a mother who wants to see her kids get to the university level, the partial responsibility rests on her shoulders .

She sells home products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates. She makes her sales by hawking through door-to-door sales. Ruth is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to support her kids in school.

She wants to use the loan to buy plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers. She would be very grateful for that support. Ruth belongs to a village bank called "Naomi." She hope to receive GH¢800 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy plastic materials and kitchen sets

loans.name: Carmen Julia

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.
Carmen es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Carmen junto a su esposo tienen un taller mecánico para carros, además Carmen vende repuestos variados, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de alternadores y arrancadores.
Los sueños de Carmen son tener una tienda de repuestos y ampliar el taller mecánico.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the El Roble Communal Bank. Carmen is 35, married, and has three children. Carmen owns an auto service garage with her husband, and also sells various spare parts that she acquires throughout Lima. Carmen needs a loan of 1250 soles, which will be invested to buy alternators and starters. Carmen's dream is to have a spare parts store and to expand the garage.

Translated from Spanish by Deborah Delzell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy alternators and starters

loans.name: Palmira

texts.es:
