La señora Palmira, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Vencedoras de Villa Universitaria”, vive en el Jr. Elías Aguirre Nº 203, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 39 años y es madre 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 por iniciativa propia, emprendió su negocio de venta de menú (alimentos), ubicada en su misma casa.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, siendo sus principales clientes  los moradores de la comunidad, vecinos y amigos, con su carisma alegre y sonriente nos cuenta que sus ventas aumentaron y le esta yendo muy bien.
Con el préstamo de S/1.200.00 que cancelara a plazo de 06 meses, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  mesas, sillas, vasos y ollas, para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Nos cuenta que es ella quien toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, se siente una Mujer fuerte, capaz e independiente y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.
Palmira, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como Mujer y empresaria y ayudarle a cumplir sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Palmira is a member of the communal bank “Las Vencedoras de Villa Universitaria (The Victorious of Villa University)”, and lives in Jr. Elias Aguirre No. 23, District of Tarapoto, Region of San Martin. She is single, 39 years old, and the mother of one son who depends on her.

With her first loan of 300 PEN, with her own initiative, she launched a business selling a menu of food located in her house. Today, she continues the same business, her main customers being the residents of the community, neighbors and friends. With her happy charisma and smile she tells us that her sales are increasing and going very well.

This loan of 1200 PEN, which she will pay on a 6 month plan, she would like to invest in the purchase of ingredients for the daily preparation of her plates, ingredients such as sacks of rice and sugar, oils in packets, chickens, and also tables, chairs, glasses, and cups in order to set up her business and give better attention to her customers.

She tells us that she is the one who makes decisions on the income of her business, and that she feels like a strong woman, capable, independent, and responsible with the payment of her loan. Palmira wants to show her appreciation to Manuela Ramos for permitting her to grow as a woman and businesswoman, and for helping her to fulfill her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the preparation of her menu of food.  To purchase chairs and utensils for the kitchen.

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.ru: Муяссар кредитор Фонда с 2008 года.Она занимается продажей детской одеждой на рынке Костакоза.Ей 33 года , мать одного ребёнка. За товаром ездит сама в Истаравшан один раз в месяц.кредит берёт на расширение своего дела.По сезону она закупает товар для детей.Поэтому на сей раз хочет в кредит закупить ассортимент летней детской одежды.Муяссар благодарит за поддержку KIVA и желает ей процветания и удачи.
texts.en:
Muyassar has been a borrower at the fund since 2008. She is involved in sales of children’s clothing at a Kostakoz market. She is 33 years old and a mother of one child. She brings her goods herself from Istaravshan once per month. Muyassar wants to obtain this loan for business expansion. She buys children’s goods seasonally and now wants to purchase an assortment of summer clothing. Muyassar is grateful to Kiva for the support and wishes it luck and prosperity.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer goods assortment

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Mrs Elida P. is a 58-year-old widow with two daughters. One of her daughters is married while the other, who is 17 years old, currently lives at home. This daughter is in high school, and Mrs Elida pays for her education. Mrs Elida is a selfless person, who works selling fruits and vegetables from her cart. She goes to Abasto market herself to buy her merchandise and transports it back on the bus. She also has her own small convenience store in her house, which her daughter attends to when she goes out to sell her goods.

Mrs Elida would like to say thank you for the loans she has received from Kiva partner, Fundación Paraguaya. Her business is growing and so is her clientele.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria Y. is 37 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. She is a hard working woman. Victoria runs a provisions store. She sells groceries such as Milo, sugar, rice, candies, bread, etc. in a store on the street. She has been in business for three years now and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her business. She is hoping to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more provisions

loans.name: Mony

texts.en:
Mrs. Mony U., 51, and her husband, Mr. Doeun Pon, 54, live on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 1979 and have three children: one son who is a security guard and two daughters. Their daughters are married and live outside the family home.
  
Mony has been a silk weaver since she was 16 years old. She learned to weave silk from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who in turn sells them in the market in Phnom Penh. Mr. Doeun Pon is a farmer who grows different kinds of crops and vegetables in his village.

Mony doesn’t have enough capital to purchase silk materials to continue her business so she is asking for her first loan of $300 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza. 
Sonia es conviviente tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Sonia tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donde vende carne, Sonia viaja a las diferentes ferias y la ciudad de Lima a comprar animales, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos.
Los sueños de Sonia son comprar un carro para transportar los animales y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Nobleza community bank. She is 33 years old, partnered and the mother of 4 children. She has a stand in the F. Vivanco market where she sells meat. Sonia travels around to different market fairs and to Lima to buy animals, work that she does with her husband's help. She needs a loan for 1200 soles that she will use to buy pigs. Her hopes for the future are to buy a vehicle for transporting the animals and to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs for meat business.

loans.name: Rosa Adelina

texts.es: Doña Rosa Adelina de 56 años de edad, reside en el barrio la primavera en la capital de Managua, soltera y con hijo recapacitado, pues le ha tocado duro salir adelante, para poder cuidar a su hijo, opciono estudiar belleza y instalar su propio salón de belleza el cual lleva diez año administrándolo, lo inicio con ahorros y prestamos, sus planes es poder abrir una cuenta de ahorro para dejar a su hijo bien para que le falte nada, ya que con mucho amor le ha enseñado ha salir adelante. Con este préstamo va a comprar cosméticos y tratamientos de belleza para aprovechar la temporada que se acerca la navidad. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible crecer en su inventario y de muchos beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Adelina, 56 years old, lives in the neighborhood of La Primavera in the capital of Managua. She is single and has a disabled son, so it has been difficult for her to succeed. In order to care for her son, she decided to study cosmetology and start her own beauty salon, which she has spent ten years running. She started it with her savings and loans. Her plan is to open a savings account to leave her son, so that he won't lack for anything, since she has lovingly taught him how to succeed.

With this loan, she will buy cosmetics and beauty treatments to take advantage of the Christmas season. She gives thanks to the institution for making it possible for her to increase her inventory and benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Kamba

texts.fr:
Kamba B. est une célibataire, mère de deux enfants qui vit à Sanankoroba localité située à 20  kilomètres de Bamako (capitale du Mali) dans une famille traditionnelle élargie avec ses frères, soeurs et biens d’autres parents.
Pour des raisons sociales, elle abandonna les études au lycée (niveau enseignement secondaire dans le système éducatif Malien) pour entreprendre le petit commerce d’articles divers. 
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, elle fait recours au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant deux ans.  
Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel après avoir bien remboursé le premier.
Elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois à Bamako et compte avoir avec ce prêt 5 douzaines de flacon de parfum, 2 douzaines de draps de lits et une quantité suffisante d’articles divers pour femme qu’elle vend en ambulant et espère réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel de 60.000 FCFA.
Ce bénéfice servira à  subvenir à ses dépenses et rembourser les échéances du prêt.
texts.en:
Kamba B., a single mother of two children, lives in Sanankoroba, a town located 20km from Bamako (the capital of Mali). She lives in a traditional family along with her brothers, sisters and lots of other relatives.
For social reasons, she quit her high school studies (at the secondary schooling level of Mali’s education system) to run a small business selling a variety of items.
Looking to supplement her financial resources, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso’s credit program two years ago.
She is on her second individual loan after having repaid the first.
She stocks up once a month in Bamako and, with this loan, she plans to buy five dozen bottles of perfume, two dozen sets of sheets and a sufficient quantity of various women’s items, which she sells on foot. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 60,000 XOF.
These profits will help her to cover her expenses and make her loan repayments.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una alegre mujer D. 45 años, actualmente vive soL. en su casa propia. ElL. posee una bodega que implementó en su vivienda, donD. ofrece diferentes productos comestibles como: golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, arroz, azúcar, etc. y es por eso que su negocio es muy frecuentado. Además, cuenta con L. ventaja D. estar ubicada en un lugar por donD. transitan muchas personas. María está muy contenta porque su negocio crece poco a poco y piensa seguir invirtiendo en él.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos para abastecer su tienda y así obtener más clienteL..
texts.en:
María is a happy 45 year old woman. She currently lives alone in her own house. She has a store that she set up in her house. She sells different food products like sweets, soft drinks, crackers, rice, and sugar, etc. That is why her business is highly frequented. Also, she has the advantage of being located in a place where lots of people travel. María is very happy because her business is growing little by little. She plans to keep investing in it. With the money she is now asking for she will buy more products to stock her store and get more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: El Señor José Ángel V. tiene  39 años, su actividad económica es la venta de granos básicos. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este trabajo, con mucho esmero le dedica el tiempo correspondiente a su negocio, junto con su compañera de vida tienen 3 hijos de los cuales tiene que hacerse cargo. El comenzó este negocio de manera ambulante, porque no tenía los suficientes recursos, establecerse en solo local, por lo que todos los días fueron de arduo trabajo para la lograr alquilar un local, el recorría muchos lugares con un saco de frijoles o azúcar sobre sus espaldas, afortunadamente logro obtener el capital necesario. Ahora solicita un financiamiento para la compra de suficientes productos y abastecer a sus clientes. El deseo de José es tener su propio local.
texts.en:
José Ángel V., 39, sells basic grains. He has been doing this work for over four years. With great care he devotes time to his business. He and his life companion have three children they are raising. He started this business as a street vendor because he did not have enough resources to establish himself in only one place. Every day he worked arduously to be able to rent a place. He traveled to many places with a sack of beans or sugar on his back. Fortunately, he was able to get the necessary capital. Now he is asking for a loan to buy enough products and supply his customers. His wish is to have his own place.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ramy

texts.en: Ramy is a 32-year-old single man who lives with his parents. He has owned a café since 2002 in his town, where he services the neighboring villages. He is the one to support his family along with his old brother. Today, Ramy is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase additional equipment in order to expand his job.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 58 years old, and married to Leopoldo, who works as a farmer. They have four loving children namely; Rubelyn and Dolores who are both farmers, followed by Benedicto, a company truck driver, and Roland, also a farmer They are presently residing in the village of Del C., Cabatuan, Isabela province. Their house is located near their rice farm and at the back of it is their piggery.

Angelita has managed a livestock business (hog-raising) for almost ten years. Her net income is Php 4,000.00 a month. She would like to make a loan in the amount of Php 5,000.00 to use in the renovation of her pig pens, because of slight damage caused during to typhoons. She hopes and prays that KIVA will grant her the loan. She will also use the loan to purchase hog feed and young piglets to raise. Angelita wants to live a life that is full of happiness. Even though they sometimes have no money, she has earns to have a contentment.

loans.use: Hog feed and renovation of pig pens

loans.name: Ismadiyor

texts.en:
S. Ismadiyor lives in the town of Kanibadam in Tajikistan. He is 40, married and has three children. Ismadiyor is the only breadwinner for the family. He earns money by raising cattle and selling it on the local market. Ismadiyor sells the cattle to the local butcher shops. Currently Ismadiyor is thinking about increasing the size of his business because his current income is insufficient to provide for his family expenses. In order to be able to do that, he requires a loan of $1000 USD. Ismadiyor is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Ismadiyor’s business. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: http://www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Cindy Vanessa

texts.es:
La señora Cindy Vanessa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Victoria”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 24 años y 01 hijo, 01 que está bajo su responsabilidad.

Cindy Vanessa, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, ubicada en el Mercado “La Paradita” y lleva 05 años en el negocio, cuenta con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores de la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen, cuenta con muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 6:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en el cumplimiento de sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cindy Vanessa belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres de Victoria,” district of Tarapoto, province of San Martín, department of San Martín. She is single and is 24 years old with a son who is under her responsibility.

Cindy Vanessa decided to sell prepared food in the “La Paradita” market and has 5 years in the business and she has very well set up surroundings to tend to her customers. She tells us that she has a good daily income because of the delicious flavor that her food has. Most of her customers live in the city, or are passersby and she has steady clients that know her and she is very well accepted by her clients.

To this day she continues to have the same business and is very happy with the work that she carries on daily. She sells from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm and personally watches over her clients with the charm that typifies her.

With this loan of S/. 500.00, she will buy the products that she needs to prepare the food like: rice in kilograms, sugar, oil in gallons, potato sacks, live chickens, vegetables and some utensils to use in her business and to give her customers better treatment.

She has the motivation to get ahead as she has many dreams and goals in her life like having her own grocery store that would be well stoked. At the same time, she wishes to express her gratitude to Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Kiva’s field partner) who contributed to the start of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and other items.

loans.name: Oldemar

texts.es:
Oldemar C. S., tiene la edad de 29 años, es casado, y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar un vehiculo de trabajo para tener mas facilidad, estar más puntual en su trabajo y tener mejor establidad laboral. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y en el pasado, el no pudo obtener crédito por que hubo demasiado requisitos con otros bancos formales. El tiene el deseo a tener una mayor seguridad en el ingreso al hogar y de esta manera poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia y hacer que puedan estudiar y tener mejor condicion de vida. 
About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Oldemar C. Sanches is 29, married, and has two children, who are his top priority. He wants to buy a work vehicle to make things easier, be more punctual in his work, and have more job stability. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR; he couldn't get a loan in the past because he couldn't meet the requirements of the other formal banks. He wants his income to be more secure so he can satisfy his family's needs, and give them the chance to go to school and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a vehicle for work

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
El banco comunal Narancay Bajo esta formado por un grupo de socia(o)s que siempre han tendido como meta salir adelante ante cualquier obstáculo y brindar a sus familias lo mejor de si y un poco de comodidad de lo que no tuvieron en su vida, viven al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, es una ciudad que tiene muchos encantos tradiciones y festividades su gente es calida y amables todos los que visitan a Cuenca se van enamorados y siempre con la promesa de volver.

La Sra. Rosa S. es socia del Banco Comunal Narancay Bajo, vive en las afueras de la Ciudad de Cuenca, a unos 15 minutos al sur de la ciudad, en el sector del mismo nombre, tiene 32 años de edad, se encuentra casada, fruto de su unión conyugal han procreado 3 hijos que se encuentran de 11, 8, 2 años de edad, sus dos hijos estudian en la escuela Nicolás Sojos, su esposo es ayudante de albañilería, la casa en la que habitan es de su mamá, pero viven de manera independiente.

Rosa es costurera pero no ejerce su profesión por su hija pequeña, pero los días miércoles y sábados sale a vender frutas recorriendo la Feria Libre (mercado de Cuenca), de 9 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m. tiene una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras del bankito ya que viven por el mismo sector todos  los prestamos que le han entregado le a beneficiado para comprar la fruta y fue su mamá quien inició en el bankito incentivándole a que forme parte del mismo, con el nuevo préstamo que la fundación le hace entrega lo va a invertir en comprar más productos para su negocio como es frutilla, mangos y todo clase de frutas que se encuentra de temporada, su gran sueño es llegar a tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Narancay Bajo” is formed by a group of members who always have a goal of becoming successful despite encountering obstacles. They strive to provide their families with the best and any little bit of comfort that life has to offer. The members live south of Cuenca, a city known its charming traditions and festivities. The people are warm and friendly to all who visit the city. In return, everyone who visits Cuenca falls in love and always promises to return someday. Sra. Rosa S. is a member of the Communal Bank “Narancay Bajo”. She lives just outside of Cuenca, about 15 minutes to the south of the city in the district that is also named Cuenca. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children (ages 11, 8, and 2). Two of her children are students at the Nicolás Sojos School. Her husband works as a masonry assistant. Rosa and her family reside at her mother’s house, but they live independently. Rosa is a seamstress but has not engaged in this profession since she was a young girl. On Wednesdays and Saturdays, she sells fruit as a traveling vendor through “La Feria Libre” (the open-air market in Cuenca). Rosa works from 9am until 3pm. She has established great friendships with the other members of her Communal Bank, who are all in the same line of business and have used their loans to purchase fruit. Rosa’s mother is the founder of this Communal Bank and invited all the members to join. With her new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, Rosa plans to purchase more products for her business such as strawberries, mangos, and other seasonal fruits. Her greatest dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Nyaga

texts.en:
Nyga K. is a 47-year-old blacksmith from the coastal town of Mombasa, in western Kenya. He has been in the blacksmithing business for 23 years. He sells small handmade metal items such as dustpans, grills, garden forks, frying pans and basins. He is requesting a 20,000 KES loan for additional materials to make these small metal items to sell to both individual and wholesale customers. 

Nyaga currently employs two people in his business. His major challenges as an entrepreneur are the competition from other blacksmiths and the shortage of materials. 

Nyga is married and has eight children from the ages of 25 to 1 1/2 years old, and describes himself as hardworking and creative. In the next five years, Nyaga would like to grow his business to be the major supplier of the items he is now selling in the local markets.

loans.use: materials for blacksmithing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish wholesale

loans.name: Kuña Arandu Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Arandu, se conformó en fecha 23  de Junio del 2.009, mediante  la Sra Petrona J., quien se acerco a la oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para informarse del programa, y contacto con la asesora para la formación de un nuevo grupo y  logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ya en el 3º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
 
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.

La señora Gregoria Ruíz es una de las integrante y realiza una de los trabajos tradicionales de la zona de ITA el cual se refiere a todo lo relacionado a la artesanía como son los bordados en Ñanduti.
Es una de los trabajos mas admirados por los turistas en Paraguay y la Sra. Gregoria lo hace de manera continua y lo comercializa en muchos lugares, este trabajo ella lo hace conjuntamente con las labores de la casa, pero también cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, a pesar de ser una mujer muy sacrificada ella agradece por la profesión que tiene por que hasta ahora ha ayuda a su familia a salir adelante dignamente. El crédito fue utilizado para la compra de hilos para bordar, telas.

texts.en:
The women commitee Kuña Arandu was launched on 23rd June 2009, thanks to Ms. Petrona J., who went to the offices of Fundación Paraguaya to learn about the program, contacted a loan officer to form a new group and managed to unite 16 women who are very happy working, with a lot of hard work and dedication, already in their 3rd loan cycle, in a joint and co responsible manner in the program. They all work hard at raising funds, help each other reach the common goals they all share within the group and with Fundación Paraguaya. They take part in weekly meetings and show great solidarity in their work together. Ms. Gregoria R. is one of the members and she performs one of the traditional jobs of the ITA area, that is, crafts such as Ñandutí embroidery [a type of traditional embroidery in Paraguay, distinctive because it is embroidered following rays that depart from the center of the fabric. Ñandutí is the guaraní word for spider web]. It is one of the most admired crafts by tourists in Paraguay and Ms. Gregoria does it continuously and sells it in several places. She does this work as well as housework, but she has her children's help. Even though she is a very self-sacrificing woman, she is thankful for the work she has which helps her family progress in a dignified manner. She used the loan to buy embroidery threads and fabric. 1 Gregoria M. R. Ñandutí crafts and sales. 2 Gilda A. Crafts sales. 3 Claudia E. Crafts sales. 4 Petrona J. Food sales. 5 Blanca E. Crafts sales. 6 Marcelina A. Crafts sales. 7 Luz Marina Alarcón Crafts sales. 8 Rumilda E. Crafts sales. 9 Benicia E. Groceries sales. 10 Delia R. Ñandutí crafts sales. 11 Laura F. Crafts sales. 12 Nadia Z. Food sales. 13 Carolina M. Dressmaking. 14 Angelina E. Raising and selling pigs. 15 Georgia O. Food sales. 16 Noelia Rodriguez Haberdasher's store.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de telas, hilos de colores.

loans.name: Farid Faizi Group

texts.en:
Farid Jan, the leader of Farid Faizi Group is 29 years old. He is married and is the father of four children. He lives with his own family.

Farid Jan is a very honest, hardworking and talented man. He is a taxi driver working in Kabul and has been working in the same area for more than seven years. During this time, he has not been able to buy new parts to repair his taxi.

Farid Jan applied for a loan to start working on his taxi. He is happy with this loan and would like to thank both Kiva and AFS and all lenders around the world who help workers and people who would like to be strong in their businesses. Finally, he wants to say that this process is a successful one in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Masheruka Siimuka Coffee Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
T. Evangelista, shown in the small picture, also appears in the group photo as the group leader. She is a 36-year-old widow who sells coffee in Kashunga trading center, Bushenyi district, to earn her daily subsistence.

Evangelista has been plying this trade for the last fifteen years and she credits her choice to sell dry coffee as her winning formula. In a month, she is able to make 25,000 Ugandan shillings, a figure which has not substantially consolidated her business.

Evangelista’s future plan is to plant her own coffee, whereupon she will be in a position to sell at a higher price. Longer term, she also hopes she will be able to educate all of her five children.

Evangelista needs a loan to be able to mulch her coffee plantations, since this improves the stock and general turnover.

loans.use: To mulch her coffee plantations for improved output

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more poultry feed.

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.en:
M. Ikrom is 24 years old. He is married and has two kids. This gentleman is a vegetable producer with more than six years of experience. Ikrom works all day on the land. He is involved in the whole production process, including post-harvest and selling. It is relevant to explain that the production of vegetables requires adequate fertilizer in order to generate the expected harvest. Nutrients and chemical fertilizers are needed throughout the process. 

Currently, Ikrom is having difficulties getting into the market with his product due to the fact that he doesn't have enough organic matter to incorporate into the soil. There isn’t enough fertilizer and the soils are poor in nutrients. It is for these reasons that his harvests aren’t going well. Ikrom lacks the capital to be able to correctly prepare the land and thereby achieve a successful harvest so that he can sell his vegetables in the different markets. He is hoping for your generosity and is very thankful to all of you.    
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Recardina Fernando

texts.pt:
Recardina Fernando R. nasceu no Distrito de Magude, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 35 anos de idade, divorciada mãe de 3 filhos de 15, 10 e 04 anos, os dois mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 7ą classe não continuou porque ficou muito tempo doente. Vive na casa cedida pelos familiares com os seus filhos e sustenta seus irmãos enviando algum valor para ajudar nas despesas de casa.
Saiu de Magude para Boane com os pais 1987, a procura de melhores condições de vida. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 16 anos, tendo iniciado depois da sua separação, tem um empregado que ajuda no seu negócio. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária (Barclays).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é seu 2° empréstimo no valor de 9.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas, barrotes, cimento, ferro, areia e outros) para continuar com a obra de construção da sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi de 9.000.00mt para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na conclusão da sua casa e oferecer melhor comodidade a seus filhos.
texts.en:
Recardina Fernando R. was born in the district of Magude, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is 35 years old, is divorced, and has 3 children who are 15, 10 and 4 years old. The two older children attend school. Recardina only studied through 7th grade, and didn't continue because of a long illness. She lives with her children in a house provided for her by family members and helps support her siblings by sending them money to help with household expenses. She left Magude for Boane with her parents in 1987, in search of better living conditions. She has had her own business for more than 16 years, having started after her separation, and has one employee who helps her with her work. She has a monthly income of around 6000 Meticales. She uses this money to cover household expenses and she is also able to save some in her bank account. Recardina has never taken out a loan with another bank. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through friends who also work with the institution. This is her 2nd loan, for the amount of 9000 Meticales. She plans to use this money to buy construction materials (metal plates, beams, cement, iron, sand and other items) in order to continue working on the construction of her home. Her earlier loan was for 9000 Meticales and was used for the same purpose. She promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future she would like to apply for more loans to finish her house and offer her children a more comfortable life.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (metal plates, beams, cement, iron, sand and other items)

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Juana, tiene 54 años la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos todos independientes; Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista de compra y venta de productos secos y  granos; La socia vende ( moraya (papa deshidratada), pallares, habas secas, maíz de diferentes variedad y tipos, lentejas y poroto. La socia lleva los productos a Urubamba y Cusco. Nuestra socia también se dedica a la artesanía desde hace unos meses atras y está aprendiendo este arte para que alterne sus actividades en un futuro cercano con la venta de estos tejidos. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos y llevarlos a vender.

Nuestra socia agradece a todos los inversionistas que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the Colquecancha community bank; she lives in the Raqchi community, Urubamba, Cusco. She is 54, married, and has 3 independent children. She does housework and retail; she buys and sells dry goods and grains. She sells moraya (dehydrated potatoes), butter beans, dried broad beans, lentils, green beans and different varieties and types of corn. She brings her products to Urubamba and Cusco. She also started doing handicrafts several months ago, and she is learning this art in order to sell them in the future. She is requesting this loan to buy dry goods to sell. Juana is grateful to all the investors who are making this dream possible, and promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dry goods to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria S. sells provisions at Takoradi.  Victoria has received a senior high education.  She is single and has a child. Victoria has been selling provisions for some time now. She is responsible for paying her rent and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to plow back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Ath

texts.en:
Mrs. Ath S., age 34, lives in Chheal Phlouh village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns three hectares of land to cultivate rice for living. Mrs. Ath S. is working hard on their farm but still does not earn enough income to support her family. 

In order to increase income so she can improve her family's standard of living, Mrs. Ath S. has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy rice to offer for sale and to buy two piglets for breeding. 

Mrs. Ath S. is a widow with two children who are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is 44 years of age and lives with her husband and two children in a city called Borewala in Pakistan. She sews clothes for her neighbors to earn an income. 

Her husband sells clothes. He has a clothes shop in the market. These days her husband is facing the problem of low quantity of stock and is unable to fulfill the requirements of his customers. Therefore, Khursheed is applying for a loan for the second time from Asasah to financially help her husband who will buy stock in bulk for selling. This will not only cut the cost of traveling but also help him to buy the clothes on discount as a result of bulk purchasing. Khursheed is hopeful that these steps will bring happiness to her family and that her family’s living standard will become better.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Bendecidas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Jaqueline is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Bendecidas 1 & 2 (Blessed Women). She lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to build a concrete foundation for her house. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to work for community progress.

Jaqueline is excited to be taking her 3rd loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over a year, starting with her first Esperanza loan. Her friend and neighbor, Mirina, invited her to be part of the group. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying wallets, perfumes for men and women and three pounds of chicken. She sells the chicken at home for her neighbors to prepare lunch. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to buy some things her children need.
 
This Esperanza associate joined us because she was invited by a neighbor to join a group to start doing the business activities she had in mind. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally, her group is located in L, the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy wallets, perfumes and three pounds of chicken

loans.name: Mall

texts.en:
Mrs. Mall U., age 40, sells chickens at a large market some considerable distance from her village. By selling at market, she is able to earn a good profit in order to help support her family. Her husband, Mr. Oll Eou (pictured here with his wife), is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice to sell for a living. He is also a construction worker. 

Mrs. Mall U.'s primary problem is that she must transport her chickens to market on an old, unreliable, and uncomfortable motorcycle. To solve this difficulty, Mrs. Mall U. is applying for a loan to buy a new motorcycle in order to replace her old one for the transportation of her chickens. 

She is the mother of four children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the others attend school as well as helping their parents in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle for transporting her chickens to market

loans.name: Liliana Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Liliana Guadalupe B. S.
Es dueña de una pulpería que tiene en la misma casa de habitación ubicada en el barrio Grenada en el centro de La Capital. 
El negocio tiene un año de existencia, ella vende variedad de productos enfocado a la dieta familiar como son; granos básicos, cereales, aceite, gaseosas, lácteos, entre otros.
Es casada, madre de una niña de 11 años, su esposo es profesor en la Universidad de Ingeniería (UNI). Es el primer crédito que trabaja con CEPRODEL, lo solicita para compra de mercadería.
texts.en:
Liliana Guadalupe B. S. is the owner of a small general store in her home, located in the Grenada neighborhood in the center of the country's capital city. The business has operated for a year. She sells a variety of products, focusing on family food needs such as basic grains, cereals, soft drinks, and dairy products, among others. She is married and the mother of an 11-year-old girl. Her husband is a professor at the University of Engineering (UNI). This is her first loan with CEPRODEL, and she is requesting it to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise such as basic grains, cooking oil, eggs, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima T. is married to Fidelo T., 52 years old. They have three children who are 15 to 24 years old. The family lives in Bungtod within Manlayag barangay, a part of Danao City, Cebu province in the central Visayas islands. Prima has four businesses: smoking fish, fish vending, food vending and pig fattening.

Prima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,600, thus lifting the family's standard of living.

This time Prima is borrowing 10,000 PHP which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future, let her children finish their education and improve her business. Prima is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Nubia De Los Santos

texts.es:
La Sra. S.,  realiza sus ventas en la parada de buses interlocales León-Managua, el crédito lo utilizó para compra de gaseosas variadas, jugos variados y cosa de horno.

Sra. S. está muy agradecida con ceprodel por que le ha ayudado a comprar variedad de productos y así realizado mayores ventas, obteniendo buenas ganancias lo que le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Saenz operates her business at the stop for the Leon-Managua intercity bus service.  She will use the loan to buy soft drinks, juices and homemade snacks.

Sra. Saenz is very grateful to CEPRODEL because they have helped her buy new products and increase her sales, help that has increased her earnings and allowed her to improve her house.

loans.use: Compra de gaseosas variadas, jugos y cosa de horno

loans.name: Enhbold

texts.en: Enhbold C., age 35, lives with his family in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic dwelling. His wife stays at home to watch their young children. Since 2007, Enhbold has been transporting loads using his own big truck between towns and has gained much experience. Now, he is planning to transport harvests from the countryside. Enhbold is a modest and hardworking man. He wishes to improve his truck. Therefore, he is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan.

loans.use: To improve his truck

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is 45 years old and married. Two of her children are adults and the other two are in school. She runs a shoe sales business in a busy market in Nairobi with a good flow of customers. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to increase her stock of shoes for sale. This loan is guaranteed by her group. She has been in this business for five years and hopes to own a plot of land in the future. Due to the loans she has been receiving from Faulu Kenya, Annah's stock has increased. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: to increase her stock of shoes

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El Señor Juan Carlos Beltrán O. es soltero y no tiene hijos, desde muy pequeño el trabajo para subsistir ya que sus padres fallecieron cuando él era muy joven, el es  padre y madre para 5 hermanos a los cuales ayuda y apoya en su educación, dos de ellos se dedican de ayudantes de albañil para así poder ayudar a su hermano mayor, y dia a dia ellos van con las mejores intenciones para poder sobrevivir en esta vida tan dura, el cliente hace como unos 3 años que trabaja para tener un futuro muy prospero, él trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato “CARRASCO” en la localidad de Puerto Ivirgarzama, en el cual esta hace mas de 3 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y mejorar el servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos Beltrán O. is single and has no children.  From a very young age he has worked to survive because his parents died while he was still very young.  He has been both mother and father to 5 siblings that he helps with their schooling costs.  Two of them work as bricklayer assistants to help their older brother and every day they have the best intention to survive in this tough life.

The client has worked for about three years to have a more prosperous future as a mototaxi driver; he works in the “CARRASCO” syndicate in Puerto Ivirgarzama in which he’s been an active member for over three years.  The service he provides is profitable due to the large number of people that request the service because of its ease, speed and efficiency.  The syndicate has stops and routes available for each affiliated member in various locations in Ivirgarzama where people come by to request said service.

This is the first time that the client obtains a loan from our institution.  It will be used to buy a new motorcycle because the one he has now has completed its useful cycle and he wants to improve customer service in order to improve his income and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Avelina; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de maíz, verdura y leña, la socia tiene un pequeño terreno de cultivo donde siembra diferentes verduras como tomate, zapallo y maíz, la socia vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Urubamba, la socia quiere mejorar las tierras de cultivo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Avelina is a member of the communal bank "VIRGEN NATIVIDAD"; the bank is located in the district of Urubamba which is part of the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco. Avelina is 41 years old; she lives with her partner and has four children. Avelina divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling corn, vegetables, and firewood. She has a small plot of land where she plants different vegetables such as tomato, pumpkin, and corn; she sells her produce in different town fairs that take place in the district of Urubamba. Avelina would like to improve her farmland, and she is asking for a loan in order to be able to buy corn wholesale. She is happy about the loan and is committed to timely repayment.

loans.use: To purchase corn wholesale

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
Este comité esta conformado de 17 señoras dispuestas a progresar  decidierón a participar del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras,  mujeres humildes y muy trabajadoras, formando asi un equipo de trabajo donde la responsabilidad es solidaria. 
Una de la integrantes es la señora Ada quien se dedica a  la venta de perfumes sobre pedido.
Ella cuenta con catalógos para ofrecer sus productos de diferentes marcas a sus clientes.
 Ella es una señora muy trabajadora que sale todas las tardes de su casa para ofrecer sus perfumes y asi reunir los pedidos.
Ella solicita el prestamo para la compra de perfumes de los que ya recibio pedidos.
texts.en:
This committee is made up of 17 women determined to progress, they decided to partipate in the "Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Enterprising Women's Committee),  modest women and very hardworking, so forming a work team where the responsibility is solidarity. 
One of the members is Ada who sells perfumes on order.
She has catalogues to offer her products from different brands to her customers.
 She is a very hard working woman who goes out every afternoon from her home to offer her perfumes and collect her orders.
She is asking for the loan to buy the perfumes for the orders she has received.

loans.use: To buy perfumes of different fragrances.

loans.name: Inomjon

texts.en:
In the previous year’s growing season, Inomjon A. was diligent in his fertilizer- and pesticide-selling venture. In that season, Inomjon acquired adequate income and that income was used to improve his home and to save for the children’s education expenses. 

Because he spent the season diligently selling fertilizer, his own land is unprepared for planting. Currently, it is the rainy season, the  appropriate and suitable time for planting. Inomjon has taken the initiative to resume working on his land while selling fertilizer. He requires funds to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. Inomjon is optimistic that his venture will be successful and all his efforts will improve the family’s welfare.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor A. M. habita en el Municipio de San Marcos, del Departamento de Carazo, pero labora en la empresa ENACAL en Masaya desde hace nueve años como Lector, una labor que arduamente la realiza en el día a día, es acompañado tiene tres personas a su cargo.

Sus intereses que tiene es de proporcionarle lo mejor a su familia, pero para lograr eso este señor quiere cancelar unas pequeñas deudas que posee, por eso el está visitando las oficinas de CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito y con esto lograr cancelar unos pequeños gastos personales que había realizado.

Cabe mencionar que este señor considera que saliendo de estas pequeñas deudas podrá sentirme libre para poder invertir más en su familiar y en el bienestar de los mismos.
texts.en:
Sr. A. M. lives in the town of San Marcos in the Department of Carazo, but he works in Masaya for the company ENACAL where he has been employed nine years as a meter reader. He works hard at his job day after day. José lives with three people who are under his care.

His interests include providing the best for his family, but in order to accomplish this he wants to pay off a few small debts that he accumulated. For this reason, José decided to visit the offices of CEPRODEL to request a loan so that he could pay off these personal debts.

It should be mentioned that Sr. José says the repayment of these debts will give him the freedom to invest more in his family and their welfare.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Zulma Iraday

texts.es:
Zulma es socia del Banco Comunal “Inka Wasi” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 03 hijos, la señora estudio educación superior. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de lentes de contacto.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, comprará diez docenas de lentes. Trabaja sola en una tienda y su esposo también vende lentes en  otro puesto.
Su sueño es poner una cadena de ópticas que le permita generar más ingresos.	
Le que gusta de Manuela Ramos es la facilidad en que le brindan los préstamos.
texts.en:
Zulma is a member of the “Inka Wasi” communal bank located in Puno district, Puno province, Puno department.  She is 35 years old, married and has three children; she finished higher education.

She has been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for five years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her contact lens business.

She will use this new 700 new sol loan to buy ten dozen lenses.  She works alone in a store and her husband also sells glasses in a different stall.

Her dream is to set up a chain of optician shops that will allow her to earn more income.

What she likes about Manuela Ramos is the ease with which they grant loans.

loans.use: To buy ten dozen contact lenses.

loans.name: 'nee & Nah' Group

texts.en:
Neetu D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of two borrowers, called 'Nee & N.'. She is 33 years old, married and has four children who are between the ages of 9-months to 9 years. She is a sophomore college student. 

For 7 years, she has been selling dishes (breakable and unbreakable bowls) in Duala Market, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 15,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar loan to buy more dishes and bowls to resell. 
She describes herself as a jovial woman whose dreams are to grow her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more dishes (breakable and unbreakable bowls) to resell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 23 años de edad, y vive con su familia en un caserío del distrito de Tambogrande ubicado en el departamento de Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Maribel  se dedica a la venta de comida y elaboración de chicha de jora a base de harina de maíz. Tiene una antigüedad de más de 5 años en su negocio ubicado en su casa, y por el trato tan amable que brinda cuenta a la fecha con una clientela fidelizada.  Ella quiere mejorar los ambientes donde ella vende la comida y la chicha, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Maribel is 23 years old and she lives with her family in a community in the district of Tambogrande, located in the department of Piura. It is 4 hours from Chiclayo, capital city of the department of Lambayeque. 

Maribel sells prepared foods and she makes the traditional drink called chicha de jora, made from corn flour. She has had 5 years in the business and her business is located in her house.  And for the excellent customer service she has a loyal client base. She wants to improve the space where she sells her foods and chicha drinks. For this reason she has requested a loan of 1000 from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to improve the space where she sells her foods and drinks.

loans.name: Yelen Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Yelen, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tomba, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les femmes du groupe Yelen sont à leur premier prêt solidaire et font le commerce de condiments, du bétail et du savon.                                                                                                                               TAYE F. compte acheter des condiments avec les revendeurs au niveau de Dioïla. Elle effectue ses ventes au village au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Yelen group are all married and average 40 years of age and three children. They all live in extended traditional families in Tomba, a village in Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got acquainted through bonds of kinship, neighborhood and friendship. The women of the Yelen group are seeking their first group loan and trade in food condiments, livestock, and soap.

TAYE F. intends to buy food condiments from resellers in Dioïla. She sells in the village, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 15'000 (ca US$ 30), to be used to repay the loan and pay her contributions to social ceremonies, while the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy food condiments

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena se dedica  a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y el crédito lo necesita para  aumentar la mercadería al por mayor, como ser arroz, azúcar, fideos, cereales etc., para mejorar su margen de ganancia y así podrá equipar su tienda con mas productos. Vive  en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Urb. Mercurio de la ciudad de El Alto, es casada  tiene tres  hijos.
texts.en:
María Elena sells basic need items and needs the loan to buy more stock items at wholesale like: rice, sugar, noodles, cereals, etc. to improve her profit margin and stock her store with more products.

She lives in her own house located in El Alto’s Urbanización Mercurio zone.  She’s married and has three children.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Seang D., 48, is a busy woman who attempts to earn money from many ventures. She cultivates rice as well as buying it in bulk from other farmers to store in her home. She buys when rice is commanding the lowest price and then sells it to gain income. Besides those sectors, she also provides a rice hulling service inside her home to her neighbors. She is a widowed mother who has five children. Four of her children are single, while the other one is married and lives separately. Two children are employed in a garment factory as workers. 

Unfortunately, the hulling machine has often broken down while providing service. Because of this problem, Seang D. would like a loan to repair her hulling machine and buy rice to stock up for future sales.

loans.use: to repair her hulling machine and buy rice to stock up for future sales.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Carmelita works hard to support her family. She has a recycling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of scrap for her recycling business.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more recyclable materials.

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es:
Ana Luz es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas de Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos.  La señora estudio hasta 4to de educación primaria.
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados vacunos, ovinos y a la chacra (cosecha de papa, quinua, habas, cebada) luego los vende en la localidad de Ilave, también cuenta que su esposo es músico y viaja a diferentes lugares,  pero la ayuda en su tiempo libre.
Está trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde  hace un ciclo,  su préstamo anterior fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio para comprar ganados.
En la actualidad solicitara un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que incrementará al capital  de su negocio para luego comprar una vaca lechera.
Su sueño es crecer y tener ganados mejorados.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Ana Luz is a member of the “Hermanas de Choquetanca II” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 42 years old, married, and has five children.  She studied up to the fourth year of elementary school.

Ana Luz buys and sells cows and sheep.  She also grows potatoes, quinoa, beans and barley which she then sells in the town of Ilave.  She tells us that her husband is a musician and travels to different places but he helps her in his spare time.

Ana Luz has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one loan cycle.  Her previous loan was for 500 Peruvian soles.  That money increased her business capital for buying cattle.

Ana Luz is currently requesting a new loan for 1,000 soles which will increase her business capital so that she can buy a dairy cow.  Her dream is to grow in her business and make better profits.  What she likes about her community bank is the ease of the loans.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Merlinda has a shop that sells t-shirts, blouses & beauty products. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stock from NATASHA, MSE & AVON.

Merlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Merlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA, MSE & AVON

loans.name: Loic

texts.en: Loic is a business men .she have 3 children on of the 2 are school goer.Her husband is a driver and part time look after her wife's business.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with five children; three of her children attend school while two are still too young. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past four years, Kwekwe has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of the increase in prices of goods at the market when there is food shortage. Kwekwe dreams of expanding and establishing another business in the future.
With the loan of 5,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase sweet potatoes and open a retail shop business. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweet potatoes, and open a retail shop business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex, age 30 and unmarried, is a farmer in his home area of Muranga, central Kenya, producing horticultural products, milk, and coffee.

He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase a motorcycle, which will help him venture into the transport business. He says this will improve his income due to cheaper delivery of his own produce to the market, unlike when transportation is offered by other parties.

Alex says fluctuation in prices remains a challenge to local farmers, and general knowledge in farming remains a challenge.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for better delivery of his produce

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 26 years old and is married with one child who is three years old. She earns a living by selling goods such as lotions, soap, sugar, salt and so on. This is her second successful year in this business. Her business is well organized. She operates her business from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except on Saturday. She employs one person to help her. 

Florence has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more lotions, soap, sugar, salt and so on for resale. By adding more goods and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With this profit, she will save for her family, reinvest in her business, and renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell, such as lotions, soap, and sugar

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Alexandra de 44 años, es una mujer trabajadora que es vendedora de mariscos. Vende pescados y camarones a sus vecinos y conocidos. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 12h00 todos los días. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso desea mejorar su estilo de vida vendiendo mas mariscos. 

Tiene 6 hijos de los cuales tres sol mayores de edad y los otros estudian su esposo le ayuda con los gastos familiares ya que es maestro albañil. Tiene muchas aspiraciones en el futuro por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para su casa como zinc, cemento, etc.
texts.en:
Alexandra is 44 years old and works hard at her job as a seafood vendor. She sells fish and shrimp to her neighbors and acquaintances. Alexandra works from 7am to 12pm every day. She has many aspirations for her business, such as selling more seafood in order to improve her lifestyle.

Alexandra has six children, three of whom are adults while the rest are in school. Her husband helps with the family expenses through his job as a master stonemason. Alexandra has many aspirations for the future, so she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials for her home such as zinc, cement, and other items.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home such as zinc, cement, and other items.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira, D. 55 años es madre D. 3 hijos D. los cuales solo dos viven con ella junto a sus dos nietos, yernos y su pareja en una casa propia. Elvira tiene un trabajo muy lindo como ella lo considera, se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y bebidas en su pequeña pero muy surtida tienda que esta en su casa, lleva en este trabajo ya casi 25 años, llego desD. San Martín en busca D. un mejor futuro en esta tierra colorada, le fue bien hasta ahora ya que siempre trabajó en su bodega y como nos menciona gracias al trabajo D. su pareja y el esfuerzo D. ella pudo lograr construir su casa y darles un lugar digno en donD. vivir a sus hijos. Lo que mas le gusta D. su trabajo es que siempre hay movimiento, lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces se van algunas personas a querer sacar productos al crédito y demoran en cancelar. Ella espera más adelante poder hacer crecer su bodega, hasta ahora no lo ha hecho porque siempre ha utilizado las ganancias para hacer crecer su casa. Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene, sin emabrgo esta un poco desconforme con su grupo ya que algunos no pagan a tiempo, pero al final siempre terminan cancelando. Con el préstamo solicitado, comprará productos y bebidas para abastecer su tienda, espera poder continuar trabajando con la institución ya que agradece el monto dado por el bajo interés que dan.
texts.en:
Elvira, 55 years old, has three children. Only two of them still live with her, her two grandchildren, her in-laws and her husband in their own house.

Elvira thinks she has a very nice job. She sells groceries and drinks in her small but very well-stocked store, which is in her house. She has been in this job for almost 25 years. She came from San Martín looking for a better future in this red land, and it has gone well for her up to now since she has always worked in her store, and as she has mentioned to us, thanks to her husband's work and her own effort she has been able to build them a house and give them a decent place to live with their children.

What Elvira likes most about her work is that there is always some movement. What she does not like is that often some people come who want to buy products on credit and who are late in paying off their bill.

She hopes that later she will be able to expand her store. She has not done it yet because she has always used her earnings to expand her house.

This is Elvira's third loan with MFP. She is a little dissatisfied with her group because some of them do not pay on time. In the end they always end up paying, but sometimes they get behind. With the 1000 soles she asked for, Elvira will buy groceries and drinks so she can keep doing her work. She hopes to continue working with the institution since she is grateful for the amount they have lent her and for the low interest rates they offer.

loans.use: to buy groceries and drinks so she can keep doing her work.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 44 years old and married with six children, living in his own house in Masindi, Uganda. He dreams of educating all his children to higher levels of education. Moses operates a butcher shop and he has been in the business for three years. Moses started by working for someone and after accumulating enough savings from his wages, he started his own. Hardships in the business include delays in payment by some debtors and his dream is to set up a meat processing plant. Moses needs the loan to buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad, age 49, has an animal husbandry business. He has a small cow-house where he breeds calves. He has a secondary education, but because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. He and his wife have four children. 
 
Mahammad buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells them on the same market at a more profitable price. In this way, he provides the markets with meat and his own family with the necessary food for their subsistence. 

In order to buy three additional young cattle, Mahammad has decided to apply for a loan. He is very grateful to all those who can support him.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle

loans.name: Nasibahon's Group

texts.en: Nasibahon is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a driver, whose monthly salary is 3000 soms. Together with her husband, she has raised a son, who is 25 and works in construction. In 1994, Nasibahon purchased a piece of land, where she cultivates wheat and cotton. Selling some part of the harvest, she earns money for a livelihood. In this way she earns about 3,000 soms per month; this profit made it possible to repair the house and to purchase two cows for breeding. With money received from the loan, Nasibahon wants to purchase 200 kg of mineral fertilizers. In the near future, she plans to build a sauna. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.ru:
Олег работает на центральном рынке города Бердянска. Он занимается цветами и держит свой цветочный павильон в цветочном рядку на этом рынке. Олег женат, у него две взрослых дочери. У бизнеса Олега есть основное преимущество: он предлагает большой выбор цветов по минимальной цене по сравнению с конкурентами соседями по рынку. На данный момент оборотный капитал Олега составляет 25 000 гривен. 

Олегу необходим кредит в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить оптом живые цветы и комнатные растения на продажу, а также сопутствующие товары. Получение кредита благотворным образом отразится на бизнесе клиента, так как клиент, закупив цветы, сможет увеличить оборотные средства и таким образом сможет привлечь свободные денежные средства для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Oleg works on the central market of the city of Berdyansk. He is in the flower business and has own flower pavilion in the flower aisle on the market. Oleg is married and has two adult daughters. Oleg's business has a big advantage: he offers a large variety of flowers at a minimal price in comparison with the competing neighbors on the market. At this time Oleg's working capital is 25,000 hryvna.

Oleg needs a loan in the amount of 15,000 hryvna to buy live flowers and house plants in wholesale for resale as well as related merchandise. This loan will make a positive impact on his business because by purchasing the flowers he will be able to increase the working capital and this way free up some cash for further growth of his business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh flowers and house plants in wholesale for resale, as well as related goods.

loans.name: Moses Nyerere

texts.en: Moses is a single man. He describes himself to be quiet, humble, and persuasive.
